loans.name: God's Way Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is fifty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to a son. She is a trader and sells provisions on a table in her house.

Elizabeth is the leader of a trust bank group called “God’s Way”. She is seated first on the right. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors and or farmers and they work to support their spouses to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Vũ Thị

texts.en:
M. Vũ Thị (535050989) is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has two adult children.

M. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 4,300,000 VND a month.

In 2005, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

M. is now requesting a new loan of 16,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 6th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Dương Thị

texts.en:
X. Dương Thị (537981034) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has three school-aged children. 

X. owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month.

In 2005, X. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

X. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 11th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Đào Thị

texts.en:
D. Dào Thị (536981004) is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has three school-aged children.

D. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately 4,200,000 VND a month.

In 1998, D. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

D. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 11th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Growing corn

loans.name: Maria Apolonia

texts.es: María Apolonia B. Ríos tiene 62 años. Es madre soltera. Su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos. María se levanta muy temprano para conseguir la leche, ya que tiene un lugar que se la proporciona a un precio accesible así ofrecerlas a sus clientes. Por lo que ella vende sus productos en el mercado, María es una mujer con muchos problemas económicos, pero gracias a los sacrificios que ha realizado ha logrado salir adelante. El destino de su financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de sus productos como leche, cuajada, queso, crema. Su mayor deseo es extender su negocio para que el día de mañana sus hijos logre salir adelante.
texts.en:
María Apolonia B. Ríos is 62 years old. She is a single mother. She runs a business in the sale of dairy products. Maria gets up very early to acquire milk, given that she has a place that offers her milk at an affordable price, which allows her to offer it at a good price to her clients. Even though she sells her products in the market, Maria has many financial problems, however, thanks to the sacrifices that she has made she has been able to get ahead in life. The loan will be used as work capital to purchase products, such as milk, cheese curds, cheese, and cream. Her biggest wish is expand her business so that her children can someday succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase milk, cheese curds, cheese, and cream).

loans.name: Adele

texts.fr: adele B. est vendeuse de petit dejeuner devant chez elle situee a proximite d'une ecole qui est tres frequentee surtout pendant les heures de recreation.adele demande un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs en vue de repondre aux exigences de la clientele ce qui lui permettra de hausser sa marge beneficiaire et de mieux assister sa famille.
texts.en:
Adele B. sells breakfast in front of her home, which is located close to a school that is very busy during recess and other recreation periods. Adele is asking for a credit of 150,000 Francs in order to respond to the demands of her clientele. This will enable her to increase her profit margins and better help her family.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Small restaurant

loans.name: Vũ Thị

texts.en:
K. Vũ Thị (443001441) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has two school-aged children.

K. owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month.

In 2000, K. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield.

K. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 9th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị thirty-three years old and lives in the town of Kim Động.  She is married and has two school-age children.  To make a living, T. owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately $173 a month from these activities.

In 2000, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid previous loans from TYM Fund.  These loans were used to purchase additional products to sell.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This will be her tenth loan from TYM Fund.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Ohene Yesu Group

texts.en:
Mary is fifty-six years old and divorced with three children. She is a food vendor preparing and selling beverages in the mornings in her community. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ohene Yesu’, which means King Jesus. Mary is seated in the middle of the group photograph.

The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities, and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Vũ Thị

texts.en:
H. Vũ Thị (426990794) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has three school-aged children. H. operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling liquor such as beer and wine in the local community. H. has been engaged in this business for more than two years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2000, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. H. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the fifth taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
A. Lê Thị (440971365) is a 47-year-old womA. living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, A. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from cultivating fruit trees and harvesting the fruit for sale. A. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1997, A. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. A. successfully repaid a previous loA. from TYM Fund, which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. A. is now requesting a new loA. of 20000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loA. will be the eighth loA. taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. A. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: El Señor José M. N. tiene 44 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que su mayor interés es como padre responsable dedicarse a ofrecer los productos como queso, cuajada y crema. El inicio este negocio, porque no tenía  un lugar estable donde ofrecer sus productos, y decide recorrer algunas calles, esto no fue tan fácil para José por que todos los días, camina bajo el sol pero esto no le impide llevar una sonrisa y mostrar esa amabilidad con sus clientes. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su mayor deseo es ser el propietario de una distribuidora.
texts.en:
José M. N. is 44 years old. He is a married man. He has 3 children under his care. His business is in the sale of dairy products; he has run this business for over 6 years, and his biggest interest as a responsible father is to have this business in which he dedicates himself to offering products such as cheese, cheese curds, and cream. He began this business because he did not have a stable place in which to offer his products so he had to sell them on the street; this was not easy for José who had to spend everyday walking under the sun, nevertheless, this didn’t stop him from having a smile on his face, and also showing his clients kindness. The loan will be used as work capital to purchase basic materials. His biggest wish is to be the owner of a distribution center.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase basic materials).

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Hoàng

texts.en:
A. Nguyễn Thị HoÀng A. (401040006) is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, A. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling liquor, such as beer and wine, in the local community. A. has been engaged in this business for over 9 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, A. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. A. successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. A. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. A. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

To making a living, H. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling religious items. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling flowers and other votive offerings to tourists and local community members. loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena F. tiene 56 años de edad. Mario dio inicio a esta actividad con unos pocos ingresos que tenia de su trabajo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. A María le gusta que sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos con sus productos. Por lo que ella tiene que viajar a otros departamentos en busca de precios muchos más accesibles. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, cosméticos y prendas. El sueño de María es establecer el negocio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Elena F. is 56 years old. María started her business with the small funds that she had from her work. Her business is in the sale of general merchandise; she has run this business for over 7 years. María likes for her clients to be satisfied with their products. For this reason she has to travel to other departments in search of much more affordable prices. The loan that she is requesting will be used as work capital to purchase clothing, cosmetics, and other garments. María’s dream is to establish a business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase clothing, cosmetics, and other garments).

loans.name: Agyenkwa 1 Group

texts.en:
Joyce A. is twenty–nine years old. She is married and has given birth to one son, who is currently in primary school. Joyce is a trader who trades in textile materials. She hawks to sell in her community.

Joyce is the leader of a trust bank group called Agyenkwa, which literally means Saviour. She is first from the left in the photo. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors and or farmers. They work to support their spouses in providing for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and nearby communities and sell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting for a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy additional stock

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling home furniture to tourists and local community members. N. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 (about $141 USD) Vietnamese dong a month from these activities.

In 2004, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha García tiene 60 años de edad. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de almuerzos y desayunos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Martha  es una mujer que tuvo que atravesar muchas dificultades. Su mayor desafío es encontrar nuevos clientes, para ofrecer la variedad de productos a sus clientes. El destino de su financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite y gaseosas. El sueño de Martha es obtener un cafetín de su propiedad.
texts.en:
Martha García is 60 years old. She is a married woman. She has 1 child under her care. Her business is in the sale of breakfast and lunch. She has dedicated herself to this business for over 5 years. Martha has had to face many difficulties. Her biggest challenge is finding new clients, to whom she wants to be able to offer a variety of products. The loan will be used as work capital to purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, and soft drinks. Matha’s dream is to own her own café.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Qork capital (to purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, and soft drinks).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking and sale of corn

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married and mother of three children. All her children are in school in the community where she lives. She trades in baking materials like flour, vegetables oil, sugar etc. She has rented a store in which she trades her goods. Through her customer care and dedication she has attracted lots of customers who buy from her instead of going to town. She takes delivery of goods from Kumasi in bulk and sells them at retail. She requests the loan to buy margarine, flour, sugar, etc. in bulk. She wants to use the profit to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy food staples in bulk for resale

loans.name: Kusi Killa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Kusi KilL. que significa Luna Alegre en quechua,  inicia su cuarto ciclo con 19 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. frutas, mercería, comidas, animales menores, panes, prendas D. vestir, artesanía, abarrotes en general, golosinas, tubérculos.

Como es el caso D. Toribia es viuda, tiene 54 años y 2 hijos, Toribia venD. frutas y golosinas D. manera ambulatoria en el centro D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días.

Mientras que Zenaida, que es soltera, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Zenaida venD. cebiche (plato preparado con pescado) actividad que realiza D. manera ambulatoria con L. ayuda D. sus hijos, además los días sábados y domingos lava ropa ajena. 

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles, haciendo un total D. 9,450 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. mesas, sillas, golosinas, frutas, ropa, arroz, azúcar, leche, animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, comprar un terreno y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Kusi KilL. Communal Bank which means Happy Moon in Quechua , begins its fourth cycle with 19 members. The members have different businesses such as selling fruit, haberdashery, foods, small animals, bread, clothing, crafts, general groceries, candy and root vegetables. As is the case with Toribía, a 54 year old widow who has 2 children. Toribia sells fruit and sweets every day as a walking saleswoman at Ayacucho's city center. While Zenaida, who is a 39 year old single mother of 5 children. Zenaida is a walking saleswoman who sells cebiche (a typical food maD. with fish) with the help of her children. She also has a business washing clothes on Saturday and Sunday. The members need different loan amounts such as 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles, totaling the amount of 9.450 soles in community bank loans. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of tables, chairs, candy, fruit, clothes, rice, sugar, milk and small animals. The dreams of the members are expanding their businesses, their children completing their studies, buying land and owning their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing of tables, chairs, candy, fruit, clothes, rice, sugar, milk and small animals.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 30 years old, single, and a mother with one child who is in school. Alice is very humble and committed to her work. She sells smoked cow meat in bulk at the community market where she lives. She has been getting cow meat from the northern region of Ghana for five years now.

Sometimes she spends weeks in the northern region so that she can buy more meat to supply to her customers. This, she said, prevents her from frequent traveling to buy only a little at a time. She requests the loan to buy more smoked meat to upgrade her inventory.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of smoked meat

loans.name: Sáu

texts.en:
Sáu N. Thị (1112060366) is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Sáu owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food products in the local community. Sáu has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, Sáu joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sáu has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sáu is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. loans.use: Used to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gissel Del Carmen

texts.es: Gissel del Carmen S. Martínez tiene 29 años de edad. Es madre soltera. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Gissel tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Ella es una joven muy activa y dinámica, le gusta mucho su trabajo gracias a una amiga que le enseñaron lo esencial con esta actividad, fue que ella se instruyó para mantener su negocio y salir adelante, todos los días por la mañana elle recorre los diferentes lugares que tiene que visitar para ofrecer sus productos. Por lo que tiene que estar por la tarde, ya que tiene que pasar por su hijo en la escuela. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cremas, perfumes, desodorantes y pinturas de uñas. El sueño de ella ha sido establecer una tienda en la que ofrezca una variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Gissel del Carmen S. Martínez is 29 years old. She is a single mother. She has 1 child under her care. Gissel has dedicated herself to this business for 6 years. Her business is in the sale of cosmetics. She is a very active and dynamic young woman, and she enjoys her work very much. Thanks to a friend that taught her what was essential in this business, she was able to teach herself to manage this business and get ahead. Every day in the morning she travels to different places that she has scheduled to visit to sell her products. She has to be back in the afternoon, given that she has to pick up her son from school. The loan will be used as work capital to purchase creams, perfumes, deodorants, and nail polishes. Her dream has been to establish a store in which she can offer a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase creams, perfumes, deodorants, and nail polishes).

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is a 45-year-old woman; she is divorced with five children who are currently in school. As a single parent she works very hard to support her children.

Felicia is an achiever and a resourceful woman. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. She has been selling bananas and groundnuts in the community market for more than three years now. She treks to surrounding villages to purchase bulk stocks of bananas from the farmers to retail to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick up enough stock to make enough profit to support her family. She wants to use part of the profit to buy other fruits that are frequently requested by her customers.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supplies of bananas and peanuts to enable her to scale up her sales. She believes the loan would enable her to save more income to support her business growth and the children's education.

loans.use: To purchase  bananas and grocery products for resale

loans.name: Armada Boliviana Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal “Los Andes” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Armada Boliviana”, con 11 integrantes, su presidenta es Sabina Q., quien explica que el grupo se formo en la zona 23 de Febrero, todas viven cerca un colegio del mismo nombre de la asociación.
Feliza Q. es una de las integrantes de esta Asociación, tiene el negocio de venta de pito (cebada molida) que se prepara en pequeñas bolsas y reparte a tiendas de barrio, este producto generalmente lo consumen los niños. Al igual que Feliza sus compañeras tienen negocios pequeños como la venta de regalos, queso, comida, verduras, papa frita, refresco, torta y material escolar, y necesitan el préstamo para incrementar su mercadería.
texts.en:
In the "Los Andes" Community Center you will find the eleven member "Armada Boliviana" Communal Association. Its president is Sabina Q., who explains that the group formed in the 23 de Febrero neighborhood and that all of its members live near a school bearing the same name as the association. Feliza Q., a member of this Association, has a business selling "pito" (ground barley), which she prepares in small bags and delivers to neighborhood shops. Her product is generally consumed by children. Just like Feliza, the other group members have small businesses where they sell gifts, cheese, meals, vegetables, french fries, sodas, cakes, and school supplies, and they all need this loan in order to increase their inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing of Inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow yams

loans.name: Tạ Thị

texts.en:
L. Tạ Thị (43698122) is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling herbs and spices in the local community. L. has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid previous loans from TYM Fund. These previous loans were used to purchase additional products to sell. L. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: invest in expanding the business

loans.name: King Solomon Group

texts.en:
Kate is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. She is a baker. Kate bakes bread and supplies it to retailers and beverage sellers. She also engage "hawk" selling in her community in the mornings. 

Kate is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘King Solomon’. She is first from left in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses to provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell their goods on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Vũ Thị

texts.en:
N. Vũ Thị (412040365) is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, N. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. N. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. N. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: used to invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta is a 32-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. Two are schooling and the last baby is still breastfeeding. She is a food vendor and sells banku with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Atta wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She also runs a grocery shop alongside the food production. She hopes to raise increased income so her business can include the sale of cereals in bags to her customers. She has been in business for five years now and believes that the loan will boost her business growth.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 46 years old, married, and father of four children. All his children are currently schooling. He lives with his wife in the western region of Ghana.

George is a very hard-working man who wants to provide for his immediate family with the needed support. He is a dealer in electrical goods and he is also an electrician. Professionally as an electrician, he takes contract from clients and wires their houses for them. He is consistent in his job and many contracts have been awarded to him. He has also been selling electrical parts for nine years now.

George wants the loan to buy materials that he frequently uses for work. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices at Kumasi and sells them to his customers at retail prices. With the loan he believes he can be more resourced to expand his territories of work and also to provide his children with an education.

loans.use: To procure an increased stock of electrical and electronic parts

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 34 years old; she is married and the mother of four children who are currently in school. She is very humble and committed to her work and the family needs, because she believes the children are her future hope.

Susanna sells smoked cow meat in bulk at the community market where she lives. She has gotten stocks of cow meat from the northern region of Ghana for five years now. Sometimes she spends weeks in the northern region so that she can buy more meat to supply to her customers. This, she said, prevents her from frequent traveling. She requests the loan to buy more smoked meat to upgrade her inventory. And she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of smoked meat.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 35 years old; she is married and a mother with four children who are currently in school. She is very humble and committed to her work and the family needs because she believes the children are her future hope.

Janet sells smoked bush meat in bulk at the community market where she lives. She has been getting stocks of cow meat from the northern region of Ghana for five years now. Sometimes she spends weeks in the surrounding villages so that she can buy more meat to supply to her customers. This she said will prevent her from frequent traveling and middlemen who sell to her at higher prices. She requests the loan to buy more smoked meat to upgrade her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of bush meat

loans.name: Saviour Group

texts.en:
Akosua is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. She is a petty trader. She sells utensils, rubber and plastic products. Akosua is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Saviour’. She is the one standing in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a 68-year-old woman; she is married with eight children. All her children are currently working. She is a resourceful mother and she works with the motivation to help her husband support the family as she is old and not active in hard work.

Ama owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets in her community and has been selling items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. for twelve years now. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc. to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her profit to finance her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Dinora Jeaqueline

texts.es:
la sra. Dinora C. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia que esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia DANIA, ella tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, sus clientes la prefieren a ella por el tipo de atencion que les brinda.
es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, con las ganancias que ella obtiene cubre con todos los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos.
ella nos comento que se siente muy alegre ya que todo le esta saliendo bien en su vida, en estos momentos ella desea comprar mas mercaderia para su negocio y asi poder aumentar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs.Dinora C. is dedicated to the sale of popular consumer goods. She has a convenience store that is located in her house which operates under the name of DANIA convenience store. She has dedicated herself to this type of activity for three years; her customers prefer her for the attention she provides them. She is a single mother with 2 children, with the money she earns she covers household costs and the needs of her children. She says that she feels very happy because everything is going well in her life, now she wants to buy more merchandise for her business and thus increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, soap, toilet paper, coffee, drinks, bread, cookies, juices, eggs, chicken, ground corn, cheese, butter, churros (fried dough), candy, milk

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 41 years old, is married and a mother with four children. All of her children are currently in school. They are a very humble family who wants to invest in the future. She is a petty trader and sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, tinned tomatoes, bags of rice etc. Selling these products, she says, stock moves very fast and you can easily recover your money. She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi.

With 25 years' experience in her business, she wants to add other foodstuffs like maize, eggs and others which are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this can be possible with the help of loan assistance. She wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, spices, tinned tomatoes etc. She is much convinced that the loan would help her increase her stock in the event of a price hike.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like cooking oil, bags of rice, spices and tinned tomatoes etc.

loans.name: Nyame Asem Group

texts.en:
Kwasi is thirty-two years old. He is married and has four children. He is a petty trader. He runs a provisions store.

Kwasi is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame Asem’ which literally means God’s Word. He is the only male in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting for a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his poultry yard and to buy new hens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow peanuts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old; she is married and the mother of five children. Currently three are in school and the other two are learning a trade. She sells smoked fish and started her fish sales seven years ago at the community market where she lives. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand.

Elizabeth buys stocks of fish from the fish mongers sometimes, when demand is high. She has a big customer base that (customers) travels from the other surrounding communities to buy her fish. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fish. She dreams of giving her children a quality education through the proceeds from the business, especially the three that are schooling. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of smoked fish and dried fish for resale

loans.name: Olga De Jesus

texts.es: Olga es una mujer emprendedora solicito un primer préstamo para la compra de materia prima, ella se dedica a la confección de uniforme de enfermería y también uniformes de escuelas, ella desea y sueña en ver a sus hijos profesionales  y una casa bonita de dos niveles, es por ello que ha logrado comprar otra maquina de coser esto le ayudara a producir mas y tener ganancias en su negocio, el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de materia prima porque trabaja a base de pedidos siempre en su negocio la apoya su esposo y sus hijos se sienten muy felices porque le ha ido muy bien porque tiene bastante pedidos, y sus clientes saben de la calidad de trabajo que realiza asegura que con la ayuda de Dios todo le saldrá bien y lograra realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Olga is an entrepreunerial women requesting her first loan to purchase raw material. She is dedicated to creating nurse uniforms and also school uniforms. She wants and dreams of seeing her children become professionals and having a pretty two story house. It is for this that she has purchased another sewing machine to help her produce more and have greater earnings in her business, the loan is needed to buy raw materials because she works based on orders. In her business she always has the support of her husband and children and it makes them happy because she has done well because she has enough orders and her clients know the quality of her work that she does. With the help of God everything will go well and she will realize her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Jesus Gustavo

texts.es:
el sr. Jesus Gustavo E. A. tiene mas de 4 años de dedicarse a la carpinteria la cual opera bajo el nombre de Carpinteria E..
en su taller se elabora una gran variadad de muebles como ser puertas de tablero, ventanas, mesas, comodas, camas y por lo que mas resalta su taller es por la elaboracion de pailas de madera para vehiculos.
el viven en union libre y es padre de 3 hijos los cuales dependen al 100% de el, todos sus hijos estan estudiando. con las ganancias que le da el taller, el cubre todos sus gastos familiares, en estos momentos el necesita el credito para poder salir adelante con su negocio, ademas tiene un proyecto de fabricar varios muebles y necesita capital para poder empezar a realizar dicho proyecto.
texts.en:
Mr. Jesus Gustavo E. A. has been running his own carpentry business for over 4 years. His business operates under the name of Carpinteria E.. In his workshop he produces a large variety of furniture such as panel doors, windows, tables, dressers and beds. His workshop stands out because it also produces wood panels for vehicles. He lives with his common law wife and is a father of 3 children, who depend on him 100%. All of his children are in school. With the profits that the business generates, he is able to cover his financial needs at the moment. He needs a loan to move his business forward. He also has a project to manufacture several types of furniture and he needs the capital to start this project.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of laurel wood, sealant, varnish, thiner, glue, sandpaper, screws, and a polishing machine.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow sweet potatoes

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 43 años, es un hombre muy noble y trabajador, vive en su casa propia. Desde pequeño se dedica a la siembra y al cuidado de sus cultivos agrícolas, por lo que aprendió las técnicas de esta actividad que ahora realiza con mucha precisión. Alejandro sabe cómo y cuándo sembrar la papa, arveja y maíz, por eso muchas veces sus vecinos le piden consejo para sus cultivos y esto lo reconforta y anima a seguir compartiendo sus conocimientos. La dificultad de Alejandro es en el momento de la comercialización de sus productos en el mercado, pues tiene problemas de audición y no habla muy claro, además su esposa es analfabeta y se limita a cuidar los productos mientras él se esfuerza en hacerse entender con sus clientes. Pese a esta discapacidad tiene planes de surgir, por ello piensa comprar una motosierra para talar árboles de su chacra y poder vender leña, generándose así un ingreso adicional. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, demostrando ser un cliente muy responsable y que le gusta asistir a todas las reuniones de su banco comunal para estar enterado de los acuerdos de su grupo. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la comprar 20 sacos de fertilizantes químicos, calcula que le costará un aproximado de 2300 soles, con el resto del dinero comprará bolsas de arvejas (semilla).
texts.en:
Alejandro is 43 years old, he is a very noble and hard working man who lives in his own home. Since he was little he has spent time planting and taking care of his crops, so he was able to learn all the techniques of this activity, and now he does it with great precision. Alejandro knows how and when to plant potatoes, peas and corn, so many neighbors ask for his advice for their crops. This has reassured and encouraged him to continue sharing his knowledge. Alejandro's difficulty; however, is in selling his products at the market as he has trouble hearing and speaking very clearly, besides this, his wife is illiterate and simply looks after the goods as he strives to understand their customers. Despite his disability, he has plans to grow his business, so he plans to buy a chainsaw to cut trees from his farm to sell as firewood, thus generating additional income. This is his eighth loan from MFP and he is proving to be a very responsible member. He likes to attend all meetings of his community bank in order to be aware of all the arrangements made for his group. The money he is requesting is for the purchase of 20 bags of chemical fertilizers, the cost is estimated to be approximately 2300 suns, with the rest of the money being used to purchase peas (seed).

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: La señora Ana luisa Gutiérrez García , tiene la edad de 43 años , habita en el barrio , la Bolsa , ubicado en el municipio de la concepción , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos , dos mayores de edad y uno de 15 años , actualmente estudiante ,los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Ana desde hace 26 años se dedica a ala agricultura, las dificultades son las plagas que afecta al cultivo y no logra sacar lo que espera en producción, también la sequilla , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres . Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y obtener una buena producción y así vende a mejor precio al mercado.
texts.en:
Ana Luisa is 43 years old and lives in a neighborhood in la Concepción municipality with her husband, who works and helps her around the house. They are taking care of three children, two who are older and one who is 15 years old and is currently studying. With plans to improve the family’s living conditions, for the past 26 years Ana has worked doing agriculture. Difficulties include pests and droughts, which affect the cultivation and the ability to harvest the expected production. She began this work with the help of her parents. With her loan she plans on buying fertilizers to apply to the crops and obtain a good yield and therefore sell at a better price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 48 años, vive con la madre de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia de su pueblo llamado Patay. Sus hijos viven en la ciudad de Lima en la casa de unos familiares por motivos de estudios. Desde hace 28 años viene sembrando papas en sus propias chacras, hace algún tiempo atrás debido a la helada (clima muy frío) y a los bajos precios del mercado tuvo una gran pérdida que no le permitió ni siquiera recuperar sus inversiones. Desde entonces decidió empezar a cultivar también arvejas, las cuales le han resultado muy rentables y de menor inversión, pues siembra en las chacras donde ya han crecido las papas y de no ser así, tiene que abonar constantemente la tierra para lograr frondosidad en sus hojas y que prontamente revienten las vainitas de las arvejas. Jorge ama a sus siembras, cuando viaja a Lima para visitar a sus hijos, extraña mucho sus cultivos, entonces decide regresar para trabajar en sus chacra, puesto que gracias a sus cuidados oportunos puede lograr producir buenos frutos que le sean muy rentables. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, durante los ciclos anteriores pagó puntualmente sus cuotas, por ello se ha ganado la confianza de sus compañeros quienes lo nombraron fiscal de su banco comunal, labor que cumple responsablemente en bienestar de su grupo. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará 25 sacos de fertilizantes químicos para abonar su chacras de arveja.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 48-year-old homeowner who lives with the mother of his two sons in a town called Patay. His sons live with relatives in Lima because they are studying there. Jorge has planted potatoes on his own parcels of land for 28 years. He suffered a tremendous loss because of a cold snap, and low market prices, a while ago and has not been able to recuperate his losses. Therefore, he decided to also cultivate beans, which have proved to be profitable and to cost less. He plants them on the same land he’s cultivated potatoes and has to fertilize constantly to get lush plants that soon explode with pods of beans. Jorge loves his crops. When he goes to Lima to visit his sons, he misses them so he goes back to work his piece of land, that thanks to his care can grow and produce good crops that are profitable. This is his eighth loan with MFP. He paid his former installments on time and earned the trust of his fellow communal bank members. They nominated him treasurer, a position he takes seriously working for the good of the group. He plans to buy 25 sacks of chemical fertilizer for his beans with the loan money.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose sells smoked fish and started her fish selling two years ago at the community market where she lives. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. 

Rose prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She buys stocks of fish from the fish mongers sometimes, when demand is high. She has a big customer base; customers travel from the other surrounding communities to buy her fish. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fish. 

Rose is 48 years old; she is single and a mother with two children. One is independent and the other is still schooling. It is the desire of her heart to give last born the best legacy which quality education for better future. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 43 años, vive con su pareja y padre de su único hijo en su casa propia. Desde hace varios años atrás se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de papas y arvejas, pero por  consejo de sus vecinos ha empezado a sembrar flores, lo que le ha resultado muy rentable, sobre todo en los meses de mayo y octubre, de no terminar la cosecha de las flores, las deja en la chacra hasta que maduren y se convierten en las semillas, las cuales vende y también las usa para su próxima siembra. Desde entonces, Maria está priorizando la siembra de flores porque no tiene pérdidas, sin embargo, demandan de mucha agua, por lo que tiene que regar constantemente, ya sea de noche o de día para lograr que sus cultivos floreen rápidamente. De seguir rindiéndole sus siembras como hasta ahora, quiere comprar vacas para criar y vender mientras espera los meses de cosecha. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, a pesar de sus carencias económicas lo que resalta en María  es la responsabilidad de efectuar sus pagos. Asimismo asiste a todas las reuniones de su banco comunal y aunque no escucha muy bien, pide el apoyo de sus compañeras cuando es necesario. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su próxima siembra de flores y pueda cosechar para el mes de octubre.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old and lives with her partner (the father of her only son) in their own house. For several years now, she has been planting and cultivating potatoes and peas. On the advice of her neighbors, she has also started planting flowers, which has been very profitable for her, especially during the months of May and October. If she doesn't get the chance to cut all of the flowers, she allows them to continue growing on her land until they begin to produce seeds, which she then sells or plants in the next season. Maria has decided to make planting flowers her top priority, since they don't incur any losses, though they do require extensive watering, and she has to water them day and night in order to make the plants produce flowers quickly. She plans to continue to grow flowers, but also wants to start raising and selling cows in the meantime, as she waits for the harvest months. This is her eighth credit with Microfinanzas Prisma, and despite her difficult economic situation, what stands out in Maria is her ability to responsibly make her loan payments. She also attends all of her village bank meetings, and since she doesn't have very good hearing, she asks for her fellow group members' support when necessary. The requested loan will be used to buy chemical fertilizers for the upcoming flower planting season; these flowers will be ready to harvest in October.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: King Of Kings Group

texts.en:
Kwame is forty-three years old. He is married and has five children. He is a farmer/petty trader. Kwame runs a provisions store. He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘King of Kings’. He is the only male in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly petty traders, food vendors, and or farmers. They work to help their spouses to provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting for a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Raquel Emperatriz

texts.es:
la sra. Raquel Emperatriz N. S. tiene 2 años de haber iniciado con el negocio de venta de pollo frito, mismo que opera bajo el nombre de POLLOS STEFANNY.
ella inicio el negocio en la casa de una de sus hijas y hace 8 meses lo instalo cerca de donde ella vive.
sus clientes la prefieren  por el buen sabor con que ella elabora el pollo, ella es casada pero su esposo vive en la ciudad capital Tegucigalpa por motivos de trabajo y cada fin de semana viaja para estar con su familia.
ella vive con su hijo, con los ingresos que su negocio le genera le ayuda a su esposo para el mantenimiento del hogar y los estudios de su hijo. ella nos comento que su meta es poder tener una pollera super grande en la cual pueda vender mucho todos los dias, ademas que el pollo es un alimento que se consume mucho en nuestro pais, ya que su precio de compra es mas bajo que la carne de res y es saludable el comerlo.
texts.en:
Raquel Emperatriz N. S. started her business of selling fried chicken two years ago. She started the business, which she calls Pollos Stefanny, in her daughter’s house. Eight months ago she set it up close to where she lives. Her customers prefer her because of the good flavor of her chicken. She is married, but her husband lives in Tegucigalpa due to his work. Every week end he travels to be with his family. She lives with her son. The income generated by her business helps her husband support the household and pay for their son’s education. Her goal is to be able to have a super big chicken store where she can sell a lot every day. Chicken is consumed a lot in her country. Its price is lower than beef, and it is healthy to eat it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicken, oil, soft drinks, plates, salsas, paper, chili, condiments, and tortillas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 47 years old; she is divorced and the mother of four children. Three are currently in school whilst the eldest is learning a trade. She sells smoked fish and started her fish selling eight years ago at a community market where she lives. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand.

Beatrice buys stocks of fishes from the fish mongers sometimes when demand is high. She has a broad customer base and they travel from the other surrounding communities to buy her fish. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fish. She dreams of giving her children who are schooling a better education through the proceeds from the business. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela tiene 34 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive con el padre de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su infancia ha realizado los trabajos agrícolas; sembrando papas, arvejas y habas, pero de todos sus cultivos el que le resulta más fácil en la recolección son las habas y aunque las papas y arvejas requieren mayor esfuerzo físico, son mucho más rentables. Cada día Mayela se levanta muy temprano para alistar el almuerzo, ya que a las 8 de la mañana ya tiene que estar removiendo la tierra de sus cultivos juntamente con su esposo. Pero cuando le toca regar sus chacras se desvela, pues inicia a las 9 de la noche hasta 1 o 2 de la madrugada, debido al turno que le dan en la junta de regantes del agua de su comunidad. De este modo viene trabajando con sus cultivos y lo realiza con mucho cariño, puesto que sabe que gracias a ello obtiene los ingresos económicos para el sostenimiento de su familia y la educación de sus hijos. De salirle muy bien sus próximas y futuras cosechas, Mayela espera poder adquirir terrenos de regadío. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, durante los 7 ciclos pasados demostró pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y asimismo trata de asistir a todas sus reuniones de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy cómoda junto a sus compañeros. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, además de una bolsa de arvejas (semilla) de un tipo de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Mayela, 34, is a very hard working woman. She lives with the father of her three children in her own house. Since she was very young she has been doing agricultural work like planting potatoes, peas, and beans. Of all of her crops, beans are the easiest to gather. Even though the potatoes and peas require much more physical effort, they are much more profitable. Every day Mayela gets up very early to get breakfast ready. By eight in the morning she has to be working the fields with her husband. When it is time to water her crops, she does not sleep. She starts at nine at night and waters until one or two in the morning. This is the turn given to her by the water rights board in her community. This is how she works her crops, and she does so with much affection. She knows that thanks to them, she receives the income to support her family and educate her children. By doing well in the next and future harvests, Mayela hopes to be able to acquire irrigated land. This is her eighth loan with MFP. During the previous seven loan cycles she has shown that she makes her payments on time. She tries to attend all of her community bank’s meetings, where she feels very comfortable being with her colleagues. The money she is asking for is to buy chemical fertilizers and a bag of better quality pea seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 47 años, es una mujer muy alegre y abnegada, está casada con el padre de sus 2 hijos y viven en su casa propia. Desde niña trabajó apoyando en los cultivos de sus padres, una vez que se casó aumentó su labor agrícola, pues trabajó arduamente, junto a su esposo, con miras de conseguir el dinero necesario para la construcción de su casa, logro por el que ahora se siente muy satisfecha. Rosa confía en que Dios la bendijo permitiéndole realizar muy buenas cosechas por las obtuvo considerables ingresos económicos. No conforme con ello, ahora ha comprado un par de ovejas  de raza para empezar la crianza y venta de la carne de este animal en aras de incrementar sus ganancias. De ese modo Rosa busca que sus hijos no pasen dificultades económicas, ya que vienen cursando estudios universitarios en la ciudad de Lima. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, acaba de ingresar a un banco comunal antiguo por lo que se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita será para incrementar su ganado y con otra parte comprará fertilizantes químicos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 47, is a very happy and selfless woman. She is married to the father of her two children, and they live in their own house. When she was a young girl she worked to help her parents with their crops. Once she got married, she did more agricultural work. She worked arduously with her husband looking to get enough money to build their house. They achieved that, and she now feels very satisfied. Rosa trusts that God blesses her and allows her to have very good harvests, which bring her good income. She does not stop there. She has now bought a pair of sheep to breed. She will start raising them and selling the meat in order to increase her income. Rosa does this so that her children will not have economic difficulties. They are studying at the university in the city of Lima. This is her first loan with MFP. She has just joined a long established community bank, and she promises to make her payments on time. The money she is asking for is to increase her livestock and buy chemical fertilizers with the other part.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Rosario Marlene

texts.es: Rosario Marlene M. A.  reside San Martin municipio de San Salvador. Rosario tiene 34 años de edad vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos todos aun menores de edad. Rosario se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras pero para mejorar sus ingresos ha creado un pequeño negocio de venta de comida donde ella elabora variedad de almuerzos para ofrecer a sus clientes, el esposo de Rosario ayuda en el negocio, el deseo de superación que esta familia ha puesto en su negocio  los ha mantenido a flote por ya casi ocho años y ahora  Rosario solicita un crédito para compra de materia prima para alimentos de sus almuerzos ya que desea aumentar la producción de los mismos.
texts.en:
Rosario Marlene M. A. lives in San Martin, in the city of San Salvador. Rosario is 34 years old and lives with her husband and four children who are still all minors. Rosario sells fruit and vegetables to improve her income but she has also created a small business selling meals that she prepares for a variety of customers. Rosario's husband helps her in the business. The effort that the family has put into the business to succeed is what has kept them afloat for almost eight years. Now Rosario is requesting a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her business to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw ingredients

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 52 years old, and she is married with four children. Three are adults and the last born is schooling. She is living with her husband in a family house at Sefwi in the Western region of Ghana. She is supportive, determined and above all very hard-working, despite her age.

She is a petty trader who trades in cereals such as bags of maize, beans, groundnuts etc. She takes delivery of stock from Tamale in the northern region of Ghana and sometimes she takes stock from the surrounding villages.

Her kids are very proud of her because of the enormous contribution she makes in the home. Selling of foodstuffs has enabled her to rent a store in the market place where she distributes to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buys more bags of maize, beans, and groundnuts to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her save for her last child's education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: to buy bulk supplies of maize

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
la sra. CORINA A. S. se dedica al comercio y tiene un puesto de venta de Ropa para bebes, caballeros damas y niños y tambien una gran variedad de ropa interior para ambos sexos.
su negocio esta ubicado en el Boulevard de la ciudad de Danli frente al campo "Julio Verne" tiene (14) catorce años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y se ve notablemente que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar muy bien, con los ingresos que le ha generado su negocio ella logro educar a sus hijos, y uno de sus hijos, se gano una beca de estudio en la Escuela Agricola del Zamorano, una de las mas prestigiosas a nivel centro americano y por mantener un buen indice academico se gano una nueva beca para que estudiase en una universidad de Estados Unidos de America, mismo que en este momento esta cursando sus estudios.
La Sra. A. es una persona luchadora, y con grandes esfuerzos logro graduar a su hijo de nivel secundario, mismo que valoro el sacrificio que su madre hacia por él.
Doña, corina es una Sra de 67 años de edad, y es de admirar ya que ha esta edad ella sigue trabajando sin ningun impedimento y bien saludable, su esposo trabaja al lado de ella.
texts.en:
MRS. CORINA A. S. is devoted to trading and has a stall where she sells clothes for babies, women, men, boys and a wide range of underwear for both sexes. Her business is located on a boulevard in the city of Danli in front of the "Julio Verne" field. She has been working in this type of business for 14 years and has done remarkably well during this time. With the revenue this business has generated she has been able to educate her children and one of her sons received a scholarship and is currently attending the Escuela Agricola del Zamorano (Agricultural College), one of the most prestigious schools in Central America . Because her son has maintained excellent grades, he has now been awarded a scholarship to study at a university in the United States. Mrs. A. is a fighter, with great effort she was able to achieve the goal of having her child graduate high school. Her son appreciates the sacrifices that his mother has made for him. Mrs. A. is 67 years old, and is admired for still working unimpeded, healthy and well. Her husband works alongside her.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase women's pants, skirts, blouses, bikinis, bras and baby clothes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Compartir, vive en la comunidad de San Martín de Paraíso.
Alejandrina es conviviente, tiene 32 años y dos hijos, Alejandrina junto a su pareja se dedican a la agricultura de verduras como perejil, culantro, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fertilizantes y semillas.
Los sueños de Alejandrina son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the Compartir Community Bank. She lives in the community of San Martín de Paraíso. Alejandrina is married, 32 years old and has two children. Together with her husband she farms herbs, such as parsley and coriander, which she sells in the Ayacucho city market. Alejandrina needs a loan in the amount of 2000 soles, which she plans to invest in the purchasing of fertilizers and seeds. She dreams of improving her business and providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosario del Carmen S. D. M. resiD. en el municipio D. Sacacoyo  en el departamento La Libertad.  Rosario vive con su esposo y su pequeño niño Saúl D. 12 meses, el esposo D. Rosario es comerciante el posee un negocio en Santa Tecla y Rosario ha montado un ciber café en la casa donD. viven, tiene al servicio D. sus clientes una mínima cantidad D. maquinas trabajando, el crédito que Rosario solicita es para invertir en sus negocio ofreciendo otros servicios y productos como materiales D. papelería, cd´s y consolas D. videojuegos para alquilar por hora.
texts.en:
Rosario del Carmen S. D. M. lives in the municipality of Sacacoyo in the department of La Libertad. Rosario lives with her husband and her small child, Saúl, who is 12 months old. Rosario’s husband is a shopkeeper and has a business in Santa Tecla, and Rosario has set up an internet café in their house. She has a minimal number of functioning machines for her customers. Rosario is asking for a loan to invest in her business, offering other services and products such as stationery, CDs, and video game consoles to rent by the hour.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business and offer other services

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 59 years old. She is a widowed woman with four children. Her husband died through a prolonged sickness. She prepares and serves pastries like cakes, dough nuts and flour chips through hawking and she also supplies to shops around her.

In spite of the challenges she faces, she manages to meet her customers' demands by depending on her small resources. She supplies her produce to her customers in the market center by herself. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials to meet the demands of her customers. She requests loan support to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide support for the business. She has been in business for four years now.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel tiene 45 años, es un hombre muy tranquilo que vive con su esposa en su casa propia, ellos no tienen hijos. Sus cultivos preferidos son las arvejas y los gladiolos, debido a su rentabilidad, pero para sembrar gladiolos difícilmente encuentra chacras, ya que se cree que esta flor empobrece la tierra y si consigue terrenos le cobran muy caro el arriendo, entre 700 a 900 soles por cada siembra. Por ello este año ha preferido sembrar arvejas en chacras alquiladas donde solo paga entre 200 a 400 soles por siembra. Además este producto le resulta muy rentable, ya que de una sola siembra logra cosechar dos veces con frutos de primera calidad y para la tercera recolección abona constantemente para lograr tres cosechas de primera. De ese modo cubre el arriendo del terreno y obtiene ganancias para sus gastos familiares. Samuel está muy feliz con sus cultivos y lo que le gustaría es comprar sus propios terrenos donde sembrar sus productos. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP y trata de pagar puntualmente todas sus cuentas, ya que no le gusta caer en morosidad. En las reuniones de su banco comunal está muy pendiente de los acuerdos que se toman para sumarse a trabajar en bien del progreso de todo el grupo. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de 3 bolsas de arvejas (semilla), asimismo pagará el alquiler del terreno donde vaya a sembrar.
texts.en:
Samuel is 45 years old. He is a very tranquil man and he lives with his wife in their own house. They don’t have any children. His preferred crops are peas and gladiolos because of their profitability. However, it is difficult to find a piece of land to plant gladiolos because it is believed that this flower impoverishes the land and if you obtain land, the rent is very expensive (between 700 and 900 PEN for each season). As a result, this year he has preferred to plant peas on rented pieces of land where he only pays between 200 to 400 PEN each season. In addition, this product is very profitable because in a single season he is able to harvest high quality fruit two times and he constantly fertilizes for the third harvest so that he has three high quality harvests. In this way, he pays for the land rental and obtains earnings for his household expenses. Samuel is very happy with his crops and he would like to purchase his own lands to plant his products. This is his eighth loan with MFP and he tries to pay his bills on time because he doesn’t like to fall behind. At his community bank meetings he is always waiting for agreements that they have to join to work for the progress of the group. The money that he is asking for will be invested in the purchase of 3 bags of peas (seed), as well as to pay the rent for the land where he will go to plant.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and rent payment for the land parcel

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es: Maria Andrea E. reside en Armenia municipio de Sonsonate. Maria vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, Maria se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo, su forma de comercializar su mercadería es de manera ambulante ya  que las personas hacen sus pedidos por medio de Maria al ver la revista y luego Maria lleva el producto que el cliente solcito dejándole a Maria un pequeño margen de comisión por venta, ahora el propósito de Maria es comprar una cantidad de cosméticos y ropa para aprovechar las visitas a sus clientes y así obtener un margen mayor de ganancias con mercadería propia de Maria es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de ropa y cosméticos que desea comercializar a todos clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Andrea E. lives Armenia, a municipality of Sonsonate. She lives in her own house with her husband and four children. Maria sells products by catalog, and she markets her merchandise door-to-door. The people make their requests through Maria after seeing the magazine and then Maria brings the product to the customer, leaving Maria with a small profit commission for the sale. Now, Maria’s intention is to buy a number of cosmetics and clothing to take advantage of her visits to her customers and obtain a larger profit margin with her own merchandise. This is why she is asking for a loan for the purchase of clothing and cosmetics that she wants to market to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Compartir, vive en la comunidad de San Martín de Paraíso.
Luisa es conviviente tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Luisa tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, abarrotes en general, además Luisa se dedica a comprar tara y cochinilla que luego vende a intermediarios. También junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de verduras.
Luisa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara, frutas y para la agricultura.
Los sueños de Luisa son mejorar sus ingresos, ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Compartir Community Bank. She lives in the community of San Martín de Paraíso.

Luisa is 31 years old, has a live-in partner, and has 2 children. She has a shop in her house where she sells vegetables and general groceries. Luisa also buys tara and suckling pig that she then sells to middlemen.

Luisa needs a loan of 1500 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of tara and fruits, and for agriculture.

Luisa’s dreams are to improve her income, expand her business, and that her children will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of tara, fruits, and for agriculture.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: Vicenta C. M. reside en San Luis Talpa en el departamento de La Paz. Vicenta tiene 52 años de edad vive con su hija y su nietas. Vicenta y su hija se dedican al negocio con el cual han logrado salir adelante es una tortillería y panadería, las ventas de sus productos son diarias y sus compras de materia prima una vez a la semana, el crédito que Vicenta solicita es para compra de materia prima para a aumentar la producción en la panadería y tortillería, así les permitirá generar mayores ingresos económicos para la familia a través del aumento de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Vicenta C. M. lives in San Luis Talpa in the department of La Paz. She is 52 years old and lives with her daughter and granddaughters. Vicenta and her daughter have a tortilla shop and a bakery, with which they have been able to get ahead. They make sales from their products daily and they buy raw materials once per week. Vicenta is asking for a loan for the purchase of raw material to increase the production of the tortilla shop and bakery so that they will be able to generate greater economic incomes for the family through the increase of their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal Compartir, vive en la comunidad de San Martín de Paraíso.
Lourdes es conviviente, tiene 28 años, Lourdes tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Lourdes necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite.
Los sueños de Lourdes son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
