Lourdes is a member of the Sharing Community Bank. She lives in the community of San Martín de Paraíso. Lourdes is married and is 28 years old. Lourdes has a store in her house, where she sells general groceries with the help of her husband. Lourdes needs a loan for 2000 soles, which will be invested to buy rice, sugar, and oil. Her dreams are to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 45 years old, married, and a mother with five children. Three of them are in school whilst the rest are working. They are a very humble family who want to invest in their future. She is a petty trader and sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, tin tomatoes, bags of rice, etc. She says these products sell very fast and you can easily recover your money. She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi. With six years experience in her business she wants to add other foodstuffs like maize, eggs, and others which are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this would be possible with the help of loan. Therefore she wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, spices, tin tomatoes etc. She is convinced that the loan would help her increased her stock in the event of price hikes and also to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy food items for resale

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 27 años, es una mujer comprensiva que vive con el padre de sus 2 hijos pequeños y por el momento habitan en la casa de sus padres. Cuando visitamos a Sonia la encontramos muy triste y a la vez enojada, porque la noche anterior le robaron los choclos de su chacra, los cuales le costaron mucho abonar hasta que maduren. Por esa razón piensa vender los que tiene a un mayor precio en el mercado y posteriormente lo rematará para no tener una mayor pérdida. Sonia se dedica todos los días a las labores agrícolas juntamente con su esposo, ya que le gusta ocuparse en su principal fuente de ingresos económicos. La manera en que ella cultiva es alternada; los meses de enero siembra gladiolos, para cosechar en mayo; en abril es el turno de las arvejas y en octubre la papa, de este modo todo su tiempo está muy dedicada a sus cultivos, generándole muy buenas ganancias. Por esta razón avizora comprar un terreno en los próximos meses donde construirá su casa propia para brindarles mayor comodidad a sus hijos. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, donde viene demostrando pagar sus cuotas en las fechas indicadas. Asimismo, le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su banco comunal, donde aprovecha de conversar y pasar un buen tiempo en compañía de sus vecinas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos con los que abonará sus chacras de arvejas que ya están sembradas.
texts.en:
Sonia is 27 years old and is very knowledgeable. She lives with the father of her two small children, and, at the moment, they live with her parents. When we visited Sonia, she was very sad and angry, because the night before her corn, which is very costly until it matures, from her farm was stolen. As a result, she plans to sell the corn that she still has at a higher price in the market, so she won’t end up with a large loss. Sonia works every day in agriculture with her husband, since it is their primary source of income. She alternates the crops that she grows; in January, she sows gladioli, which she harvests in May. In April, she sows peas, and in October, she plants potatoes. She spends all of her time working on her crops, which generates good earnings. Because of this, she will buy land in the next few months, where she will build her own house so that she can offer her children more comforts. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and she has made her repayments on time. Also, she likes to attend the meetings at her community bank, where she takes advantage of talking to and having a good time with her neighbors. The money that she requests will be used to buy chemical fertilizers, with which she will fertilize her pea farms that have already been sown.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Ana Consuelo

texts.es: Ana Consuelo O. de 37 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Paz junto a sus cuatro hijos Cesar de 20 años, Maria de 16 años, Beatriz de 10 años y Nadia de 3 años de edad. Ana es madre soltera y ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijos brindándole estudios a todos ya que reconoce que la educación es parte importante para la formación de sus hijos, Ana tiene un negocio de venta de pupusas y bebidas donde el principal motor del día a día lo obtiene del deseo de superación que quiere darle a su familia es por eso que Ana solicita un crédito ya que desea surtir de mas bebidas y productos para su negocio asi lograra aumentar su ingresos por medio de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana Consuelo O. is 37 years old and lives in the department of La Paz with her four children. Cesar is 20 years old, Maria is 16 years old, Beatriz is 10 years old, and Nadia is 3 years old. Ana is a single mother and has succeeded in taking her children forward by offering all of them an education because she recognizes that education is an important part of her children’s development. Ana has a business where she sells maize dumplings and drinks. Her main motivation from day to day is her desire to be able to give more to her family. Because of this, Ana is requesting a loan so that she can supply more drinks and products for her business. With this, she will succeed in increasing her income through her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
la sra LUCY A. SANABRIA se dedica al comercio y tiene un negocio de varieddes, mismo que opera bajo el nombre de "VARIEDADES LUCYS"
Su negocio esta ubicado en la terminal de transporte de la ciudad de Danli, frente a la estación de buses de Jacaleapa, ella cuanta con 22 años de experiencia en el negocio.
Doña Lucy, tiene (9) nueve años de haber instalado su propio negocio, mismo que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar muy bien; ella vende su producto al por mayor y menor y tiene vendedores ambulantes dentro de la terminal de transporte dandoles los productos a un costo mas bajo que el que ella vende y teniendo las ganacias a como ellos logren vender a los consumidores, ella es casada con los ingresos que le genera su negocio colabora con su esposo en un 50% a cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
su esposo es comerciante individual, viaja a Panama a comprar mercadería y la distribuye en diferentes departamentos de este país.
texts.en:
Lucy A. Sanabria has a variety store, which she runs under the name "Variedades Lucys" (Lucy's Varieties"). Her business is located in the transportation terminal in the city of Danli, across from the Jacaleapa bus station. She has 22 years of experience in business.

Lucy started her own business nine years ago, and during that time she has learned to manage it very well; she sells her products wholesale and retail, and has peddlers inside the transportation terminal who she sells products to at a lower cost than in her store, and she profits like they do when they sell to customers.

Lucy is married, and with the income from her business, she collaborates with her husband and covers half of the expenses in her household. Her husband is an independent trader who travels to Panama to buy merchandise and distributes it to different regions of Honduras.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy watches, ibuprofen, tetracycline, amoxicillin, acetaminophen, ointment, snail cream, menthol, and gold plating

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nkakrankakra Group

texts.en:
Salim is twenty-nine years old. He is single but cares for two younger siblings who are currently in primary school. He is a carpenter by profession. Salim is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nkakra-nkakra’ which literally means gradual by gradual. He is the young man standing in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors and or farmers. They work to help their spouses in providing for their families.

They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Nohemy Concepción

texts.es: Nohemy Concepción C. A. de 28 años de edad reside en San Luis La Herradura ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Nohemy vive con su esposo que trabaja como taxista y su promedio de ganancias mensuales es de 100$, tiene dos niños aun menores de edad Adriana de 7 años y Diego de 5 años de edad ambos niños son estudiantes. Nohemy posee un negocio donde producen queso, y se comercializa en diferentes lugares cercanos, Nohemy es fuente de ingresos para otras familias ya que ella posee un pequeño grupo de trabajadores que le ayudan en su negocio, el destino del crédito que solicita Nohemy  es para compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus quesos.
texts.en:
28-year-old Nohemy Concepción C. A. resides in San Luis La Herradura in the district of La Paz. Nohemy lives with her husband, who works as a taxi driver, and earns an average of $100 per month. She has two children who are still of a young age; Adriana is 7 years old, and Diego is 5 years old. Both children are students. Nohemy owns a cheese-making business, and sells her cheeses at several local locations. Nohemy functions as a source of income for other families as well, employing a small group of workers who help her run her business. The money that Nohemy requests will be put toward the purchase of raw materials for the making of her cheeses.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is 66 years old she is a married mother with eleven children: four are working and her last born is in school but unfortunately, six have died.

Adwoa is a petty trader and sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, tinned tomatoes, bags of rice, etc. In selling these products, she says, they move very fast and you can easily recover your money.

She buys her goods from the capital city of Kumasi. With thirty years trading experience she wants to add other stuff like maize, eggs and others items which are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this can be possible with the help of loan assistance. Therefore she wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, spices, tinned tomatoes, etc. She is much convinced that the loan will help her increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy food items like cooking oil, bags of rice, spices, tinned tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando R. O. de 46 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas Griselda de 17 años y Nanci de 12 años de edad ambas niñas son estudiantes. Orlando posee una tienda ubicada dentro de su casa donde vende productos de consumo, también recibe el apoyo económico de su esposa  Doña Rosalina quien se dedica a la venta de tortillas generando  ganancias de 200$ mensuales, pero el motivo por que Orlando solicita este crédito es para la compra de cereales y otros productos para vender en su tienda.
texts.en:
Orlando R. Oseguera is 46. He lives in the La Libertad department with his wife and two daughters. Griselda is 17, Nanci is 12, and they both go to school. Orlando has a store, which is located in his house. He sells consumable products. He also receives economic help from his wife, Rosalina. She sells tortillas, and she generates $200 a month. The reason Orlando is asking for this loan is to buy cereals and other products to sell in his store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cereal and other products

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder tiene 25 años, es un joven muy responsable, el mayor de 6 hermanos que viven en la casa de sus padres. En vista de la enfermedad de su padre decidió hacerse cargo de la educación de sus hermanos menores, desde entonces siembra papas, arvejas y habas en chacras alquiladas, pagando por el arriendo entre 600 a 700 soles por cada siembra. Para esta labor cuenta con la ayuda de su madre y los fines de semana, de sus hermano y su padre. Wilder está muy contento de labrar la tierra y ser útil para su familia, eso lo llena de mucha alegría. Últimamente ha decidido sembrar sus propios cultivos para sus gastos personales, ahora en la chacra de papas, donde posa para la foto, va sembrar arvejas aprovechando los nutrientes del abonado de la siembra anterior. Nos cuenta que lo que requiere de mayor inversión es el cultivo de la papa, debido a la necesidad de fertilizantes y cuando no obtiene un buen precio en el mercado no alcanza las ganancias esperadas, es por ello que se va a dedicar más a la siembra de arvejas para alcanzar sus anhelos de contar con sus propias chacras. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, durante los tres ciclos pasados demostró honestidad y puntualidad en sus pagos y trata de asistir a todas la reuniones de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy cómodo con todos los demás integrantes. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de dos bolsas de arvejas (semilla) en una variedad mejorada para que resista las diversas circunstancias climáticas.
texts.en:
Wilder, 25, is a very responsible young man. He is the oldest of six siblings who live at home with their parents. In light his father’s illness, Wilder decided to be in charge of his younger siblings’ education. From then on he planted potatoes, peas, and beans in rented fields. He pays between 600 and 700 PEN for each planting. His mother helps him with the work. During the week ends his father and his siblings help him. Wilder is very happy to work the land and to be useful to his family. This fills him with joy. He has decided to plant his own crops for his own personal expenses. In the potato fields, where he poses for the photo, he will plant peas to take advantage of the fertilizer’s nutrients from the last planting. He needs more investment in his potato crop due to the need for fertilizers. When he does not get a good price at the market, he does not reach his expected income. That is why he is going to plant more peas to reach his goal of having his own fields. This is his fourth loan with MFP. During the past three loan cycles he has demonstrated honesty and punctuality in his payments. He tries to attend all of his community bank’s meetings. He feels very comfortable with all of the other members. The money he is asking for is to buy two bags of peas (seeds) in a better variety so that they resist the diverse climate.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 54 years old. She is married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She lives with her family in the western region of Ghana. She is a baker who uses flour for her production. She has been in business for 30 years, in spite of the challenges she faces. She bakes bread, cakes, meat pies, etc., and sells them to her customers. She has customers who buy from her in bulk.

Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are going up. She requests a loan to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family, most especially for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Ana Ernestina

texts.es: Ana Ernestina C. D. R. D. 46 años D. edad resiD. en San Marcos ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ana vive junto a su esposo Don Rafael quien es empleado y aporta 80$ mensuales, también tiene una nieta en su responsabilidad llamada Tatiana D. 7 años D. edad. Ana se dedica en su mayoría a la venta D. productos D. belleza, pero también posee un inventario D. productos que son los más solicitados por sus clientes como joyería, vajillas, pañales desechables entre otros, el destino del crédito que Ana solicita es para la compra D. perfumes para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Ernestina Caceres D. R. is 46 years old and lives in San Marcos in the department of San Salvador. Ana lives with her husband Rafael who is employed and brings home $80 monthly, Ana supports a granddaughter called Tatiana who is 7 years old and is under her responsibility. Ana sells beauty supplies, but she also has an inventory of products that are on high demand by her clients like jewelry, dishes, pampers among others. The loan Ana is requesting is for buying perfumes for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes for her business

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo O. G. de 55 años de edad reside en municipio de Soyapango departamento San Salvador. Wilfredo vive con solamente con su esposa Doña Francisca ya que su dos hijos se encuentran en Estados Unidos. Wilfredo se dedica al transporte de carga de mercadería, lleva ya veinte años de experiencia en el negocio, motivo por el cual es muy conocido en la zona, el crédito que Wilfredo solicita es para la revisión y mantenimiento su vehículo ya que es su único medio con el cual logra sacar sus  ingresos de tal manera que es importante el estado de su carro para desempeñar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Wilfredo O. Garcia is 55 years old and lives in the municipality of Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. Wilfredo lives only with his wife Francisca because their two sons are in United States. Wilfredo works transporting merchandise, he has 20 years of experience in this business so he is very well known in the area, the credit Wilfredo is requesting is to provide service and maintenance to his vehicle because it is his one and only medium to produce income, so to keep his vehicle in good condition is very important.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is 60 years old. She is married with five children. Two children are currently out of school and independent, whiles the rest are still in school. She is very committed to her work and very resourceful to her family  because she believes the children are her future hope. 

She sells smoked cow skin in the community market where she lives. Smoked cow skin is a popular source of meat used in preparation of sauces and favourite local dishes like "waakye" and "banku". She purchased stock of cow skin from herd men in northern region of Ghana and has been in business for three years now. Sometimes she spends weeks in the northern region so that she can buy more to supply to her customers. This, she said, saves her from frequent traveling. She requests a loan to buy more smoked skin to upgrade her inventory. She desired to provide her children with quality to give them better career. she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of smoked meat

loans.name: Laura Dina

texts.es: Laura Dina R. R. de 40 años de edad  vive el departamento de Ahuachapán. Laura posee de negocio una venta de madera, su local está ubicado en una buena zona ya que tiene buen acceso a sus clientes y camiones que llegan a cargar madera. Laura posee un excelente record creditico ya que su negocio le permite una buena estabilidad económica, el crédito que Laura solicita es para la compra de todo tipo de madera, de esta manera lograra aumentar sus ingresos y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Laura Dina Rodriguez R. is 40 years old and lives in the department of Ahuchapan. Laura has a business selling wood, her store is located in a good area because it provides easy access to her clients and trucks that come to carry wood. Laura has a great credit record because her business gives her financial stability, the loan Laura is requesting is to buy all kinds of wood, so she can keep on increasing her income and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy all kinds of wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell used refrigerators

loans.name: Gbamra

texts.fr: Gbamra A. est un cultivateur de sorgho à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agé de 32 ans, il est marié et père de 2 enfants. il désire avec ce crédit acheter des intrants comme les engrais pour augmenter sa production et par là améliorer son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Gbamra A. is a sorghum farmer in Avetonou, a village located about 100 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He is 32 years old, married, and the father of two. He would like to use this loan to buy inputs, such as fertilizers, to increase his production and thus to improve his standard of living.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other inputs

loans.name: Francisca Amanda

texts.es: Francisca Amanda M. P. de 63 años de edad vive en el departamento de La Libertad junto a su esposo don Elías de 60 años de edad y posee un empleo que mensualmente le deja 250$. Francisca sale a vender fuera del  pasaje de su colonia por las tardes ya que es muy transcurrido por peatones y  los carros que pasan en dicha  calle, Francisca elabora variedad de bocadillos para su comercialización como yuca, papas fritas, elotes entre otros; su ganancias diarias son aproximadamente 25$, el crédito que Francisca solita es para la compra de productos de la temporada para la elaboración de sus boquitas típicas salvadoreñas.
texts.en:
Francisca Amanda Melendez P. is 63 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad with her husband Elias who is 60 years old and is employed bringing home $250 a month. Francisca sells snacks every afternoon by the main street in her neighbourhood because the street is very popular and full of people and cars. Francisca creates different kinds of snacks like yuca, french fries, corn, among others; her daily profit is approximately $25, the loan Francisca is requesting is to buy seasonal products to prepare her typical Salvadorean snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal products to prepare snacks

loans.name: Wendy Del Carmen

texts.es: Wendy del Carmen N. D. D. resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango en el departamento D. San Salvador. Wendy vive con su esposo quien tiene un negocio que es un taller automotriz, en su casa también los acompañan sus cuatro hijos, todos aun menores D. edad y estudiantes D. primaria. Wendy ayuda a su esposo en los gastos familiares apoyada D. los ingresos que obtiene por su negocio que es la venta D. comida y bebidas, también Wendy es socia D. una marca D. productos D. belleza en la cual obtiene comisiones por la venta D. productos D. ese catalogo, pero ahora Wendy solicita un crédito para la compra D. materia prima para la elaboración D. su comida que ofrece en su negocio.
texts.en:
Wendy del Carmen N. D. Duenas lives in the municipality of Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. Wendy lives with her husband who has an auto body shop, their four children live with them at home, they are all still kids and are on elementary school. Wendy helps her husband with the family expenses thanks to the income she gets from her business selling food and drinks, Wendy is also a member of traD. mark beauty products company for which she obtains commission from sales of their catalogue products. Wendy is requesting the loan to buy groceries to prepare the food she sells at her business.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to prepare the food she sells

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es: Ermelinda S. D. L. D. 47 años D. edad vive en el departamento D. La Paz con su esposo y sus tres hijos Norma D. 17 años, José D. 13 años y Jorge D. 10 años D. edad, todos los niños se encuentran estudiando. Ermelinda posee un negocio donD. venD. variedad D. productos como carne, lácteos, verduras, tamales y pan fabricados por ella. Ermelinda ya ha manejado créditos los cuales le han ayudado a seguir creciendo en su negocio, y ha sido muy responsables es sus cuotas asignadas, y en esta ocasión Ermelinda solicita un crédito para la compra D. productos y materia prima, ya que tiene mucha demanda en la zona y desea aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ermelinda Santamaria D. L. is 47 years old and lives in the department of La Paz with her husband and 3 children. Norma who is 17 years old, Jose is 13 and Jorge is 10 years old, all her children are studying. Ermelinda has a business where she sells products like meat, milk, vegetables, tamales and bread she bakes. Ermelinda has experience managing credit, which had helped her grow her business, and she has been responsible paying her quotes, this time Ermelinda requests a loan to buy products and groceries for her business because there is high demand in the area and she wants to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and groceries for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement and other construction supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
To make ends meet, Daniel works a day job in a packaging factory and nights and weekends running his business, Puerta Cleaning Services. He specializes in carpet cleaning and odor control as well as standard house cleaning, but his portable carpet-cleaning machine isn’t powerful enough. In order to keep clients from going elsewhere, Daniel put a deposit down on a used truck-mounted cleaner that would enable him to serve more clients more efficiently. The new cleaner will help him expand his business, hire an employee, and make him less vulnerable to job loss if the factory where he works closes.

A $7,000 loan from Opportunity Fund will help Daniel purchase the truck-mounted cleaner. It will also allow him to invest in advertising and marketing to build his client base, including putting a decal on his cleaning van.

loans.use: To buy a truck-mounted carpet cleaner

loans.name: El Buen Soldado (The Good Soldier) Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario el buen soldado esta integrado por 5 personas las cuales se conocen desde hace muchos años atras y han hecho una muy buena amistad, la sra. Macaria I. tiene 59 años de edad, viven en union libre y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales solo 2 dependen de ella, otros de los hijos de ella son personas mayores y casadas, le ayudan economicamente. 
ella se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo, chicharrones, tocino, costillas de cerdo, tajo. tiene 20 año de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y con las ganancias que obtiene puede sacar adelante su hogar.

el sr. Petronilo C. tiene 65 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 14 hijos de los cuales solo 4 dependen de el. el se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular como ser frijoles, arroz, azucar, cafe, pastas, especias, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Langue.

la Sra. Maria Santos M. tiene 61 años de edad, es soltera y tuvo 6 hijos de los cuales todos ya estan casados, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular como ser aroz maiz, frijoles, manteca, jabones.

El Sr. Angel Z. tiene 64 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 6 hijos, el se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular como ser maiz, frijoles, arroz, azucar, lacteos, manteca, aceite, jabones, y otros productos de la canasta basica.

la sra. Balbina G. tiene 54 años de edad, viven en union libre y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales solo 4 dependen de ella, 
Balbina se dedica a la venta de baleadas, panqueques, cafe con leche, galletas, rosquillas, cereal, tamales, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. su mejor deseo es que sus hijos sean personas honorables.
texts.en:
El Buen Soldado (The Good Soldier) Solidarity Group consists of 5 members who have known each other for many years and have formed a very good friendship. Macaria I. is 59 years old, has a common-law marriage, and has 8 children, 2 of which are dependent upon her. Her other children are adults and are married, and they help her economically. Macaria sells pork, chicharrones, bacon, ribs, and slices of meat. She has been selling for the past 20 years and has gotten her family ahead with her earnings.

Petronilo C. is 65 years old, has a common-law marriage, and has 14 children, 4 of which depend on him. He sells popular consumer products such as beans, rice, sugar, coffee, pastas, and spices. His business is located in the municipal market in the city of Langue.

Maria Santos M. is 61 years old, single, and had 6 children, all of which are already married. She sells popular consumer products such as rice, corn, beans, butter, and soaps.

Angel Z. is 64 years old, is married, and has 6 children. He sells popular consumer products such as corn, beans, rice, sugar, dairy products, butter, oil, soaps, and other staples.

Balbina G. is 54 years old, has a common-law marriage, and has 7 children, 4 of which depend on her. Balbina sells baleadas, pancakes, coffee with milk, cookies, rosquillas, cereal, and tamales. She has been selling for many years. Her biggest dream is that her children become honorable people.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pork, avocados, beans, rice, coffee, corn, soap, bread, household cleaning products, toilet paper, lard, butter, salt, water, soda, flour, cheese, curd, churros, juice, tortillas, and candy.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Leonsia

texts.es: Maria Leonsia H. D. G. D. 41 años D. edad resiD. en San Luis Talpa en el departamento D. La Paz, junto a su esposo y sus tres hijas MatilD. D. 21 años, Maria D. 19 años y Bernarda D. 15 años, solo dos D. ellas siguen estudiando, ya que MatilD. se graduó D. bachillerato se encuentra trabajando dejando a un lado el estudio universitario que en este momento no pueD. cubrir su familia. Maria se dedica  a su negocio que es la elaboración D. ropa a la medida, tiene veinte años D. experiencia en el mismo, negocio con el cual ha logrado mantener  a su familia en el transcurso D. estos años, ahora Maria solicita un crédito para la compra D. tela con la cual pueda elaborar prendas para vender.
texts.en:
Maria Leonsia H. D. G. is 41 years old and lives in San Luis Talpa in the department of La Paz with his wife and three daughters. MatilD. is 21 years old, Maria is 19 years old, and Bernarda is 15 years old. Only two of them are studying, since MatilD. graduated from high school and is working. At this point, she is putting university studies to the siD. because her family can’t cover the costs. Maria makes custom-maD. clothing and has 20 years of experience in this business, which has helped her to be able to support her family over the years. Now Maria is asking for a loan for the purchase of fabric, which she will use to make clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Marta Leticia

texts.es:
la srita. Marta M. se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de nacatamales desde hace 5 años, desde niña le han gustado las ventas y asi fue como ella logro poner su negocio.
sus ventas las realiza frente al instituto hondureño de seguridad social IHSS, cuenta con muchos clientes fijos y tambien muchas personas transitan por este lugar. Marta ncesita el credito para comprar producto al por mayor como ser carne de cerdo, pollo, maiz, papas, codimentos, vasos, bolsas y asi obtener mayores ganancias.
ella no tiene hijos y es muy sociable y querida por sus clientes. ella tiene todos los deseos de superarse.
texts.en:
Marta M. has been making and selling nacatamales for the past 5 years. Since she was a child, she has liked sales and so it was like her to achieve opening her business. She makes her sales in front of the Instituto Hondureño de Seguridad Social – IHSS (Honduras Institute of Social Security). She has many regular customers and many people pass by this place. Marta needs the loan to purchase wholesale products such as pork, chicken, corn, potatoes, condiments, cups, and bags so that she can obtain larger earnings. She does not have any children and she is very sociable and is loved by her customers. She has every desire to improve herself.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de frijoles, arroz, aceite, azucar, refrescos, leche, queso, mantequilla, embutidos, jugos, pastas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: el sr. Gabriel D. se dedica al comercio, el sale a vender ropa americana usada a pueblos pesqueros como ser punta raton, cedeño, monjaras y pueblo nuevo, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. el ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y pagar los estudios de sus 4 hijos, tambien ha logrado comprar un terreno para construir una casa para su familia. el necesita el credito para comprar mas fardos de ropa y asi tener mas producto y obtener mas ganancias, en el futuro el desea comprar un carro para poder llevar mucha ropa a todos los diferentes pueblos que el visita porque ahora lo hace por medio de bus.
texts.en:
Gabriel D. dedicates himself to business. He sells used American clothing in fishing towns such as Punta Ratón, Cedeño, Monjaras, and Pueblo Nuevo. He has been doing this for 10 years. He has been able to help his family get ahead and pay for his 4 daughters’ studies. He has also been able to purchase land to build a house for his family. Gabriel needs the loan to purchase more bundles of clothing so that he has more products and obtains more earnings. In the future, he wants to buy a car to be able to bring a lot of clothing to the different towns that he visits because he currently does it by bus.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bundles of used clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow sweet potatoes

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La Sra. Marina P. tiene 27 años, está casada con el Sr. Luis Cabrera Flores, llevan tres años de casados. Tienen un bebe de 1 año de edad. 

La Sra. Marina lleva trabajando con ganado lechero 10 años, entrega todo lo que produce a una microempresa local que elabora productos lácteos para la venta en un mercado de la ciudad de Cbba. Empezó trabajando con su madre y poco a poco fue comprando su propio ganado para independizarse. Necesita del préstamo para poder comprar alimento de ganado debido a que debe almacenar para todo el año. Esto repercutirá en su producción ya que no tendrá escases de alimento y producirá mas leche para generar más ingresos. 
En un futuro desea comprar más vacas lecheras e incrementar sus ingresos para poder mejorar su casa y darle a su bebe una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marina P. is 27 years old, and she has been married to her husband, Mr. Luis Cabrera Flores, for three years. Marina has been working with dairy cattle for 10 years. She sells all of what she produces to a local microenterprise that produces dairy products that are then sold in the market in the city of Cochabamba. She started working with her mother, and little by little she began purchasing her own cattle to independence herself. She needs the loan to purchase feed in bulk that she can use for the entire year. This purchase will help improve her productivity as she will be able to protect against food shortages and thus will produce more milk that will allow her to generate more resources. In the future she would like to purchase more dairy cows and increase her earnings in order to improve her house and improve her baby's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Kreger, Kiva Staff

loans.use: To purchase feed for her dairy cow

loans.name: Vitalis Nyangoro

texts.en:
Vitalis Nyangoro is married with three children, ages 11, 6 and 1. He runs a charcoal wholesale store jointly with his wife, Pamela. He has been in this business for nine years, during which he has grown from a retailer to wholesaler.

A shortage of capital has been his main problem, and if he'd had the money, he thinks he would have opened more outlets. Lack of tangible security and other regulations prevented him from accessing a bank loan, after which a neighbor who is a KADET client informed him about the products KADET offers. 

He wishes to use the money from this loan to increase his stock of charcoal and consistently increase his ordering quantities, while still serving the retail market, which would increase his sales.  

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To increase stock of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Linet Moraa

texts.en: Linet Moraa is a thirty-two-year-old lady who is married with two children. She runs a wholesale and retail shop in Manyatta, a low-cost residential area in the outskirts of Kisumu City. Linet has been running this business for seven years. She sells mainly foodstuffs and household goods. Linet had been accessing small loans from an informal women's group, which disintegrated during the post-election violence in early 2008 and she was left with no other source of capital. She learned about KADET through a friend. She hopes to use the money from this loan to purchase more stock and include cereals in her shop to serve her customers better. In the long run, Linet hopes to build a permanent house on a plot of land which she has purchased and to move the business there, so that she would not have to pay rent and other related charges. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her store that sells foodstuffs and household goods

loans.name: Leidy Laura

texts.en:
When I visited Leidy at her home on Saturday, she impressed me with her enthusiasm and priD. in her business. Although Leidy has been working with Manuela Ramos for less than a year, she was chosen to be president of her communal bank, “Mujeres Perseverantes” (Persevering Women). Leidy sells beauty products, perfumes and undergarments from a variety of different catalog vendors. She has an impressive display case for her goods and a room dedicated to receiving customers.

Leidy plans to use this loan of 1,000 soles to purchase clothes in Lima to sell. In this way she will begin working on one of her goals, which is to have a boutique out of her home. She envisions this boutique as a “one-stop shop” where clients would be able to outfit themselves for any event. She hopes to sell not only beauty products and clothes, but also shoes, jewelry and gift items. Leidy also spoke to me about her desire to expand into new lines of products available by catalog.

Leidy is 29 years old, single, and has no children. She teaches English in a local school in the mornings and dedicates herself to her business in the afternoons. She is happy to have the support of her parents (with whom she lives) for her business ventures. She told me that her business is doing very well at the moment; she has a good clientele. Leidy very much enjoys her work and appears to have excellent business skills!

loans.use: To purchase clothes in Lima to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria purchased Parkside Postal three years ago to provide a neighborhood mail and shipping center for the community. Despite strong sales in her first two years, she is still unable to qualify for a loan from a bank. More recently, the recession has been hard on Gloria’s business, and she has been forced to draw down her savings to keep the business running.

Gloria knows many of her customers by name. The relationships she has built and the level of customer service that she provides are what set her apart from competitors. A $5,000 loan will help Gloria to invest in more marketing and renew her notary license in order to expand her customer base, increase business revenue, and endure the economic downturn.

loans.use: To improve and expand her postal supply store

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en:
“The thing I’ve learned is that you can’t wait for things to come to you,” says Katrina about her mobile massage company. Since losing her job at a spa when it closed down, she has focused on her own business working mostly with motorcyclists, racers, and mechanics recovering from injuries and surgery. Since her clients rarely seek out a massage therapist, Katrina has built partnerships with automotive businesses who bring her in to work on their employees. This niche market has enabled Katrina to establish a loyal customer base, but she needs to expand her client list in order to build a sustainable business.

A $3,000 loan will help Katrina buy a car to that she can travel to more businesses, and even raceways and other events, in order to expand beyond her current client base.

loans.use: Purchase a car in order to travel to more businesses/clients

loans.name: Susana Rosario

texts.en:
Susana is a member (and the official treasurer) of the communal bank “Mujeres Perseverantes” (Persevering Women) and lives in the city of Pucallpa. She helped to found her communal bank about two-and-a-half years ago. Susana sells beauty products, undergarments and shoes through catalog orders. She devotes herself to this business in the afternoons and teaches kindergarten in the mornings. Although Susana dedicates a lot of time to her work as a teacher (including creating lesson plans in the evening), her salary is quite low. Teachers are not very well paid in Pucallpa. She is happy to have a business venture with which to supplement her income.

With this loan of 2500 soles Susana plans to purchase more products for sale. Loans have helped her to expand both the number of products she has on hand and her clientele. Susana also hopes to buy a display window for her goods. Additionally, she is considering purchasing a permanent post in the market from which to sell her goods rather than conducting her business from home.

Susana and her husband have four children, aged 17, 15, 13 and 4. Susana’s husband works as an accountant at a timber enterprise. Her eldest daughter, who is studying environmental engineering, occasionally helps her with her business. Susana is also helping this daughter with her own little business venture doing manicures and pedicures.

Susana told me that her business has been doing well; her credit has helped it to grow quite a bit. In this short video clip Susana talks about her goals of continuing to expand her business, helping women to look and feel good, and ensuring that her children get a good education.

loans.use: More products for sale and a display case.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa tiene 50 años, esta casada con el Sr. Hernan verduguez, llevan 28 años de casados, tiene tres hijas, todas viven con ella. La mayor ayuda a la Sra. Rosa en el cuidado y en la alimentacion de las vacas lecheras, las otras dos acuden a la Universidad Mayor de San Simon.

La Sra. Rosa se dedica a la produccion de leche durante 30 años. Empezo a trabajar independientemente desde que era muy joven. Toda la produccion de leche entrega diariamente a una empresa local que elabora toda clase de productos lacteos. Necesita el prestamo para poder comprar mas alimento para su ganado lechero por que ya no tiene mucho. 

La Sra. Rosa quiere mejorar su produccion de leche. En un futuro desea comprar mas vacas lecheras para incrementar su produccion y asi mejorar sus ingresos para poder ayudar a sus hijas en el estudio.
texts.en:
Rosa, 50, has been married to Hernan Verdugues for 38 years. They have three daughters who live with them. The oldest helps Rosa take care of and feed the dairy cows. The other two attend the Universidad Mayor in San Simon. Rosa has been working in milk production for 30 years. She started to work independently when she was very young. Every day she takes all of her milk production to a local business that makes all kinds of dairy products. She needs the loan to be able to buy food for her dairy cows because they do not have much now. Rosa wants to improve her milk production. In the future she wishes to buy more dairy cows to increase her production and improve her income. Then she will be able to help her daughters with their education

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food for dairy cows

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Cliente joven, que trabaja como albañil encofradora en una Empresa Constructora, actualmente se encuentra en la obra del hospìtal de Los Pinos, posteriormente cambiara a otra construcción de la zona de Sopocachi. Ella tiene un hijo pequeño en edad escolar, sus padres le cedieron en herencia un terreno en la zona de codavisa donde ella esta construyendo su vivienda, pero por el momento se encuentra ocupando dos habitaciones en la casa de su mamá. ella trabaja en ese oficio desde hace cuatro años, por su actividad y por la recomendación de su hermana quien es cliente nuestra se le atiende con esa actividad.según referencias ella es una persona responsable.
texts.en:
One of our younger clients, Juana is a formwork mason for a construction company. She is currently working on a project for the Hospital de Los Pinos, and will then move to a different construction site in the Sopocachi district. She has a young son who is of school age. She inherited from her parents a plot of land in the Codavisa district, where she is building a house. At the moment, she and her son occupy two rooms in her mother’s house. She has been in her line of work for four years. Her sister, who is also one of our clients, recommended that she pursue this profession. According to her references, Juana is a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for her house

loans.name: Sol De Tihuanacu Group

texts.es: “Sol D. Tihuanaku” es una asociación que pertenece al Centro Focal “Juan Pablo II”, con 11 integrantes. Su presidenta es  Isabel D. quien las organiza para asistir al consultorio y hacerse un examen general. Una D. las integrantes es Margarita B., que tiene el negocio D. venta D. mantas y polleras, en L. feria “16 D. Julio” una D. las más grandes del país. ElL. cuenta que se agruparon por L. necesidad  D. contar con un capital D. trabajo para hacer crecer sus negocios, bajo L. garantía solidaria ya que en otras entidades financieras les piden garantías reales. Al igual que Margarita todas tienen sus propios negocios como L. venta D. pasteles, comida, ropa, artículos en cuero, abarrotes y tejido a mano y requieren del préstamo para L. compra D. mercadería e insumos.
texts.en:
"Sol D. Tihuanacu" (Sun of Tihuanacu) is an association with 11 members that is part of the "Juan Pablo II" Community Center. Its president is Isabel D. who organized the group in order to access Pro Mujer's health services, including a general exam. One of the group's members is Margarita B., who owns a business selling ponchos and skirts in the "16 D. Julio" street market, one of the largest in the country. She counts on the group because it provides her with the necessary capital in order to grow her business under a joint guarantee, while other financial entities would require a real guarantee. Just like Maria, all of the other group members have their own businesses selling items such as pies, meals, clothing, leather goods, groceries, and handwoven goods, and they require a loan in order to buy merchandise and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise and Supplies

loans.name: Bricelda Evangelina

texts.es:
la joven Bricelda P. se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de pan, como ser semitas, galletas, quequitos y tortas, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, sus clientes la prefieren porque el sabor de sus panes es muy bueno ademas que es muy aseada en la forma que elabora su producto. ella en estos momentos desea invertir dinero en comprar varias camisas de la seleccion nacional de futbol de honduras, ya que para las eliminatorias y la copa oro se venden mucho este tipo de producto, y tambien se le saca buena ganancias, en estos momentos ella tiene pero necesita comprar mas al por mayor para poder tener una buena venta, por tal razon esta solicitando el credito.
ella es madre soltera y ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos que estan pequeños de edad.
texts.en:
Bricelda P. makes and sells baked goods such as semitas (Honduran bread rolls), cookies, cupcakes and regular sized cakes. She has been in this line of business for 5 years. Her customers prefer her baked goods because they taste good and are neatly prepared.

At the moment, Bricelda would like to invest in Honduran national soccer team jerseys. Since the Gold Cup playoffs are in progress, she wants to sell this type of product because it can generate good revenue. She currently has a few jerseys on hand, but she would like to buy more at wholesale prices to maximize her profits. This is why she is requesting a loan.

She is a single mother who has managed to get ahead for the sake of her young children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy national soccer (futbol) team jerseys

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Familia Unida Group

texts.en:
The members of the Familia Unida ('United Family') Communal Bank are involved in various businesses. They are taking out their third loan, and have always been very responsible and punctual in repaying in the past. Their businesses incluD. selling construction materials, legal coca leaves, school materials, beer, cloth for t-shirts, fruit, and other things, plus a food store and teaching brick-laying. They all live in the Ciudadela Ferroviaria area, in a tight-knit community.

Vicky sells salchipapas, a Bolivian meal maD. of sausage and French fries. She would like to buy more potatoes and meat with her loan so she can invest her profits into books and education for her children. She says of them, "As far as I can, I’ll help them. I want them to study and do something in life.”

Juanita has two stores. In one, she sells soft drinks and food, and in the other she sells building materials. She would like a loan to restock products that she needs. Before she had access to capital, she just had a small juice stand. She has two children and says that the loan helps them, especially since one is in college. She wants her children to become professionals and she hopes to enlarge her hardware shop.

Elsa has a flower stand in La Paz. It used to be her mother’s, but Elsa has been running it for five years, ever since her mother passed away. She would like a loan to buy more flowers from Cochabamba (a city about six hours from La Paz) and the Yungas (the rainforest three hours from La Paz) to sell at the stand. Previous loans have allowed her to sell more and Elsa says she now has a higher income and can buy more food for her four boys, three of whom are students. With this loan, she would like to expand her store, with the eventual goal of opening her own flower store downtown, where she could also make and sell flower arrangements and decorations.

Claudia sells clothes and would like a loan as more capital. She has one little daughter, and she says that all she hopes is that her daughter doesn’t lack anything growing up, since “it’s all for her.”

Ruddy is a young man who designs advertisements on his computer for various companies, and sells them to television channels. Ruddy would like to improve his computer. With the profits from his business, he hopes to pay for his studies in computer engineering at the military university. He enjoys the military university a lot for its discipline, and the punctuality and respect it requires. He is looking forward to starting his career when he graduates in five years.

The president, Mrs Maritzabel T., runs her own TV show called "Tropical Rainbow." She is very hardworking and gave a speech telling her group to be responsible.

loans.use: To improve equipment and use as capital

loans.name: Nidia Sabina

texts.es: La Señora Nidia Sabina López es cliente de Fundación León 2000. Es madre soltera, tiene 57 años y 1 hijo que depende de ella. Es por eso que Nidia se esfuerza muy duro con esta actividad económica. El ser una madre responsable, la motivo para iniciar con este negocio, y poco a poco fue suministrándole los productos que se utilizan para uso diario y cotidiano. En la actualidad sus clientes recurren a su pulpería por su buena atención y por encontrar lo necesario. Con este financiamiento comprara golosinas, jugos, refrescos naturales, pan y gaseosa. Su mayor deseo es que su pequeña pulpería se convierta en una mini distribuidora que sea mucho más favorable para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nidia Sabina López has been a client of the Fundación León since 2000. She is a 57 year old single mother with one dependent son. He is the reason Nidea puts forth so much effort into her work. Being a responsible mother is what motivated her to start this business. Little by little she was supplying her business with daily use products. Her customers currently go to her mini market for her good service and to find what they need. With this loan she will buy sweets, juice, natural drinks, bread, and soft drinks. Her biggest desire is to change her small store into being a mini distributor, which would be much more favorable for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marta Leticia

texts.es: la sra. Marta tiene una pequeña pulperia, en la cual vende productos basicos de consumo diario como ser arroz, azucar, frijoles, refrescos, entre otros. su negocio esta ubicado en la colonia San Francisco, su negocio lo abre desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, tambien ella en su negocio hace golosinas para vender como ser tacos, enchiladas, tajadas de platano fritas y pastelitos. ella necesita el credito para comprar mas productos al por mayor y asi obtener mejores ganancias, ella se mueve dos veces por semana al mercado a comprar su producto, nos cuenta ella que su mayor deseo es poder terminar de construir su casa, ella es muy amable y siempre atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa.
texts.en:
Marta has a small general store where she sells basic products of daily consumption such as rice, sugar, beans, soft drinks, and others. Her business is located in the San Francisco neighborhood; she opens her business at 7 in the morning and closes at 10 at night. She also makes snacks to sell in her business like tacos, enchiladas, fried plantains, and pastries. She needs a loan to purchase more products wholesale to be able to obtain better earnings; she travels twice a week to the market to purchase her products. She tells us that her biggest wish is to be able to finish building her house. She is very friendly and always attends to her clients with a smile.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beans, churros, soft drinks, juices, canned goods, pastas, canned soups, sugar, rice, milk, coffee, cookies, bread, candies, lard, butter, tortillas, and margarine.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fuente De Vida (Fountain Of Life) Group

texts.es: En el Centro  Focal “Panamericana” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Fuente de vida”  con  aproximadamente 9 años de vida y tiene 10 integrantes, en su mayoría se dedican al tejido de chompas (con máquina o  a mano) y en esta época de invierno les va bastante bien porque tienen demanda y necesitan del préstamo para la compra de lana y en algunos casos comprar maquinaría, otras se dedican a la venta de verduras, y también necesitan el préstamo para la comprar mercadería  como cebolla, zanahoria, zapallo y nabo.
texts.en:
In the "Panamericana" Community Center you will find the "Fuente de vida" (Fountain of Life) Communal Assocation, which has been established for approximately 9 years. The association has 10 members, the majority of whom make a living knitting jackets (with machines or by hand). This wintertime, things are going well enough for them because there is demand for their products, so they need a loan in order to buy more wool and in some cases to buy machinery. Other group members make a living selling vegetables, and they also need a loan in order to buy their merchandise such as onions, carrots, pumpkins, and turnips.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials, Merchandise, and Supplies

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: La señora de nombre María José R. tiene la edad de 29 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es ofrecer los servicios de agencia de viaje. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio por cuenta propia, ya que necesitaba un medio de ingresos para su familia, a pesar de la corta edad de María ha logrado obtener experiencia en su negocio, ya que antes nadie confiaba en ella,  y temía enfrentar el mayor desafío que alguien estableciera este mismo negocio. Pero ha superado las dificultades que se le presentan y es por medio de este trabajo que ha logrado ofrecerles a sus hijos el pan de cada día. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de papelería, computadoras entre otras cosas. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
María José R. is 29 years old. She is a single mother and has 2 children under her care. She has been offering travel agency services for more than 5 years. She started the business on her own because she needed a means of income for her family. Despite being young, María has been able to obtain experience with her business. Before, people were not confident in her and she feared the biggest challenge that someone else would establish the same business. However, she has overcome the difficulties that she has been presented with and it is through this job that she has been able to offer her children bread every day. She is asking for a loan for working capital for the purchase of stationery and computers, among other items. Her biggest dream is for her children to complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: 5 De Junio Group

texts.en:
The "Fifth of June" group is made up of twelve women, the majority of whom live in the Villa Dolores zone. This zone is characterized by one-story adobe homes.

The board of this group is made up of Mrs. Esperanza C. M., Mrs. Rosmery C. L. and Mrs. Carmen Rosa T. A.. The majority of women in this group are tailors, shawl knitters, store keepers, food makers, and vegetable sellers in the very competitive market. Also, some members sell hardware material, books, legal coca leaves, and backpacks.

The women need loans to buy material for their businesses, which is in some cases cloth, thread, and wool. They are very excited to work with AgroCapital and recently approached the institution to ask for their first loan. The majority of the women all know each other, and it is a very happy group.

loans.use: additional business capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 3 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en la Parcialidad de Quicañamayo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  el cual utilizó para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor (para engorde y cría).

Su deseo es seguir trabajando con ganado mayor.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoria is a member of the community bank "Manuela de Hoy" (Today's Manuela) that is located in the La Llave district, Province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 43 years old, married and mother of 3 children. She has finished secondary school and lives in the area of Quicañamayo. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 5 years. Her first loan was for 300 new soles which she used for the purchase of small livestock. At this time she is in need of a loan of 1200 new soles for the purchase of small livestock (to fatten up and raise). Her wish is to continue working with large livestock. She likes the easiness of the loan process.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock for fattening up.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Gracsa Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Gracsa está conformado por María Isabel Chávez M. y Eligia María D. Chávez ambas con diferentes actividades económicas. María tiene 49 años, su actividad económica es la venta de nacatamales. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que dio inicio por cuenta propia, ya anteriormente su esposo le ayudaba con esta actividad, y fue por la forma tan dinámica que el poseía para ofrecer los nacatamales de María que obtuvo los clientes. Pero María tenía problemas respiratorios, debido al humo. Pero a pesar de este tipo de dificultades por las que enfrento no la detuvieron para que siguiera adelante con su negocio, y fue con la ayuda de María que decidieron realizar mejoras para sus negocio. La Señora Eligia tiene 32 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Decide incursionar en negocio por su amiga María Isabel ya que ella le ayudo al inicio con muy pocos productos como perfumes, calzado y cremas. Por lo que poco a poco fue que logro independizarse y obtener su propia actividad. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo en invertir el dinero en la compra de nuevos productos. El sueño que las dos comparten es preparar a sus hijos para que no sufran todas las cosas por las que ellas atravesaron.
texts.en:
The Group Solidario Gracsa is formed by Maria Isabel M. and Eligia María D. Chávez. Both of them have different businesses. Maria is 49 years old, her business is the selling of nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales). She has been working in this business for over 10 years. She began selling on her own and her husband helped her with this activity. It was Maria's dynamic personality and her way of selling her nacatamales that gained her many loyal customers. But Maria had respiratory problems due to the smoke.Despite the difficulties she faced, she carried on with her business and decided to make improvements to her business. Eligia is 32 years old, she is a married woman with 2 children. She sells cosmetics and has been working in this business for more than 9 years. She decided to start her business because of her friend Maria Isabel, who also helped her to start with a few products like perfumes, shoes and creams. Little by little she was able to gain her independence and run the business on her own. The loan is for working capital to buy new products. Both women share the dream of preparing their children so that they will not suffer the things that they themselves have suffered.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for their businesses

loans.name: Bilma

texts.es:
la sra. BILMA B. C. se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es de la venta de carne (carniceria ) y tambien tiene comedor, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace (8) años, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de carniceria Zelaya.
Doña Bilma es casada y su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, del matrimonio ya no depende ninguno de sus hijos ya que todos ellos trabajan y tienen sus hogares formados.
el local donde tiene su negocio es apto para consumir toda su variedad de comidas ya que es un lugar muy higienico y de ambiente agradable. 
Con los ingresos que genera el negocio ella cubre un 100% sus gastos del hogar. 
Doña Bilma, nos comento que con su negocio logro educar a sus hijos con carreras universitarias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bilma B. C. works selling meat at her butcher shop, where she also has a small restaurant. She has been running her business, called the "Zelaya Butcher Shop," for the past 8 years. Bilma is married, and her husband buys and sells cows. All of her children now have jobs of their own and their own families, so none of them depend on their parents for support anymore. Her business is an ideal place to consume different kinds of food, since it is very hygienic and has a pleasant atmosphere. The income she generates with this business pays for 100% of her household expenses. Bilma tells us that thanks to her business, she has been able to provide her children with a college education. She will use this loan to buy beef, chicken and pork for her butcher shop.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beef, chicken and pork

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Agua De La Vida Group

texts.en:
Agua D. la Vida is maD. up of twelve women who know each other well and live in the southern zone of the city which is characterized by single story adobe homes.

The board of the group is maD. up of Mrs. Celestina C. C., Mrs. Griselda T. U. and Mrs. Maxima M. D. O.. The majority of women in this group are seamstresses, shawl knitters, storekeepers, and potato, condiments, hardware material, and vegetable sellers in the city market. One member is a salaried driver. The giant outdoor market is a competitive and chaotic place, but the women have confidence that their businesses can keep up with the competition.                       

The women would like a loan to buy materials for their businesses, which in some cases incluD. cloth, thread, and wool. Agua D. Vida is a friendly group that is very excited to be taking out their very first loan with AgroCapital.

loans.use: To buy material for businesses.

loans.name: Jacinta Isabel

texts.es:
La señora  Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Chimu, el distrito D. Puno, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 51 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, y es madre D. 6 hijos.  Tiene estudios D. primaria completa, vive en La Comunidad D. Chimu Barrio Progreso Sector Calcota.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace casi 7 años,  con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la elaboración D. quesanas (tipo D. esteras).

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. material totora y chillihua (árboles), para la fabricación D. quesanas (tipo D. esteras), para vender en las minas, allí las compran para protegerse D. las bajas temperaturas.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.
A ella le gustan los ahorros y las forma D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel is a member of the "Las Totoritas" Village Bank, located in Chimu Community of Puno Department/Province. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. She completed primary school, and currently lives in the Calcota sector of the Progreso neighborhood. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost 7 years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, and she used it to make "quesanas," a type of rush mat. She currently needs a loan of 2,700 soles to buy totora reeds and chillihua wood to make her quesanas, which she will then sell in mines to the workers, who use the mats to protect themselves from the cold temperatures. She hopes to continue working in the future. She appreciates the savings accounts and working methods of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chillihua wood and totora reeds to make rush mats

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en el Centro Poblado de Rosa Cani Sector Mamani Allachaya.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de ganado mayor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor (ovinos) ella los compra en las comunidades de la zonas, para luego venderlos en las ferias del lugar.

Su deseo es poder comprar mayor cantidad de ganado y poder vender al por mayor.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones de los Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa belongs to the "Manuela de Hoy" Village Bank, located in Ilave District of El Collao, Puno Department. She is 20 years old and single; she doesn't have any children. She has a high school education, and currently lives in Mamani Allachaya Sector of the Rosa Cani Community. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past year. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used to buy livestock. She is currently requesting a loan of 800 soles to buy sheep in her local area, which she will later sell at area markets. She likes her savings accounts and her village bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Solucion Group

texts.es: “Solución” es un grupo de 15 señoras que se reúnen alegremente para llevar adelante su reunión a la cabeza de su presidenta Antonia A., quien comenta que tiene el negocio de panadería y requiere del crédito para comprar harina, azúcar y sal  y de esta manera expandirse en el mercado con  más productos. Al igual que Antonia las demás socias tienen sus propios  negocios como la venta de ropa, atención de fotocopia, tienda de barrio, venta de fruta y costura de chamarras y necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería, insumos y herramientas de trabajo. A todas les agrada mucho capacitarse sobre todo en temas como la mora, central de riesgo porque les hace reflexionar.
texts.en:
Solución is a group of 15 women who happily get together to move forward. Antonia A. is the president. She has a bakery, and she needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, and salt. This way she can expand her business with more products in the market. The rest of the members, like Antonia, have their own businesses. They do things like sell clothes, provide photocopy service, have a neighborhood store, sell fruit, and make jackets. They need a loan to buy merchandise, supplies, and working tools. All of them are very pleased with the trainings, especially about late payments. This is a risk that causes them to reflect.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, supplies, and working tools

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Unidas” esta representado por la señora Angela y conformado por 12 miembros dentro de los cuales se encuentra un parentesco familiar entre la señora Maria y su primo el señor Huascar, ambos cuentan con ingresos totalmente independientes por lo que no representa un riego para el grupo. Una mayoría de las socias se dedica a la venta de productos como la comida, cosméticos por catálogos, pan, ropa y juguetes. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es bastante alta pero la dedicación y las ganas de trabajar son las que prevalecen ante la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la  adquisición de mercadería, insumos, materiales y para la ampliación de sus puestos de venta que les permitirá generar un  mejor ingreso para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En general los miembros del grupo cuenta con experiencia gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen la modalidad de trabajo así como la responsabilidad y compromiso que se requiere para recibir un apoyo económico para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The “Unidas” (United) Group is represented by Angela and consists of 12 members. Two of those members, Maria and Huascar, are cousins, but they each have incomes completely independent of each other and so they do not pose a risk to the group. A majority of the group members make a living selling products such as food, mail-order cosmetics, bread, clothing, and toys. Their competence in the commercial environment is high enough, but their dedication and willingness to work are the factors that truly prevail above the competition. This loan will be used for the acquisition of merchandise, supplies, materials, and for the expansion of their storefronts, which will allow the group to earn higher incomes to provide their families with a better quality of life. In general the members of the group have experience thanks to financing from entities similar to the Agrocapital Foundation and so they understand the process as well as the responsibility and commitment required of them in order to receive financial support for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Operations

loans.name: 23 De Diciembre Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "23 D. Diciembre" estan representadas por la señora Yaneth y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales presentan un nexo consanguíneo entre la señora Yaneth y su hija Lizeth ambas con ingresos y actividades independientes. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es bastante alta pero la dedicación y las ganas D. trabajar son las que prevalecen ante la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la  adquisición D. mercadería, insumos, materiales y para la ampliación D. sus puestos D. venta que les permitirá generar un  mejor ingreso para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En general los miembros del grupo cuenta con experiencia gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo así como la responsabilidad y compromiso que se requiere para recibir un apoyo económico para sus negocios.
texts.en:
Yaneth represents the 23 D. Diciembre Community Bank, which is comprised of 12 members. Two of the members are related, Yaneth and her daughter, Lizbeth. They have separate activities and incomes. The competition in the business arena is pretty high, but their dedication and their desire to work prevail over the competition. The loan is to acquire merchandise, supplies, and materials to expand their sales locations, which will allow them to generate better income to give their families a better quality of life. The members of the group generally have experience thanks to loans with entities similar to the Foundation Agrocapital. Hence, they know the way to work, how to be responsible, and the commitment that is required to receive a loan for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amigas Del Espinal Group

texts.en:
The Amigas D. Espinal loan group is maD. up of 14 women, the majority of whom live in the Villa Dolores zone, which is filled with one-story adobe homes.

The group is governed by a board that is maD. up of Mrs. Juana H. , Mrs. Paulina S. C. and Mrs. Grecia AyD. M.. These women run a variety of businesses, including selling bed covers, food, dough, condiments, shawls, dessert fillings and cleaning cloths. One member even has an auto repair shop.
 
The women need loans to buy material and wares for their businesses. They are excited to be taking out their fourth loan with AgroCapital. Most of the women know each other and have experience working together from their previous three loans. They are a very hard-working group of happy people who would like to grow their businesses in order to proviD. a better life for their families.

loans.use: To expand several small businesses

loans.name: Gladis Argentina

texts.es:
la sra. GLADIS ARGENTINA M. M. se dedica a la venta de variedades como ser Ropa y una gran variedad de calzado para adulto y niño(a), tambien vende camisas, aritos, carteras, pantalones, colas y otra variedad de prodructos, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de variedades "M.".  se encuentra ubicado en el Barrio Abajo de Danlí, Gladis cuenta con varios años de experiencia en 
este tipo de negocio, tiene muy buena clientela por la humildad y la buena persona que es, el negocio de ella se encuentra en un buen punto estrategico donde tiene varios clientes que gracias a los mismos le han podido generar mas ingresos para su vida y asi poder contar con el apoyo de sus familiares que la rodean. 
Es Casada tiene  36 años de edad y sus hijos estan cursando Educacion Primaria y secundaria, gracias a los ingresos persibe de su negocios a mejorado su nivel de vida, actualmente ella esta solicitando un credito para surtir un poco mas su negocio y asi poder ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladis Argentina M. M. sells a variety of clothing and shoes for adults and children. The merchandise she offers includes shirts, earrings, wallets, pants, formalwear and other products. Her variety store is called M. and is located in the downtown neighborhood of Danlí. Gladis has several years of experience in this line of business. Due to her humble and good-natured personality, she has been able to attract and maintain a variety of regular customers. She is grateful for their patronage which has allowed her to generate an income and for the support of family members who surround her.

She is 36 years old and married. Her children attend primary and secondary schools. Thanks to the income from her business, she has been able to improve her standard of living. She is requesting a loan to restock her business so that she can continue offering customers a wide variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mensi

texts.es:
La señora Mensi, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Puerta”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella.
