loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La sra. Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera  y madre de 04 hijos  y no tiene estudios, vive en el Jr. Las Kanteras s/n.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 06 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para su negocio de venta de comida. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de arroz, fideos, aceite, papa, etc. Para la preparación de comida.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para solventar los gastos familiares.

A ella le gustan las reuniones, las charlas y los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Mercedes belongs to the "Medalla Milagrosa" Communal Bank, which is located in the Pomata district in the province of Chucuito in the Puno area. She is 53 years old and is a single mother with 4 children. She has not had an education and she lives on Jr. Las Kanteras Street. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 6 years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used in her food-selling business. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 600 nuevos soles to buy rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, etc. for food preparation. Her wish is to continue working to settle family expenses. She likes gatherings, chats and meetings between Communal Banks.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Graciela Lucina

texts.es:
La señora Graciela Lucina H. C. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene 2 hijos, de 20 y 17 años de edad, quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
Graciela se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza , los cuales vende a sus amistades y familiares.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró materiales como: telas, pinturas, hilos, cintas, etc, para realizar manualidades como carteras, tapetes, almohadas, etc.
El crédito de 1700 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza . Así como también en la compra de materiales como: telas, pinturas, algodón, lana, etc para realizar sus manualidades como: carteras, almohadas, tapetes, mantas, etc.
texts.en:
Graciela Lucina H. C. is 41 years old and lives in the Moche district in the province of Trujillo in the area of La Libertad, Peru. The businesswoman has completed her studies through the 5th year of secondary school and has 2 children who are 20 and 17 years old, who depend on her financially. Graciela works in the sale of beauty products, which she sells to friends and family. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she bought materials such as fabric, paint, thread, ribbons, etc. to make handicrafts such as wallets, tablecloths, pillows, etc. She will invest the loan of 1,700 nuevos soles in the purchase of beauty products as well as materials such as fabric, cotton, wool, etc. to make handicrafts such as wallets, pillows, tablecloths, blankets, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and materials for handicrafts.

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
La señora Yola, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Pomata, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 57 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, es madre D. 02 hijos y tiene estudios primaria completa, vive en el Jr. Odria s/n.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 6 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra D. harina para elaboración D. pan. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. harina e insumos para preparación D. pan, negocio que actualmente maneja.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando, para mejorar en su vida junto con su familia.

A ella le gustan las charlas y los encuentros.
texts.en:
Yola belongs to the "Medalla Milagrosa" Communal Bank, which is located in the Pomata district in the province of Chucuito in the Puna area. She is 57 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. She has completed her primary school studies and lives on Jr. Odria Street. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 6 years. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to buy flour to make bread. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy flour and supplies for bread making, a business which she currently manages. Her wish is to continue working in order to make a better life for her family. She likes the bank's chats and meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour for making bread.

loans.name: Francisca Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Francisca Elsa F. C. tiene 57 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, Provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria.
Francisca se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como: cremas, labiales, perfumes, talco, etc, los cuales los distribuye en puestos de sus amistades y también los vende directamente a sus familiares y amistades.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro mas productos de belleza para aumentar su stock y poder vender con mayor facilidad y frecuencia.
Este crédito de 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos de belleza (cremas, perfumnes, talcos).
Francisca sueña con tener un puesto en algún centro comercial o mercado, para vender ropa para niños, jóvenes y adultos. Así como también para vender sus productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Francisca Elsa F. C. is 57 years old and lives in the district of Moche, which is in the Trujillo province of the department of La Libertad, Perú. This entrepreneur has finished schooling through the fifth level of secondary school. Francisca sells beauty products such as: lotion, chapstick, perfume, talcum powder, etc., which she distributes to her friends' market stands. She also sells directly to friends and family. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought more beauty products to increase her stock and be able to sell with ease and more frequently. This loan of 500 PEN will be invested in the purchase of more beauty products (lotion, perfume, talcum powder). Francisca dreams of having a stand in a commercial center or market, to sell clothes for children, adolescents, and adults as well as her beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products such as: lotion, chapstick, perfume, talcum powder

loans.name: Albina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Albina Isabel A. D. V., tiene 51 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º D. secundaria, tiene 6 hijos, pero solo 1 hija depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Albina se dedica a la venta D. gaseosas y galletas en su domicilio.
Este crédito D. 300 soles,lo invertirá en la compra D. galletas y gaseosas.
Albina tiene como sueño tener una tienda D. abarrotes en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Albina Isabel A. D. V. is 51 years old and lives in the district of Moche, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Perú. This businesswomen has completed school until the fifth year of secondary school. She has 6 children, but only one daughter who is financially depentent on her. Albina sells soda and cookies and her home. The loan for 300 soles will be use to buy cookies and soda. Albina dreams of having a grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies and soda

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
La señora María Fernanda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. D. Guadalupe”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 64 años y es madre 07 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes y con familia.

Lleva 12 años, dedicándose a la venta D. pescado fresco, queriendo aportar en su familia con los ingresos económicos, contando para esto con un capital D. S/. 600.00 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedad D.  especies. Su negocio se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central, un puesto muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprará pescado fresco en kilos tanto los que produce la región como los D. la costa del país como: bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey para así mantener surtido su negocio y satisfacer el exigente gusto D. su clientela. 

María Fernanda, nos manifiesta su satisfacción por pertenecer muchos años a un grupo D. mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Fernanda belongs to the “Our Lady of Guadalupe” Community Bank in the district of Bellavista, in the province of Bellavista, in the department of San Martín. She is married, is 64 years old, and is the mother of 7 children, all of whom are now independent and have their own families. She has spent 12 years selling fresh fish. She wants to proviD. for her family with her income, including capital of 600 soles, which was invested very well. Because of this, today she continues with the same business, but now with larger quantities and varieties of fish. Her business is located in the central market, in a stand that is very well-equipped to take care of her clients. With this loan of 1000 soles, she will buy many kilos of fresh fish, which are produced in the region, including those from the country’s coast, like bocachico, pomfrets, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, and pejerey, to keep her business stocked and to satisfy the demands of her clients. María Fernanda is satisfied to have spent many years in a group of women that have helped her overcome difficulties that she went through, but was able to confront with a lot of strength.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kilos of fresh fish, including bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, and pejerey

loans.name: Betty Adela

texts.es:
La señora Betty Adela A. Azabache, tiene 52 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º D. secundaria, tiene 10 hijos y 5 dependen económicamente D. ella porque se encuentran estudiando.
Betty se dedica a la crianza D. animales como: cerdos, ovejas, cuyes, vacas para luego venderlos.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo utilizo para comprar mas animales y posteriormente venderlos.
El crédito D. 300 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. mas animales (cerdos, ovejas).
Betty sueña con aumentar la crianza y comercialización D. sus animales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Betty Adela A. Azabache is 52 years old, she lives in the district of Moche, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru.

The entrepreneur studied until 5th graD., has 10 children, 5 still economically dependent on her as they are studying.

Betty breeds animals such as pigs, lamb, guineapigs, and cows which she later sells. With the first loan of 300 nuevos soles she bought animals which she later sold. The loan of 300 nuevos soles will be spent on buying more animals (pigs, lamb). It is Betty's dream to increase the number of animals and market them.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals to breed and sell.

loans.name: Yovani

texts.es:
La Señora Yovani R. D. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene 4 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
Yovani se dedica a la venta de menús en un puesto frente al hospital de essalud de Moche.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles, compro insumos como: arroz, fideos, menestras, azúcar, papas, etc para la preparación de menús.
El crédito de 700 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mas insumos para la preparación de sus menús.
Yovani sueña con ampliar su local y modificar su infraestructura.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yovani R. D. is 45 years old, she lives in the district of Moche, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru.

The entrepreneur studied until 5th grade, she has 4 children who are economically dependent on her. Yovani sells food from a stall in front of the hospital of Moche.

With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles she bought ingredients such as rice, pasta, vegetable stew, sugar, potatoes, etc. to prepare her menus. The loan of 700 soles will be invested in buying more supplies for the preparation of her menus. Yovani dreams of extending her stall and remodel it.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Diana Maribel

texts.es:
L. señora Diana Maribel F. D. L. C., tiene 24 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. L. Libertad, Perú.
L. empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º D. secundaria, tiene 2 hijos quines dependen económicamente D. elL..
Diana se dedica a L. venta D. ropa y edredones que trae D. L. ciudad D. Lima para vender a sus amistades y familiares.
El crédito D. 300 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en L. compra D. edredones (ropa D. cama) y prendas D. vestir pra niños, y adultos.
Diana sueña con tener un puesto en el mercado D. Moche para vender ropa y edredones al por mayor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Diana Maribel F. D. L. C. is 24 years old, she lives in the district of Moche, province of Trujillo, department of L. Libertad, Peru.

The entrepreneur studied until 5th graD., she has 2 children who are economically dependent on her. For a living Diana sells clothing and quilts which she gets from the city of Lima to sell among friends and relatives.

The loan of 300 nuevos soles will be spent on buying quilts (bedclothes), and garments for children and adults. Diana dreams of having a stall at the market of Moche for wholesale of clothes and quilts.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and bedclothes.

loans.name: Julia Ines

texts.es:
La señora Julia Ines S. D. M. tiene 73 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6º D. primaria, tiene 1 hija D. 32 años D. edad quien no depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Julia se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, pollo, gaseosas, jugos, entre otros, en la tienda D. su casa.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles compro 2 vitrinas para poder colocar sus productos.
El crédito D. 500 nuevos soles,  lo invertirá en la compra D. mas abarrotes, como: huevos, embutidos, detergentes, papel higiénico para la tienda que tiene instalada en su casa.
Julia considera que Manuela Ramos la apoyó a iniciar y crecer su negocio por lo cual esta muy agradecida.
Julia sueña con ampliar su tienda y poder vender también juguetes, adornos y ropa.
texts.en:
Mrs.Julia Ines S. D. M. is 73 years old and lives in the Moche district, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad in Peru. This businesswoman had finished through the 6th year of primary school and has a 32 year old daughter that no longer depends on her financially. Julia sells groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, chicken, sodas, juices among others, in a store at her home. With her first loan of 300 new soles she bought cabinets for her products. The loan for 500 new soles will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise such as eggs, sausages, detergents, toilet paper, for the store in her home. Julia believes that Manuela Ramos supported her in starting her business for which she is very grateful. Julia dreams of enlarging her store and being able to sell toys, decorations and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise such as eggs, sausages, detergents, toilet paper, for the store in her home.

loans.name: Yackeline Karen

texts.es:
Yackeline, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chimu, el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 18 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos. Esta estudiando Educación superior y vive  en la Comunidad de Chimu Central. 

Es socia nueva, y requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles para iniciar su negocio de venta de artesanías en totora (planta de la zona), así ella podrá ayudarse en sus estudios.

Su deseo es poder culminar sus estudios y así poder también ayudar en su casa.
A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos y la confraternidad que hay en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Yackeline is a member of the Community Bank "Las Totoritas" located in the Chimu community, Puno district, Puno province and department. She is 18 years old, single and without children. She is studying for an advanced degree and lives in the Community of Chimu Central. She is a new member and is in need of a loan of 500 New Soles to start her business of selling crafts made from totora (a reed that grows in the area), and this way she will be able to help finance her studies. Her wishes are to be able to finish her studies and also help in her home. She likes the easiness of the loan process and the fellowship that exists at the Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make mats (quesanas)

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer: Grupo 8 Group

texts.en:
Renata R., 38, is looking forward to taking out her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use the funds to expand a home-operated beauty salon she managed to fund herself. Now, with an inside knowledge of her customers’ preferences, she will use her loan to sell beauty products door-to-door in her neighborhood.

Looking ahead, Renata plans to use her new income to both continue taking out future loans to expand her business, and to provide benefits for her two children, Jose (12) and Katherine (14), who already attend school.

Renata is Coordinator of the newly formed solidarity group “Nuevo Renacer” (“New Rebirth”), pictured above. From left to right: Yessi, Evelin, Renata, Juana and Carmen.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to sell door-to-door

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora  Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chimu, el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 46 años de edad, estado civil casada, y es madre de 4 hijos (3 a su cargo) y tiene estudios de primaria completa, vive en La Comunidad de Chimu Central.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela R. hace casi 4 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la elaboración de artesanías en totora. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de material quesana y chillihua, Julia va a elaborar sus artesanías en totora y chillihua (plantas de la zona), ella nos cuenta que este es su negocio y le va muy bien.

Su deseo es construir su casa.
A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos que ayuda bastante a las mujeres para que puedan salir adelante solas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is a member of the Community Bank "Las Totoritas" located in the Chimu community, Puno district, province and department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married and mother of 4 children ( 3 of which are in her care). She has completed primary school and lives in the Chimu Central community. She has been working with the Manuela R. movement for almost 4 years, with an original loan of 300 New Soles used in the making of crafts made from totora, a locally grown reed. She is currently requesting a loan of 1500 New Soles for the purchase of woven mat materials and chillihua. Julia will make her items from totora and chillihua (plants that grow in the region), she says that this is her business and that it is going very well. Her wish is to build her own home. She likes the facilities of the loans which provide great help for women that want to get ahead on their own.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chillihua and totora

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora  Julia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chimu, el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 36 años de edad, estado civil casada, y es madre de 3 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en el Barrio Estación Chimu.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la elaboración de artesanías en totora (planta de la zona). 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de material quesana y chillihua, con ello Julia va a elaborar sus artesanías en totora, también quesanas (tejas o calaminas).

Su deseo es seguir trabajando, y más adelante poner una tienda de abarrotes en la comunidad.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, las reuniones  y las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the Las Totoritas Community Bank, which is located in the Chimu community, Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 36, married, and she has three children. She has a third grade education. She lives in the Estación Chimu neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. She used her first loan of 300 PEN in making handicrafts from “totora” (a regional plant). She now needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy material called “quesana” (rush) and “chillihua” (wood), which she will use to make her totora reed handicrafts. She will also make “quesanas” (a type of rush mat).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy quesana (rush) and chillihua (wood) to make her handicrafts

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
La señora  Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Chimu, el distrito D. Puno, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 50 años D. edad, estado civil casada, y es madre D. 3 hijos.  Tiene estudios D. primaria completa, vive en la Comunidad D. Chimu.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 7 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la elaboración D. artesanías en totora (planta D. la zona). 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. material quesana y chillihua, con los cuales ella elabora quesanas para la venta y artesanías en  totora.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando ya que su negocio tiene muy buen mercado.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the “Las Totoritas” Community Bank, located in the Chimu community in the Puno district of the Puno province in the department of Puno. She is 50 years old, married, and is the mother of 3 children. She completed her primary school studies and lives in the community of Chimu. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 7 years. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN, which she used to make handicrafts from reeds (a plant in the area). Now she requires a loan of 2500.00 PEN for the purchase of quesana and chillihua material, with which she makes quesanas to sell and reed handicrafts. Her wish is to continue working because her business has a very good market. She likes the savings and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of quesanas and chillihua (material to make handicrafts).

loans.name: Sonia Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora  Sonia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chimu, el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, estado civil casada, y es madre de 2 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta, vive en La Comunidad de Chimu Central.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 7 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó  para la elaboración de artesanías. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder comprar totora y chillihua (plantas de la zona), y fabricar quesanas (tejas,calaminas), luego llevar a las ferias de la zona para venderlo.

Su deseo es mejorar su criadero de truchas
A ella le gustan las charlas, las reuniones y las orientaciones que se dan en el Banco Comunal
texts.en:
Sonia belongs to the “Las Totoritas” Communal Bank located in the Chimu community, Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 27 years old, married with 2 children, and has partially completed secondary school. She lives in the Chimu Central community. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 7 years. Her first loan for S/.300.00 soles was used to make artisan pieces. Today she needs a loan for S/.1500.00 Nuevos Soles to buy reed mace and chillihua (local plants) and make artisan pieces (weavings, metal pieces) to take to the area markets to sell. Her wish is to improve her trout farm. She likes the Communal Bank’s seminars and orientations it provides.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make artisan pieces

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
La señora Dalila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. de Guadalupe”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 48 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Tiene 13 años dedicándose a la venta de pollos desviscerados, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos, vendiendo pocos pollos, luego tuvo mucha acogida y clientes fuertes.
Así, siguió superándose, ahora vende pollos en cantidad. En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, en un ambiente alquilado del Mercado Central, donde brinda el servicio, a los moradores de la comunidad y amas de casa.  Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  pollos vivos en jabas y  parte del dinero lo invertirá comprando herramientas nuevas como una balanza digital y cuchillos nuevos para remplazar a la que ahora tiene.

Hoy, es una mujer independiente, y ella es la que administra y toma las decisiones en su negocio.
Dalila Dice: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Dalila belongs to the Our Lady of Guadalupe Communal Bank located in the Bellavista district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is 48 years old, has a partner, is mother to 4 children, 2 of whom are still dependent upon her. She has been selling butchered chickens for 13 years in the city’s Central Market. She began with a loan from Manuela Ramos selling a few chickens, becoming very accepted with steady customers. She continued her successful business and now she sells chickens in bulk. Today she has the same business in a rented stall in the Central Market where she provides service to the restaurants and housewives. With this loan for S/.3000.00 Nuevos Soles she will buy crates of live chickens and with part of the money buy new tools like a digital scale and new knives to replace the one she now has. Today she is an independent woman and she manages and makes the decisions for her business. Dalila says: Belonging to a group of women has helped her better know her rights and together they work to be respected.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy crates of live chickens

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Luisa G. D. O. tiene 57 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6º D. primaria, ya que desD. pequeña tuvo que trabajar, tiene 5 hijos y solo 2 dependen económicamente D. ella.
Maria Luisa se dedica a la crianza y venta D. carne D. cerdo, res, cuy, pollo, pato. Los cuales los venD. en el mercado D. Moche.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles, compró patos y cuyes para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos.
El crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. mas animales menores para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos.
Maria Luisa sueña con aumentar la crianza D. sus animales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Luisa G. D. O. is 57 years old and lives in the Moche district, in Trujillo province, in the city of La libertad, Peru. This businesswoman was only able to study through the sixth graD., since from the time she was young she had to work. She has 5 children but only two are economically dependent on her. Maria Luisa is dedicated to the raising and selling of pigs, cows, guinea pigs, chickens and ducks. She sells these animals in the Moche district market. With her first credit of 300 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency), she purchased ducks and guinea pigs in order to raise them and later sell them. She is currently requesting 1000 nuevos soles ($350 US), which she will invest in the purchase of more small livestock in order to raise the animals and sell them for profit. Maria Luisa dreams of increasing the growth of her livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ducks and guinea pigs in order to raise them and later sell them for profit

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa A. R. tiene 64 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, Provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria. Tiene 4 hijos pero ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
Rosa se dedica a la venta de quesos, quesillos, manjar blanco y mantequilla. Los cuales los venden a sus amistades, vecinos y familiares.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles inicio comprando quesos, quesillos, manjarblanco y mantequilla.
Este crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de productos lácteos como: queso, quesillo, manjarblanco, mantequilla, yogout, para poder cubrir sus pedidos a tiempo, aumentar sus ventas y su ganancia.
Rosa sueña con aumentar su clientela y colocar un puesto en el mercado de Moche.
texts.en:
Rosa A. is 64 years old, and lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. She completed 5th year of secondary school. She has 4 grown children. Rosa sells cheese, cheese curd, caramel, and butter to her friends, neighbors, and family. With her first loan for 300 Nuevos Soles she began buying cheese, cheese curd, caramel and butter. With this loan for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles she will buy dairy products such as cheese, cheese curd, caramel, butter, yogurt in order to be able to meet her orders, increase her sales and her earnings. Rosa dreams of increasing her clientele and opening a stand in the Moche market.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese, cheese curd, caramel, butter, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. de Guadalupe”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Rosita, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas y pollos  a la brasa, en un local  muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en el Mercado Central de la Ciudad, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 10:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Nuestra Sra. de Guadalupe Community Bank in the Bellavista district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is 30, in a common law marriage, and she has two dependent children who go to school. Rosita decided to sell prepared meals and grilled chicken in a well set up location, which is in the Central Market in the city. She has very good daily sales because of the good flavor she gives her meals. Her stand is well known and very well received. She currently continues with the same business, and she is very happy with the work she does day to day. She sells in the mornings from 10:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. She personally waits on her customers with her characteristic charisma. With this loan for 1,000 PEN, she will buy supplies for the daily preparation of her food. She will buy things like kilos of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, sacks of potatoes, crates of chicken, vegetables, and some utensils to use in her business and give her customers better service. She feels full of life with the desire to get ahead. She has a lot of dreams and goals in her life. She would like to set up her own well equipped grocery store. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the start of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for the daily food preparation

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.es:
La señora Leocadia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. D. Guadalupe”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 68 años, 08 hijos todos ellos ya independientes y formando sus propias  familias.

Leocadia, a su edad aun se siente con fuerzas para seguir trabajando, ella se dedica a la venta D. bebidas gasificadas y chupetes. Manifiesta que con el negocio que ejerce se siente muy tranquila y contenta, es ella quien administra su negocio. Se siente muy capaz y responsable con las cuotas que debe pagar mensualmente al Banco Comunal.

Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio,  es conocida en el barrio; ya que sus gaseosas las venD. bien heladitas al gusto del cliente.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 800.00, comprará más bebidas como: gaseosas D. diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas. Así como agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Se siente orgullosa por haber logrado implementar su negocio, y asegurarse una vejez tranquila. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a superarse y a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante y a defenderse como mujeres.
texts.en:
Leocadio belongs to the Nuestra Sra. D. Guadalupe Community bank in the Bellavista district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is 68, married, and she has eight independent children who have their own families. Leocadia still, at her age, feels the strength to keep working. She sells carbonated beverages and lollipops. She is very calm and happy with her work. She runs her own business. She feels very capable and responsible with her monthly payments to the community bank. She currently continues with the same business. She is known in her neighborhood because she sells her beverages well chilled the way her customers like. With this loan for 800 PEN she will buy different flavors, sizes, and brands of carbonated drinks. She will also buy carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water. She feels proud of herself for having set up her business and assuring herself of a peaceful old age. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for having helped her do so well and for helping other women who want to get ahead and defend themselves as women.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more drinks like different flavors of carbonated drinks

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. de Guadalupe”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 44 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.

Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio de venta de comida, ubicando su a las afueras de su casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado.

En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su negocio de venta, donde ella los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente aun con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vejez tranquila. Elsita, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the Community Bank "Our Lady of Guadalupe," in the Bellavista District, Bellavista Province, San Martin Departmnet. She lives with her partner, is 44 years old, and is the mother of three children, all of whom are already independent. With the security of having a good seasoning for the preparation of different types of food, her own initiative with her first loan of S. 300 started her business selling food, located outside of her house, a well conditioned area. In actuality she has passed the time continuing with the same business, counting on an already loyal clientele who come to her business daily, where she takes care of them with the charisma which characterizes her. With this loan of S. 1,000 she will buy ingredients for the daily preparation of her foods like sacks of rice, sugar, oils in packets, chickens and also some utensils to implement in her business and give better attention to her clients. She feels like she has a lot of strength to continue working and continue forward and ensure herself a quiet old age. Elsita is thankful to the Manuela Ramos movement for contributing with the realization of her hopes and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for the daily preparation of food

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
La señora Reina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. D. Guadalupe”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es casada, tiene 40 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, ya independientes.

Ante la necesidad D. aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por ella misma, emprendió un pequeño  negocio D. venta D. abarrotes con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desD. un inicio por la calidad D. sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donD. sus principales clientes son los vecinos D. su barrio.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,200.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Hoy se siente muy feliz D. la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Reina belongs to the Our Lady of Guadalupe Communal Bank, Bellavista district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is married, 40 years old, and the mother to 3 grown children. Upon needing to add to her family’s household income, she began a small business selling groceries all by herself with a loan for S/.300.00 soles. She was successful from the start because of the quality of her products, her attractive prices, and good customer service. Today she continues this same business located in her own home, where her primary customers are her neighbors. With this loan for S/.2,200.00 she will buy more products to stock her store such as kilos of rice and sugar, crates of eggs, personal care products and household cleaning products, soda pop, candy, and other products to keep her customers happy. Today she is very happy with the work and service she provides and she is grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting people such as herself who wish to work and get ahead. She hopes to continue on for a long time and help many families and women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to stock her business

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujer Bellavista”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y es madre de 02 hijos, quienes son quienes lo impulsan a seguir adelante.

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por su esposo emprendió su  propio negocio de venta de arroz al por mayor y con  el carisma y la buena atención que le caracteriza, tiene muy buena acogida. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son clientes fijos que cuentan con sus propias bodegas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará 45 sacos de arroz, para posteriormente venderlos. 

Hoy se siente muy feliz del  servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar mujeres como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Marisol belongs to the communal bank group “Mujer Bellavista”, which meets in the Bellavista District of Bellavista Province, Department of San Martín. She is 42 years old, married and the mother of 2 children, whom she urges to do their best.

Given the need to contribute to the household income, Marisol was encouraged by her husband to start her own business selling rice to wholesalers. Her charisma and attentiveness are qualities to be admired. She currently operates her business out of her home, where her regular customers come to restock their own shops.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will buy 45 sacks of rice for later sale. She is very happy with the service she has received and thanks Manuela Ramos for supporting women who want to work to get ahead. She hopes to be in business for a long time and help other female entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 45 sacks of rice

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujer Bellavistana”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 46 años y 05 hijos, 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Con el fin de contribuir con los ingresos económicos de su hogar le nace la idea de aperturar un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas preparadas y poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su restaurant y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con su rica sazón y la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Anita, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ana belongs to the "Mujer Bellavistana" loan group of the Bellavista district in the San Martín department. She is 46 years old, lives with her partner, and has five children, three of whom are dependent upon her. With the goal of contributing to the family income, she had the idea of opening a small catering business. Little by little she gained experience, becoming well-known and loved by her customers. She continues this business, personally serving customers who visit her restaurant daily with the flavor and kindness that is characteristic of Ana. With this loan of 2500 soles ($850), Ana will buy sacks of rice and sugar, various vegetables, eggs and poultry. She will also purchase cooking utensils to replace the one she has now in order to provide better service and attention to her clients. Anita feels very confident with the aim to move forward and ensure a peaceful life for herself. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the success of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale foods for her catering service

loans.name: 01-Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Liên T. Thị is 39 and lives in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Liên is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 01-Đông Hải (16-03-001).

Liên is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Liên raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Liên has been engaged in this business for more than 25 years and earns approximately 1500000 Vietnamese dong (approximately $84) a month from these activities.

In 2004, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liên has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND, which will also be used to purchase fertilizer. The loan will be the tenth  taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liên plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  N. Thị Tâm, 47, is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.

2.  Lê Thị Hồng, 25, is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.

3.  N. Thị Hoan, 51, is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.

4.  Lê Thị Nhật, 51, is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Liên T. Thị (19) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Liên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 01-Đông Hải (16-03-001).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ trồng & thu hoạch gạo để bán.  Liên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 25 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Liên kiếm được khoảng 1500000 VND.  Vào 2004, Liên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Liên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua phân bón như phân chuồng.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 10th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Tâm (21) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.


2.  Lê Thị Hồng (104) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.


3.  N. Thị Hoan (22) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.


4.  Lê Thị Nhật (105) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Maria Niceta

texts.es:
La señora María Niceta, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujer Bellavistana”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 59 años y es madre D. 06 hijos, 01 que aun dependen D. ella.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas D. salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. anticuchos, en un local alquilado muy bien acondicionado, donD. poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo D. actividad. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donD. venD. diariamente  por las noches. Tiene 15 años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,500.00, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios D. cocina para brindar un servicio D. calidad.  

María Niceta,  se siente tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
María Niceta belongs to the "Mujer Bellavistana" loan group of the Bellavista district in the San Martín department. She is 59 years old and married with six children, one of whom is still dependent upon her. The fighting spirit that has always defined María Niceta and her goals to move forward inspired her to start a food business, selling kebabs in a comfortable local rental space. Little by little she has become very well-known among her customers. This activity has been going very well for her. She currently continues this business and sells her food nightly. She now has 15 years of experience and feels very content with her career. With this 1500-sole ($500) loan, María Niceta will buy wholesale goods such as sacks of rice, eggs, and poultry for her kebabs. She also will buy better cooking utensils to proviD. better quality service. María Niceta feels very peaceful and content with her life. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the accomplishment of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale food for her catering business

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao Y. lives in Khsom Village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice.

In this plantation, Mrs. Mao Y. faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she would use the rest of money to build a cow stall for her cow-breeding.

Mrs. Mao Y. is a 41-year-old mother of three children who are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Yim Sokhim, is a laborer who is a hard working man. Her husband is on her right in the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her field

loans.name: 008 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en: Liên N. Thị (13) is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hóa. Liên is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 008 Quảng Hưng (18.02.008). Liên is married and has six adult children. She owns and operates a business running a food stall, primarily selling vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,300,000 VND a month. In 2004, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liên is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in renovating her business. The loan will be her 10th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. N. Thị Tú (74) is a 21-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business. 2. N. Thị Bình (75) is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Liên N. Thị (13) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa. Liên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 008 Quảng Hưng (18.02.008). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán rau trong cộng đồng địa phương. Liên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Liên kiếm được khoảng 1.300.000 VND. Vào 2004, Liên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Liên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 10th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. Thị Tú (74) là 21 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc. 2. N. Thị Bình (75) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in renovating her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Futuro”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 44 años, 03 hijos, 02 que aun depende de ella.

Elizabeth, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de panes,  nos comenta que para empezar tuvo que pasar por muchas dificultades, empezó con pocos panes y ahora ya tiene un negocio establecido en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, esta muy orgullosa y contenta por haber salido adelante con el apoyo  Manuela Ramos que le ayudo bastante a mejorar su servicio.

En la actualidad continua con la venta de panes y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su casa a comprar sus panes y  es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00, comprará harina y azúcar en sacos, levaduras, manteca y mejoradoras, huevos en javas.
Parte del dinero también lo invertirá pagando la inicial de su amazadora eléctrica, herramienta principal para preparar sus panes.

Elizabeth, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada y con el apoyo de su pareja, salieron adelante y hoy se siente con ganas de hacer realidad sus demás sueños y metas que tiene trazada en la vida.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the "Mujeres del Futuro" (Women of the Future) loan group in the Bellavista District of the San Martín department. She is 44 years old and lives with her partner. She has three children, two of whom are still dependent upon her. Elizabeth is in the business of baking and selling bread. To begin her business she had to overcome many obstacles. She began with a few breads and currently runs her established business out of her own house, a comfortable environment for her. She is very proud and content for having moved forward with the support of the Manuela Ramos organization, who helped her considerably to improve her service. She currently continues to sell bread and has a faithful clientele who visit her house daily to buy her breads. It is Elizabeth who personally attends to them with the charisma that defines her. With this 1800-sole ($600) loan, she will buy sacks of flour and sugar, yeast, eggs, fat and seasonings. She will also use part of the loan to continue payments for her electric oven, the primary tool she uses to prepare her breads. Today, Elizabeth is an empowered woman. With her partner's support, they will move forward with the goal of making the dreams and goals that they have mapped out for their lives a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Say Eng

texts.en:
Mrs. Say Eng C. is a 52-year-old widow and is a villager in Khsom Village in Kandal province. She owns a small business that sells Chinese noodles in the local market.

Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more plates, glasses, and other supplies for her business. She hopes to increase her income and make a better profit from her business.

loans.use: To buy more plates, glasses, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Mrs. Dina S. is 36 years old and she now lives in Phum Thom Village in Kandal province. She is a good housewife in her family. Her husband, Mr. Sout Sam, is a motorbike repairer. He is on the right in the photo. This couple has four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

Although Mr. Sout Sam tries to work hard, he still earns less income than needed to support his children’s studying. Thus, Mrs. Dina S. decided to ask for a loan to support her children in their studying. She hopes her children will improve their education and have the opportunity to find a good job in the future.

loans.use: To support her children in their studying

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Futuro”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 34 años, 03 hijos que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Lleva años dedicándose a este tipo de negocio de venta de ropa y nos cuenta que le va muy bien es así que logro ahorrar su dinero que le permitió comprar  mas ropa variada, ya que tiene como meta implementar su negocio con ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, a su edad el trabajo que realiza no le causa mucha molestia, y esta muy tranquila con lo que hace. 

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada,  en el barrio ya es muy conocida y es la única que cuenta en el barrio  con este tipo de negocio  y esto le da mayores ventajas para sus ventas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará ropas como pantalones, polos, vestidos y blusas. Con parte del dinero también comprará una vitrina, donde le servirá para exhibir su mercadería de ropas.

Se siente muy contenta, tiene fuerzas aun para seguir adelante, y esto; hasta que Dios lo permita, se esta asegurando una vejes tranquila; por lo que reconoce el gran apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres de la región San Martín.
texts.en:
Rosario belongs to the "Mujeres del Futuro" (Women of the Future) community bank in the district of Bellavista, San Martín department. She is 34 years old, widowed, and has 3 dependent children that are in school. For years she has worked selling clothes. She tells us that she has been doing well, thus she has been able to save money that allowed her to buy a greater variety of clothing, since her goal is to stock her business with clothes for women, men and children. At her age, Rosario's work doesn't cause her much trouble and she is very contented with what she does. Currently she is continuing the same business and has a loyal customer base; she is already very well known in her neighborhood. Rosario is the only one in her neighborhood with this type of business and this gives her an advantage in sales. With this loan of 800 PEN, she will buy clothing such as pants, polos, dresses and blouses. With part of the money she will also buy a display case, where she will exhibit her merchandise. She feels very content, she still has the energy to continue to advance her business and this, godwilling, assures her security in her old age. For this she recognizes the support of Movimiento Manuela Ramos, helping her and other women in the region of San Martín.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing such as pants, polos, dresses and blouses

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La señora Gladis, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Futuro”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y no tiene hijos.

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por su ella misma emprendió un pequeño  negocio de venta de abarrotes con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Gladis belongs to the Women of the Future Community Bank in the District of Bellavista, Province of Bellavista, Department of San Martin. She is married, 36 years old, and does not have children. Facing the need to help with the household income and self motivated, she started a small business selling groceries with her first loan of 300 Soles, obtaining very good results since the beginning because of the quality of her products, her fair prices, and good customer service. She now is continuing with the same business, located in her own house where her principal clients are her neighbors of the community. With this loan of 1,700 Soles she will buy more products to supply her business such as rice and sugar by the kilogram, cases of eggs, supplies for personal use, home cleaning supplies, packaged carbonated drinks, sweets, and other products to keep her clientele content. These days she feels happy with the work and service she supplies and is grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting people like herself who want to work and move ahead. She hopes that they continue for a long time and assist many families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy more groceries to increase her supply of products.

loans.name: Miller

texts.en: Miller A. is from the town of Northern Poblacion, Calamba, Mis. Occ. He is 50 years old, married, and has adult children. Miller owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Miller joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC. Miller is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his 4th from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresa de Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Futuro”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 62 años y no tiene hijos.

Se inicio con la venta de golosinas; hace muchos 09 años atrás, nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 210.00 y ahora le va muy bien en sus ventas de golosinas, se siente muy bien y tranquila, ya que tiene muy buena acogida. Se encuentra ubicada en la misma esquina de su casa, donde ofrece sus productos.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, comprará golosinas como: chocolates sublimes, cañonazo; chupetines, chicles y caramelos en diferentes sabores y marcas; así satisfacer a sus clientes. 

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa de Jesús belongs to the communal bank group "Mujeres del Futuro", which meets in the Bellavista District of Bellavista Province, Department of San Martín. She is 62 years old, single, and does not have any children.

She has been selling candy for 9 years. Her business started with a loan of 210 soles, and it continues to do well. She is a good-natured and calm person, and everyone enjoys being around her. Sra. Teresa displays her products on the street corner in front of her house.

With this loan of 1200 soles, she will buy a variety of candies to satisfy her customers’ tastes: premium chocolates, cañonazo (a popular brand of candy bar made of chocolate covered wafers), lollipops, caramels, and different flavors and brands of chewing gum.

Her work gives her much satisfaction. She believes it is worth the sacrifice to fulfill the dreams and goals one has in life. At the same, she expresses her thanks to Manuela Ramos for helping her and other women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different types of candy

loans.name: Gavina

texts.en: Gavina M. is from the village of Duanguican, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, married, and has nine adult children. Gavina owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising hogs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Gavina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Gavina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Calvin

texts.en:
Calvin J. is from the town of Sapang Dalaga. He is 59 years old, married, with 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Calvin owns and operates a business venture in the service sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from the revenue of using a van for transportation services. Calvin has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from his business.

In 2006, Calvin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Calvin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Calvin is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used for renewal of the registration for his van and franchise expenses. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Calvin from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for renewal of registration for van.

loans.name: Tseveldulam

texts.en:
Tseveldulam D. is 46 year old who lives with her husband and 20 year old son in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her son is a student at the Mongolian University of Science and Technology in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Tseveldulam has been selling meat at the local food market since 2000. She purchases livestock from the wholesale market in the town and slaughters the purchased animals at home. She cuts the carcasses into small pieces and retails them to the locals. Since she has been selling good quality beef and mutton to locals for over nine years, many local customers visit her often and buy meat for their family dinners. She says that she is committed to making her business as successful as possible. This business is the main source of her family's income and she pays her son's university tuition with the business profits. She would like to see her son graduate with a bachelor degree and pursue his dream without financial strain. She is requesting a loan to purchase more livestock for her business.

loans.use: To purchase whole animals at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Yumjirdulam

texts.en:
Yumjirdulam A. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two teenage children in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her two children are both students in local high schools.

She has a small retail business in butchery. She rents a small stall at the local food market and sells cut meat. She purchases livestock from the wholesale market in the town and slaughters them at home. She cuts the carcasses in small pieces and retails them at the local market. She also sells the skins and other internal organs and parts at the market as well. She has been in the meat retail business for over eight years and has gained significant experience. Her husband owns a small truck and he sometimes travels to herder families nearby and purchases livestock for discounted prices. She says that she would like to expand her business and make it a more profitable large-scale family business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more livestock for her meat business.

loans.use: To purchase whole animals at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor S. is 56 yeard old and lives with her husband and two teenage children in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her 9 year old son and 14 year old daughter are both high school students.

Dolgor runs a small fast food store where she offers various domestic dishes for locals. Her fast food store is located close to the busy market and is usually busy with local customers. She runs the food business with the help of her grown-up daughter. She has been running the food store since 2006 and her business has done quite well. She easily purchases necessary ingredients such as flour, meat, vegetables, etc. from the market which is just next door. She says that she hopes to run her business successfully and enable her two children to be well educated without any financial strain. She is requesting a loan to purchase necessary ingredients for her food business.

loans.use: To purchase food products for her business.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel M. is from the town of Quiboro, Mambajao Camiguin. He is 30 years old and is married. To make a living, Ariel owns and operates a business venture in the service sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transport services with his motorcycle in their community. Ariel has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,400 PHP a month from these activities.

In October 2008, Ariel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ariel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Ariel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to repair his motorcycle. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ariel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair motorcycle used in his business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita G. is from the town of San Isidro, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 39 years old. Carmelita is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.
