In November 2008, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Reine

texts.en:
Reine F. is from the town of Jang, Mahinog Camiguin. Reine is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Reine owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income from the business comes primarily from providing entertainment services to local community members with his videoke or sing along and billiards. Reine has been engaged in his business for over 9 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In October 2008, Reine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Reine is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Reine from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand his services.

loans.name: Rachabgul

texts.ru: Аташбекова Рачабгул проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 55 лет. Вдова, имеет 5 детей. Рачабгул более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Она торгует национальными тканями, на рынке. Ей конечно же помогают ее дети. Старший сын находится на заработках в России. Сама клиентка просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Rachabgul A. lives in the Hamadoni district. She is 55 years old, a widow and has 5 children. Rachabgul has been involved in sales for over 6 years. She sells traditional fabrics at a market. Of course, her children help her with the business. Her oldest son works in Russia. The client is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Muslima

texts.ru: Гуломова Муслима проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 45 лет. Вдова, имеет 2 детей. Муслима более 5 лет занимается бизнесом. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует одеждой. Она просит кредит, дял увеличения товараоборота. Т.к. увеличится товараоборота, прибыль тоже увеличиться, а это ей очень нужно.
texts.en:
Muslima G. lives in the Hamadoni region. She is 45 years old. She is a widow and has two children. Muslima has been doing business for more than five years. She has a vendor spot on the market where she sells clothing. She is asking for a loan to increase her inventory. This way when the sales increase her profit will increase too which she needs a lot.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Razya Group

texts.en:
Razya is the group leader of Razya group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to take a loan for their own business. The total of their group loan is 40000 Afghani.

A. Hasan wants to take a loan for his general store, because he wants to strengthen and enlarge his business. Zakya and Mohammad Yaqob want to take a loan for their business of fresh fruit selling, because they want to expand and progress their businesses. Razya wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of selling firewood, to make his business larger.

They are all happy about the process of taking out loans and want to say that it can support the entrepreneur a lot.

loans.use: to further their individual businesses

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат Махмудова проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 26 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж работает "таксистом". Адолат более 3 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке в поселке "Москва". Она в основном торгоует одеждой. Кредит просит для пополнение ассортимента.
texts.en:
Adolat M. lives in the Hamadoni region. She is 26 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Adolat has been in the retail business for more than three years. She has a vendor spot on the market in the village called Moskva. She mainly sells clothing. She is asking for a loan to increase assortment of inventory.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase assortment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kurbonho

texts.ru: Курбонхо Хикматуллоев проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 47 лет. Женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Курбонхо по образованию работал учителем. Вот более 4 лет занимается бизнесом. Он покупает скот, откармливает и продает его на рынке как мясо. В данный момент он просит кредит, для покупки скота.
texts.en:
Kurbonho H. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 47 years old. He is married and has one child. Kurbonho has worked as a teacher in which he has a degree. For more than four years he has been doing business. He buys cattle, feeds it and resells on the market as meat. At this time he is asking for a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sayad Hasyan Group

texts.en:
S. Hasyan is the group leader of the S. Hasyan group. There are three members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for his/her own business.

Pary Gull wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving. She wants to buy the necessary materials for her business. Toba wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to expand her business. S. Hasan wants to take a loan for his business of health services. He wants to make his shop larger. They are very happy with these loans to Afghanistan.

They want to say that these loans are very useful because they can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses and become stronger in business and in life. This group appreciates this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: Make their businesses larger

loans.name: Marelyn

texts.en:
Marelyn C. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 41 years old. Marelyn is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Marelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food in the local community. Marelyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In February 2009, Marelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Marelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jameila Group

texts.en: Jameila is the group leader of Jameila group. There are two members in this group. Each of them want to take out a loan for expanding her business and making it larger. So they requested a group of loan 10,000 Afghani. Jameila wants to take a loan for her husband who has a fruit and vegetable shop. Khlada wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring, and they are very thankful to AFS and Kiva lenders who can support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For expanding their businesses

loans.name: Roquesa

texts.en:
Roquesa O. is from the town of Quiboro, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 43 years old. Roquesa is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Roquesa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, and others in the local community. Roquesa has just started this business.

In July 2008, Roquesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roquesa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. Roquesa is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Roquesa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma M. G. reside en la capital del país en el municipio de Soyapango. Irma tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres niños Henry de 11 años, Ingrid de 10 años y Brayan de 9 años de edad los tres niños se encuentran estudiando el nivel básico en la escuela. Irma ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos por medio de las ganancias que le genera su negocio, una tienda muy surtida de productos de consumo la cual tiene ubicada en el mercado de la colina donde ella vive el deseo de Irma es seguir surtiendo su negocio para contar con la capacidad de vender productos al por mayor ya que le generaría mayores ingresos es por eso que solicita este crédito para comprar mercadería para su negocio y contar con grandes cantidades en los productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
Irma M. Garcia resides in the capital of the country in the municipality of Soyapango. Irma is 33 years old. She is a single mother of three children: 11-year-old Henry, 10-year-old Ingrid, and 9-year-old Brayan. The three children are studying in elementary school. Irma has been able to move forward with her children by way of the earnings that her business generates for her. She has a small store stocked with consumer products which is located in the market on the hill where she lives. Irma’s desire is to continue to stock her business so that she can count on the ability to sell wholesale products as they generate more income. She solicits this loan in order to buy merchandise for her business and count on having great quantities of the products that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store

loans.name: Holmumin

texts.ru: Мирзоеров Холмумин проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 52 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Холмумин по проффесии земледелом работал более 17 лет. В данный момент он более 7 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Холмумин кредит просит для покупки удобрений и зерна. Он хочет посеить урожай риса, а потом собрав продать его на рынке.
texts.en:
Holmumin M. lives in the Tursun-zoda region. He is 52 years old. He is married and has five children. Holmumin is an agronomist by profession in which he worked for more than seventeen years. At this time he has been in farming for more than seven years. Holmumin is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. He wants to sow a harvest of rice and sell it after he collects it.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sow rice

loans.name: Jose Felipe

texts.es: Jose Felipe A. S. de 46 años de edad  vive en el departamento de San Vicente con su esposa y sus dos hijos Rafael de 7 años y Alicia de 4 años de edad. Felipe se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz, el cual el obtiene por grandes cantidades y para comercializarlo después por libras en el cual obtiene un porcentaje de ganancia, Felipe distribuye el maíz en el mercado dejándolo en los puestos del mercado de San Vicente. El crédito Felipe solicita es para incrementar su inventario en maíz ya que no logra cubrir todas sus ventas con la cantidad existente.
texts.en:
Jose Felipe A. S. is 46 years old and lives in the San Vicente departement with his wife and his two children, Rafael who is 7 years old and Alicia who is 4 years old. Felipe buys and sells corn, which he gets in large quantities to later market by the pound, from which he receives a percentage of the profits. Felipe distributes the corn in the market, leaving it in the stalls of the San Vincente market. The loan that Felipe is requesting is to increase his corn inventory as he does not manage to cover all of his sales with his current quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира Маматкулова  торгует на рынке около 7 лет  журналами  и продуктами питаниями.  Сейчас у школьников каникулы и основные ее покупатели это дети. Они покупают у нее  жвачки, конфеты и другие сладости и мелочи. Она считает что может оправдать свой доход за эти трехмесячные каникулы.  Замира планирует  прикупить журналы и канцелярскими товарами, потому что каждый год товар дорожает к концу лета, для этого она и хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Zamira M. sells magazines and food on the market for about seven years. Right now all the school children are on recess and are her main customers. They buy gum, candy and other sweets and small things from her. She thinks that she can make good profit during these three months of recess. Zamira plans to buy magazines and stationary supplies because each year the prices for these items rise by the end of the summer and this is why she wants to get a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy magazines and books

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Юлдашев Дилшод проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 23 года. Женат, детей не имеет. Дилшод по проффесии "электрик". По проффесии он работал более 1 года, т.к. заработная плата не устраивала, он решил начать свой бизнес. Он более 3 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Кредит просит для покупки семян и удобрений, чтобы посеить рис. Собрав его, он продаст на рынке.
texts.en:
Dilshod Y. lives in the Tursun-zoda region. He is 23 years old. He is married and does not have children. Dilshod is an electrician by profession. He has worked in his profession for more than a year and because his salary did not satisfy him he decided to start his own business. He has been doing farming for more than three years. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sow rice. He will sell the harvest on the market.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Bernabe Ana Silvia

texts.es: Bernabe Ana Silvia T. D. G. D. 58 años D. edad resiD. en la zona D. oriente del país en el departamento D. San Vicente. Ana vive con su esposo don Francisco quien posee un negocio D. estructuras  metálicas y con sus dos hijas Ana D. 14 años quien es estudiante y Eliseo D. 22 años que trabaja como mecánico. Ana se dedica  a su negocio  que es una panadería ubicada en San Vicente, el pan que Ana elabora se distribuye en tiendas y comedores cercanos, también posee buena clientela ya que no hay ninguna panadería en la zona. Ana solicita un crédito para compra D. insumos utilizados en la elaboración D. pan.
texts.en:
Bernabe Ana Silvia T. D. G. is 58 years old. She lives in the western part of the country in the department of San Vicente. Ana lives with her husband don Francisco who posses a business of building framework and with her children: Ana, a 14-year-old student, and Eliseo, a 22-year-old mechanic. Ana works in her business, a bakery located in San Vicente. The bread that she makes is distributed in nearby stores and dining establishments. She has a strong customer base as there are no other bakeries in the area. Ana solicits a loan in order to buy ingredients used to make bread.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials for her bakery

loans.name: José Gerardo

texts.es: José Gerardo C. reside en el departamento de San Vicente, tiene 44 años de edad, José vive con su esposa Marlene que trabaja como comerciante y con su hijo Roberto de 19 años que se encuentra estudiando en la universidad. José se dedica a la reparación de zapatos cuenta con 14 años de experiencia en su negocio, José posee una clientela muy estable ya que su negocio se encuentra ubicado a las orillas del mercado de San Vicente. El destino del crédito que solicita José es para invertir en su negocio en la compra de materiales para reparar calzado como suelas, tapitas, hilos entre otros.
texts.en:
Jose Gerardo C. lives in the San Vicente department, is 44 years old and lives with his wife Marlene who works as a small businesswoman. His son Roberto who is 19 years old, is currently studying at the university. Jose repairs shoes and has 14 years of experience in his business. Jose has a very stable clientele since his business is located at the edges of the San Vicente market. Jose will use the proceeds from the loan to invest in the purchase of materials for his business, such as soles, covers, and thread among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of material for fixing shoes

loans.name: Melagros

texts.en:
Melagros O. is from the town of Quiboro, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 45 years old. Melagros is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Melagros owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling grilled chicken and pork. Melagros has just started this business.

In July 2008, Melagros joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melagros has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. Melagros is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients for her business . This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Melagros from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Alma Yanira

texts.es: Alma Yanira M. M. reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad. Alma tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos Jonathan de 10 años, Daniel de 8 años, Emanuel de 6 años y Miguelito de 4 años de edad todos los niños se encuentran estudiando. Alma posee un negocio donde vende variedad de almuerzos, ella vende su comida en el centro comercial donde se encuentran muchas oficinas y maquilas a los alrededores, es así como ha logrado hacer una clientela muy estable. Alma solicita un crédito para insumos utilizados en la elaboración de sus platillos de esa manera lograría aumentar su margen de ventas.
texts.en:
Alma Yanira M. Martinez lives in Ciudad Arce in the La Libertad department. Alma is 32 years old, and is a single mother of four. Jonathan is 10, Daniel is 8, Emanuel is 6 and Miguelito is 4 years old. All her children are currently in school. Alma has a business where she sells a variety of lunches. She sells her food in a shopping center located between offices and factories, and this is how she has acquired a stable clientele. Alma is requesting a loan for the ingredients required to make her dishes, and this way she can increase her sales margin.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Lenny Dhayly

texts.es: Lenny Dhayly H. D. H. resiD. en Plan del pino ubicado en  San Salvador.  Lenny tiene 28 años D. edad vive con su esposo Salvador quien trabaja como motorista en ruta D. buses y con sus dos hijos Michelle D. 10 años y Briget D. 2 años D. edad. El esposo D. Lenny recibe un sueldo D. 6$ por día; Lenny trabaja en su negocio el cual es una tienda donD. venD. productos D. consumo, el deseo D. Lenny es seguir creciendo en su tienda y surtirla D. más variedad D. productos es por eso que solicita un crédito por que quiere comprar productos D. belleza para colocar en su tienda y así también surtir con mayor cantidad D. insumos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lenny Dhayly H. D. H. lives in Plan del Pino, in San Salvador. Lenny is 28 years old and lives with her husband Salvador who works as a bus driver and her two children Michelle who is 10 and Briget who is 2 years old. Lenny's husband receives a $6 a day salary. Lenny works in her store where she sells products. Lenny's wish is to continue getting her store to grow and to supply it with a better variety of products, and this is why she requests a loan to purchase beauty products to place in her store and this way supply her business with a greater quantity of materials.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply her business

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза Бобочонова  имеет небольшой продуктовый и вещевой магазин, также в ассортименте  товара  имеются сигареты и спички.  В настоящее время сезон летней одежды , мороженного и холодных напитков.  Она  торгует недалеко от института , где каждый день проходят много студентов и покупают у нее напитки и мороженное. Кредит необходим для покупки мужской одежды .
texts.en:
Firuza B. has a small food and clothing store. Her product assortment also includes cigarettes and matches. Now is the season for summer clothing, ice-cream and cold drinks. She sells not far from a university; so many students pass by her store every day and buy drinks and ice-cream from her. Firuza needs a loan in order to purchase men’s clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of men's clothing

loans.name: Víctor De Jesús

texts.es: Víctor De Jesús G. reside en el municipio de Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San Salvador. Víctor tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su papá, mamá y su hijo de 12 años de edad llamado Bryan que se encuentra estudiando 4º grado en la escuela. Víctor cuenta con un negocio que es  un taller automotriz llamado  “Taller Vik Racing” donde ve todo tipo de carros, Víctor genera a empleo a otras familias ya que posee empleados en su taller, también cuenta con el interés de su hijo que se ve atraído a la mecánica y manifiesta seguir los pasos de su padre, ahora Víctor solita un crédito por que desea comprar un compresor el cual le permitirá dar servicios de enderezado y pintura, negocio que le ayudara a aumentar sus ganancias en su negocio.
texts.en:
Víctor De Jesús G. lives in the Ciudad Delgado county in the San Salvador department. Victor is 30 years old, lives in his own home with his father, mother, and Bryan, his 12 year old son, who is currently in the 4th grade at school. Victor has a business, which is a car shop called "Taller Vik Racing" where he sees all kinds of cars. Victor generates employment for other families since he has employees in his shop. His son is also interested and attracted to mechanics and wants to follow in his father's footsteps. Victor is asking for a loan because he wants to purchase a compressor which will allow him to provide the services of straightening and painting, which will help him increase his business' profits.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of air compressor

loans.name: Joaquín Antonio

texts.es: Joaquín Antonio A. Y. reside en Ciudad delgado en el departamento de San Salvador. Joaquín tiene 35 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos Joseline de 12 años y Eunice de 2 años de edad. Joaquín posee una chatarrera donde compra a muy bajo precio hierro reciclado para ser reutilizado, el deseo de Joaquín es comprar mas hierro y aluminio para aumentar sus ventas ya que posee buena demanda con fabricas que buscan de su producto es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de este material que luego el ofrece  a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Joaquin Antonio A. Yanez lives in Ciudad Delgado in the San Salvador department. Joaquin is 35 years old and lives with his wife and 2 kids: Joseline, who is 12 and Eunice who is 2 years old. Joaquin has a junk yard where he purchases recycled iron at a very low price to be reused. Joaquin's wish is to purchase more iron and aluminum to increase sales since he has steady demand in the factories that ask for his products. This is why he requests this loan for the purchase of material to offer to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of iron and aluminum

loans.name: Martha Lilian

texts.es: Martha Lilian A. Y. de 34 años de edad reside en Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San Salvador. Martha vive en casa propia donde posee un negocio hace diez años es una venta de pupusas  y también hace cuatro meses adquirió  un pequeño chalet ubicado en el polideportivo de la zona, que es un lugar donde llegan muchos a jóvenes a jugar varios deportes, los negocios de Martha poseen buenas ganancias ya que es una persona muy amable con sus clientes, el destino del crédito que solicita Martha es para materia prima de las pupusas y también para surtir su chalet en el cual desea incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Martha Lilian A. Y. is 34 years old and lives in the city of Delgado of the San Salvador department. Martha lives in her own home where she has had a business for the last 10 years of selling pupusas (corn flat breads). Additionally four months ago she acquired a small cottage near the sports center of the area, this is a place where a lot of young people go to play various sports. Martha's businesses make good profits since she is a very likable person with her customers. The purpose of the loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of raw materials for the flat breads and also for the furnishing of her cottage where she is wanting to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw material for flat breads and purchase of merchandise for the cottage.

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es: Dinora Del Carmen C. D. O. D. 40 años D. edad resiD. en Ciudad Delgado municipio D. San Salvador. Dinora vive con su esposo quien posee su propio negocio y con sus dos hijos Henry D. 19 años y Boris D. 24 años D. edad, ambos cursaron hasta el bachillerato y actualmente se encuentran trabajando. Dinora tiene su negocio en su casa donD. venD. diversos productos como ropa, listones, papel, hilo, telas entre otros. El credito que Dinora solicita es compra D. mercadería para vender en su bazar.
texts.en:
Dinora Del Carmen C. D. O. is 40 years old and lives in the Ciudad Delgado municipality of San Salvador. Dinora lives with her husband, who has his own business, and their two children Henry, age 19, and Boris, age 24. Both children finished school and today are working. Dinora has a business in her home selling a variety of products such as clothing, ribbon, paper, thread, fabric, and more. Dinora seeks a loan to buy merchandise to sell in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jonathan Moisés

texts.es: Jonathan Moisés I. de 22 años de edad vive en el municipio de San Cristóbal departamento Cuscatlán con su esposa que trabaja en su propio negocio. Jonathan se dedica a la venta de sorbetes en la zona de Cojutepeque sus ventas son diarias ya que él se pasea por todos los lugares hasta acabar con su mercadería (sorbete), el crédito que solicita Jonathan es para la compra de materia prima para la producción de sorbete ya que obtendría mayores ganancias si el produjera su sorbete sin necesidad de comprarlo todos los días, de esta manera aumentaría su margen diario en sus ingresos por ventas.
texts.en:
Jonathan Moisés I. is 22 years old and lives in the San Cristóbal municipality of Cuscatlán with his wife who has her own business. Daily Jonathan sells sorbets in the Cojutepeque zone, strolling until he sells all his merchandise (sorbets). The loan Jonathan seeks is to buy ingredients to make sorbet as he can obtain higher profits if he makes his own sorbet without having to buy it every day, and in this way increase his profit margin on his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make sorbet

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria Del Carmen S. H.  reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Maria tiene  52 años de edad, es una mujer soltera y vive solamente con su madre la Sra. Dalia de 87 años de edad quien sigue trabajando como comerciante. Maria posee un puesto en el mercado municipal de Santa Tecla donde vende variedad de artesanías salvadoreñas, unas son hechas por ella misma y otras la compra, el crédito que solita Maria es para surtir su negocio ya que desea adquirir nueva mercadería en productos artesanales que le ayudaran a aumentar sus ventas en una zona muy transitada como lo es el mercado en el que se encuentra su local.
texts.en:
Maria Del Carmen S. Hernandez resides in the La Libertad department. Maria is 52 years old, is single, and lives alone with her mother, Dalia who is 87 years old and keeps working as a merchant. Maria has a stand in the Santa Tecla municipal market where she sells a variety of Salvadoran artisans, some which she makes herself and others she buys. The loan which Maria is asking for is to support her business now that she wants to acquire new merchandise in artisan products which will help her increase her sales in a transitory zone like the market in which her spot is located.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing her buiness

loans.name: Haitboi

texts.ru: Хаитбой Ахроров 1978 года рождения , женат имеет сына. 12 лет назад начал разводить скот. В своем коровнике  он содержит три бычка. Все прошлое  лето он содержал 6 бычков. После откорма он продал 6 быков и купил еще больше бычков . В конец осени скот подешевел поэтому,  планирует получить очередной кредит,  что бы купить еще пару бычков.
texts.en:
Born in 1978, Haitboi A. is married and has a son. He started breeding livestock 12 years ago. He keeps three bulls in his cowshed. Last summer, he had 6 bulls. After raising them, he sold 6 bulls and bought some more bulls. Livestock becomes less expensive at the end of autumn, and so Haitboi plans to obtain another loan in order to buy a couple more bulls.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Gloria Mirian

texts.es: Gloria Mirian R. F. de 54 años de edad vive en el municipio de Lourdes Colon departamento de La Libertad. Gloria vive en casa propia solamente con su esposo  Don Santos de 56 años quien es empleado. Gloria tiene un negocio que es la venta de ropa al detalle y por docenas, tiene aproximadamente veinte años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa; la ropa la vende en su casa y en otros negocios de Lourdes Colon, el crédito que Maria solita es con el fin de surtir su inventario en ropa para poder ofrecer mayor variedad de estilos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria Mirian R. F. is 54 years old. She lives in the municipality of Lourdes Colon, department of La Libertad. Gloria lives in her own home with her husband Don Santos who is 56 years old and employed. Gloria has a business selling clothes at retail and by the dozen. She has been selling clothes for approximately 20 years. She sells the clothes in her house and in other businesses in Lourdes Colon. The loan that Maria solicits is to stock her inventory with clothes so that she can offer a greater variety of styles to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory with clothes

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana Silvia R. reside en Lourdes en el departamento de La Libertad. Ana vive con sus dos hijos Hugo de 20 años que curso hasta el bachillerato y actualmente es empleado  y Jacqueline de 5 años de edad quien estudia nivel básico. Ana se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, pero también le saca provecho a las costumbres de los salvadoreños que degustan por las tardes de los famosos choco bananos que son bananos congelados cubiertos de chocolate, pero no es la única fruta que se puede hacer cubierta de  chocolate también Ana vende choco sandia, choco fresas entre otros; de esta manera Ana aprovecha vender de otra manera su fruta. El crédito que solicita Ana es para comprar de mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras para comercializar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana Silvia R. resides in Lourdes in the district of La Libertad with her 2 children. Hugo is 20 years old and studying for his degree while working. Jacqueline is 5 years old and attends elementary school.

Ana sell fruit and vegetables, but she also offers a traditional Salvadoran treat many enjoy in the evenings: the famous “choco banano” (a frozen banana covered in chocolate). However, that’s not the only type of chocolate-covered fruit that she sells. She also offers chocolate-covered watermelon, strawberries and other fruits. This provides another way for her to sell more fruit.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy larger quantities of fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. has been a member of ASHI since 2007. She and her husband Antonio are 41 years old and have three children. Their eldest two children are in high school, while the third one is an elementary student. Education of these three incurs a lot of expenses for Josephine and her husband to deal with. Her husband is a bus "conductor" (someone who is in charge of collecting passengers' fares and will command the driver to stop when passenger wants to ride or step off the bus), while Josephine has been making and selling "nipa" shingles. 

"Nipa" shingles is the most affordable roofing material in the province. This material is good for two to three years before it gets rotten. Poor people all over the province of Antique and those who live in very remote areas like the place where Josephine and her family live, can only afford this kind of roofing material. Therefore, Josephine thought of starting such a business. She will also be maximizing the resources which her village and community offers, because the "Nipa" plant is everywhere and a lot of people make "Nipa" shingles, however, they don't have access to marketing their product outside their village.

Josephine wanted to address the issue faced by most poor people in their community. She started to grow her own business through loans she received from ASHI and she will still be expanding further by purchasing the products of people in her community to market in places outside their own village. Her loan will make this happen and will contribute to the improvement of the lives of poor people.

loans.use: To purchase nipa (kind of palm used in making shingles for rooves) leaf, and nipa shingles to sell.

loans.name: Ada Alicia

texts.es: Ada Alicia G. V. de 29 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad, Ada es madre soltera vive solamente con su hija Génesis de 6 años de edad estudiante de preparatoria. Ada posee un negocio de venta de licuados naturales y otras bebidas, el negocio de Ada se encuentra en una pequeña plaza donde todos los negocios son de comida y los jugos y licuados de frutas de Ada son los únicos y preferidos por los clientes, por lo cual Ada no tiene ninguna competencia. El crédito lo solita para compra de materia prima para sus jugos ya que su demanda va a aumentando y no logra cubrir todas sus ventas con la mercadería que tiene en existencia.
texts.en:
Ada Alicia G. V. is 29 years old and resides in the province of La Libertad, El Salvador. Ada is a single mother and lives only with her daughter Génesis, who is six years old and an elementary school student. Ada owns a business selling smoothies and other drinks which is located in a small plaza where all of the businesses sell food. Ada doesn't have any competition because hers is the only business in the plaza selling fruit smoothies and juices and she is her customers' preferred vendor. She is requesting the loan to buy raw materials for her juices since their demand is increasing and she is not able to cover all of her sales with the goods that she currently has.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para jugos

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita G. is from the town of Quiboro, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 28 years old. Carmencita is separated from her spouse and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Carmencita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, selling basic products in the community. Carmencita has been engaged in her business for many years. She also has a sideline business making and selling food.

Carmencita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmencita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. Carmencita is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make food for sale.

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru: Каримов Аъзам является активным нашим клиентом. Он печет отличные лепешки. Даже соседи  приходят что бы купить у него пару вкусных лепешек. У него много клиентов.  Клиенты к нему приходят с тележками (арба) заполняют тележки лепешками и везут на рынок. Вечером они приносят получившую прибыль Аъзаму.  Ему нравиться его работа, он считает что хлеб всегда будут покупать и это является постоянным источником дохода.
texts.en:
Azam K. is our active client. He bakes excellent flatbread. Even his neighbors come by in order to buy a couple of delicious flatbreads from him. He has many customers. His customers come to him with carts (arba), fill the carts with flatbread and take them to the market. In the evenings, they bring resulting profits to Azam. Azam likes his work; he thinks that bread will always be in demand. This business is his only source of income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of several bags of flour

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita M. is 56 years old and is married to Zosimo M. who is one year older than her. The two were blessed with five children and four of those have their own families to manage now. Rosita's husband is a tailor, while she is a business woman. Ever since she had her own family, Rosita has tried different kinds of businesses to earn money for her family, especially for the education of her children. Through the support of her husband, she was able to send all of her children to school up to college. However, she did not have much time and capital to spend on her business. Her main priority then was family and the education of her children.

When Rosita's children became responsible for themselves and got their own careers, she thought of expanding her business to give herself time to be with other people in their community. She joined ASHI in 2007, and she finds that she is achieving her dreams. The amount she is qualified to loan from ASHI has increased, thus she has more options to enhance the variety store she started. Her new loan is intended for purchasing additional goods to be sold in her variety store. The profits she will earn from her business will be saved for her future plans of growing her mini variety store to a general grocery store, which can accommodate the needs of people who want to put up their own mini variety store someday.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods to be sold in her store.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
At her age, which is 55 years old, Carmelita has to earn money to save for her future because she is single. She also has to earn enough money to take care of her mother who is very old. She is one in charge of looking after her mother, and they live together with no one else to share the responsibility. However, Carmelita's membership in ASHI is a great opportunity that changed her perception towards life and being single. Now she has a lot friends in ASHI and she has found a family where she belongs. Aside from the opportunity of having a business, she also found the opportunity to release her burdens by sharing them with her co-members. This is what encourages Carmelita to go on.  

Carmelita S. started her dressmaking business ten years ago. This was the only livelihood she knew then, until she was encouraged by women in their community to try direct selling of Avon cosmetics. Her loan from ASHI, when she became a member in 2008, gave her the option of trying this business. She realized then that her new found business was good and she enjoys doing it. She makes large profits and she has had the opportunity of meeting and dealing with a lot of people within and outside her village. Therefore, she wants to increase this business by continuing with the loans from ASHI. She will be able to reach to more people when she has more capital to purchase more Avon products. Furthermore, if her business will create larger profits, she can offer a better life for her mother while she is alive.

loans.use: To purchase more Avon (company that sells cosmetics) products to sell.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
N. Sarah is the leader of Seeta development group in Mukono. She is 43 years old and married with five children, with the youngest being 12 years old.

Sarah has a stall in Seeta trading centre where she has sold fresh produce and chickens for seven years. She is happy that, this being her second loan from Pearl Microfinance, she has been able to transform her business by having more stock - hence more profits.

Sarah is a determined and hardworking lady that has been able to cater for her family with the help of her husband. She needs a loan to help buy more food and chickens for resale.

loans.use: To buy more food and chickens for resale

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn is 37 years old and is married to Jimmy who is 37 years old. The two have five children and all are studying. Erlyn's eldest, second, and third child are in high school while her fourth and fifth children are in elementary. Her husband is a laborer while she manages a business she learned from her parents. Her loan through ASHI enabled her to enhance her skills in running her processed food business and negotiating with her supplier and customers.

Erlyn and her family live in a village far away from the main municipality of the province of Antique. People in her community are dependent for their food on the resources present in their surrounding. Fish from the ocean are their main commodity, however, during the off-season when they are expensive, people are having problems where to buy their food.

Erlyn saw this as an opportunity for her to put up a business that would bring them access to food. She buys processed foods in the neighboring city and sells them in their village. So far, Erlyn's business has been doing well and she hopes to expand it further until the time where she can afford to make her own products by acquiring training on how to process food.

loans.use: buying a variety of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Junolito

texts.en:
Junolito R. is from the town of Cabuan, Guinsiliban Camiguin. He is 37 years old. Junolito is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Junolito owns and operates a business venture in the service sector, providing transport services to the local market. Junolito has been engaged in his business for many years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities. He has also been engaged in providing tailoring services.

In 2009, Junolito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junolito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used for motor vehicle maintenance. Junolito is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials for his tailoring business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Junolito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Samuel Kamenwa

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old and married with one child. He owns rental houses in Mwimtu, Kikuyu, Kenya. His clients are low income tenants. Samuel also rears pigs and sells pork to pork product dealers. He learned about KADET through his friends who are also members.

He intends to use his loan to build permanent rental houses. He hopes to expand his pig farming so as to connect with companies that deal in major pork products like Farmers Choice.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To build more rental houses.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel M. is from the town of Banbagon, Mambajao Camiguin. He is 30 years old. Joel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Joel owns and operates a business venture running a retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products like bananas and others in the local community. Joel has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In June 2008, Joel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Joel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used as additional as capital for his business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Joel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sokina

texts.ru: Сокина Очилова   торгует на рынке нижним бельем. Первый кредит получала на расширения бизнеса. Так как нет мужа она сама вынуждена содержать семью.  Тогда она еще продавала носками , платками и детскими нижним бельем. Сейчас постепенно перешла на   торговлю женского нижнего белья. Она меняла свою торговую точку 2 раза. За прежние места она платила дорогую арендную плату.  От чего и оставалась маленькая прибыль. Но кредит ей помог найти более достойное и удобное для торговли место.
texts.en:
Sokina O. sells undergarments at the market. She received her first loan for business expansion. Because Sokina has no husband, she has to support her family by herself. Previously, she also sold socks, scarves and children’s undergarments. Since then, she gradually transitioned to sales of women’s undergarments. Sokina moved her retail store twice because leases on previous spaces were very expensive. This is why her profits were small. However, a loan helped her find a more affordable and convenient retail location.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's undergarments

loans.name: Elsita

texts.en:
Elsita R. is from the town of Lawigan, Catarman Camiguin. She is 41 years old. Elsita is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Elsita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,150 PHP a month from these activities.

In October 2008, Elsita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Elsita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elsita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
N. Margaret is the leader of Tukole Bukozi group in Manyangwa, Kayunga Road. She is 53 years old with a salon business that she has operated for 10 years. In the salon, she sells weaves and braids hair, and applies some cosmetics as she also does hair treatments, retouching, and relaxing.

Margaret is happy that after joining her lending group, she is now able to have a bigger stock of salon products hence more profits. She works from her home so she is able to save on rent expenses. She has 5 children of whom 2 are still in school and the loans help her to educate her children by investing in her business and making more profit. She needs a loan to help buy more braids, weaves, and cosmetics for still more profits.

loans.use: Buying braids, weaves and cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan C. is a 44-year-old man who lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His three children (ages ranging between 7 and 17) are all students.

Batsaihan has a small business selling wood retail. He owns an old Russian truck called Zil 130. He drives his truck between nearby towns and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He visits nearby towns and purchases unprocessed cut wood and transports it to Ulaanbaatar. He sells that wood at the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar for a profit.

His brother also works in the wood retail business in Arhangai province, where he resides with his family, and helps a lot in his business. He has done well with his business; his business capital growth is an evidence of his business expansion. The capital has increased from 800,000 MNT to 3,000,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,420 MNT). His short-term goal is to renovate his old house for his family. He says that he is working hard to make sure that his family lives in a better house.

He requests a loan to purchase more cut wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase planks and wood

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena T. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Filomena is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Filomena owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Filomena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Filomena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Filomena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Filomena is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks and as additional working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Filomena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks and as additional working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mairamchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Майрамчон - молодая женщина 28 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Майрамчон вместе с мужем занимается производством и продажей национальных колыбелек. Муж Майрамчон мастерит колыбельки, а Майрамчон продает их на рынках Джума и Якшанбе города Худжанда. Товар ей отвозит муж. Майрамчон и её муж хотят закупить сырьё для производства колыбелек. Они хотят закупить в основном доски. Майрамчон очень надеется на поддержку нашей организации для расширения ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Mairamchon is a young 28-year-old woman. She is married and is mother of 3 children. Mairamchon and her husband are involved in manufacturing and selling traditional cradles. Mairamchon’s husband makes the cradles, and Mairamchon sells them at the Djuma and Yakshanbe markets in the city of Khujand. Her husband delivers the goods for her. Mairamchon and her husband want to purchase raw materials for making cradles. They want to primarily buy wood planks. Mairamchon hopes that our organization can support her in expanding her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for making cradles

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa T. is from the town of Comon, Mambajao Camiguin. Felisa is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Felisa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, and many more to the local community. Felisa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In March 2009, Felisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional capital. Felisa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Felisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla E. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Perla is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Perla owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn to sell. Perla has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In June 2009, Perla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla is requesting a loan amounting to 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Perla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely P. is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Mely is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mely owns & operates a business venture, fishing and retailing fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from fishing and selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Mely has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Mely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for additional working capital. Mely is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase kerosene, and as working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Mely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional working capital, as well as the purchase of kerosene and additional fish to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou T. is from the town of San Roque, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 44 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. Marilou owns and operates a business providing tailoring services. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In February 2009, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tailoring supplies for her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring supplies for her business

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Dolgorsuren D. is a single mother living with her two children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her daughter is 23 and lives with Dolgorsuren and her son is 18 and studies in the Mongolian National University of Pedagogy in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Dolgorsuren has a small retail business in dairy products. She rents a small stall at the local food market and sells various dairy products, including cheese, curds, cream, etc. She travels to herder families in the nearby towns and purchases dairy products at discounted prices. She mostly sells dairy products at the local market; however, when there are many leftover products in her inventory, she brings them to the wholesale markets for dairy products in Ulaanbaatar. 

She has been in the dairy business for the last four years and she has done well. Her business capital has increased from 800,000 MNT to 3,000,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,420 MNT). She says that she would like to save some portion of her profit for her two children. 

She requests a loan to purchase more dairy products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Манзура Воситова  1979 года рождения. Замужем имеет 3 детей. Более 5 лет разводит скот. Она покупает коров и бычков и через 3-4 месяца выводит на рынок для продажи. От оставшейся прибыли  она прикупает еще пару молодняка для  следующей продажи. К осени планирует купить корм и скот. 
 С Микроинвест  сотрудничает  с  2006 года по настоящее время.
texts.en:
Manzura V. was born in 1979. She is married and has 3 children. She has been breeding livestock for over 5 years. She buys cows and bulls and after 3-4 months takes them to a market to sell. She uses remaining profits to buy a couple of calves for the next sale. Manzura plans to buy livestock and feed prior for autumn. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2006 and to present time.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and feed

loans.name: Jennifer's Group

texts.en:
T. Jennifer is the leader of Kamwokya II development group in Kamwokya.

Jennifer is a hardworking and business-oriented lady and has had a poultry business since 1995. At the moment, she has mostly broilers and she sells to restaurants and on retail for home consumption. She is able to make profits amounting to 150,000/= per month, hence being able to educate her children to become self-reliant. She is the married mother of four children aged 28 – 17 years and she helps cater for her aging parents.

Jennifer needs a loan to help expand her poultry business by buying more chicks since the loans have always helped in boosting her business.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and chicken feed for her business

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Замире – 40 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она занимается продажей детской одежды. Она торгует на рынка «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда, а также по пятницам на рынке "Джумабазар" и по воскресеньям на рынке "Якшанбебазар" города Худжанда. Замира закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан и часть товара из города Бишкек Республики Киргизстан. Она ездит за товаром 2-3 раза в месяц. Замира кредитуется у нас с 2005 года. Она очень хороший клиент. Замира просит кредит для закупки новой партии летнего детской одежды, футболок, маек и шорт. Тогда у Замиры увеличится ассортимент ее товара.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Zamira is 40 years old. She is married and is a mother of three children. She sells children's clothing. She sells on the Panshabe market of the town of Khujand and also on the Djumabazar market on Fridays and on the Yakshanbazar market of Khujand on Sundays. Zamira buys the goods on the wholesale market in the town of Istaravshan and part of the goods from Bishkek, Republic of Kyrgyztan. She travels for the merchandise two to three times a month. Zamira has been our client since 2005. She is a very good client. Zamira is asking for a loan to buy a new batch of summer children's clothing, t-shirts, tank tops and shorts. This way Zamira will increase the assortment of her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer children's clothing, t-shirts, tank tops and shorts

loans.name: Davagsumberel

texts.en:
Davagsumberel T. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His daughter is 19 years old and studies in a local university, and his 13-year-old son is a high school student.

Davagsumberel T. runs a small car repair shop. He offers various car services including diagnosing, repairing various vehicles and selling second-hand car accessories. He started his car repair shop in 2007 with his small capital of 350,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). Since then, his business has grown exponentially and his business capital currently exceeds 1,800,000 MNT. Since his repair shop is located just next to the main road in the town, he is usually busy with many customers. In addition, when he has too many orders, his wife and son help him in his business. He says that he would like to expand his business and become a full-service car-repair shop in the town.

He requests a loan to purchase more second-hand accessories for his repair shop.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts for his business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan A. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Susan owns and operates a business running a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Susan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Susan is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment, such as a video-k unit, to expand the business. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn M. is a 25-year-old caring and loving mother to her two children and husband, Cristopher. She is determined to help her husband, who is a jeepney (small bus) driver, earn money to sustain the needs of their children, especially for their children’s education, and to stop the cycle of poverty in their family.

Genalyn wanted to save and invest for the future of her children. Thus, she joined ASHI in 2005 to have access to business capital through loaning. She then started cooking and selling food, buying and selling charcoal and selling ice.

Eventually, she thought of other businesses as her loanable amount in ASHI increased. Aside from her previous business she thought of raising livestock such as chickens, pigs, and cattle in their backyard. She lives in a mountainous area of the province of Antique, Philippines, and they have a wide, verdant space in their backyard that is good for raising animals. Some of these animals, after a certain period of time, will be sold and others will multiply. Her loan previously received is intended for this purpose. 

Out of the profit she will have in her businesses, she envisions that someday she will be able to build a stable house to shelter her family, and that she will become a successful entrepreneur someday, and she will be a mother that her children can be proud of.

loans.use: To purchase a pig, cattle and chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Agatuna

texts.en:
Agatuna D. is from the village of Katipunan,Sindangan, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Agatuna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Agatuna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Agatuna has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In August 2008, Agatuna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agatuna successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Agatuna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Agatuna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Абдумалик берет второй займ на закуп оптом сахара и двух коробок макаронных изделий. После первого займа у него увеличился оборотный капитал в двое. Торговля стабильная из-за расположения торговой точки.Она расположена на автовокзале города Худжанда где сюда приезжают люди из разных районов Согдийской облости.
texts.en:
Abdumalik is obtaining his second loan in order to purchase sugar and two boxes of pasta. Following the first loan, his working capital doubled. His sales are stable due to the location of his store.
