It is located at a bus station in the city of Khujand, where people come from different districts of the Sogdiysk region.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar and pasta

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon S. is from the town of San Roque, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 45 years old. Corazon is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a business venture in the service sector providing repairs in the local community. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In February 2009, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Corazon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and supplement her income.

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of five children, who are all in school. She sells smoked fishes. She started her fish sales business twenty years ago at the community market near where she lives. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana, and from the fish mongers sometimes when demand is high. She prepares very tasty and good quality fish to serve her customers, and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She has a large customer base as a result of her moderate prices and her good reception towards her customers.

She is requesting a loan to upgrade her stock of fishes. She dreams to give her children a quality education through the proceeds from her business, and she would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a business woman at Sefwi. She is 45 years old and married. She lives with her husband and has four children who are currently in school.

Mary supports her family through her trading business. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen, and lace materials. She mostly sells through hawking--a personal selling method that she said makes her goods move very fast. She has been selling for the past eight years, but progress has been slow due to insufficient funds. She hopes this loan will enable her to revive the business and make a more consistent profit. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes, linen, and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory. It is her desire to rent a store in the community market. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina B. is from the town of Benoni, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 39 years old and single. To make a living, Elvina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elvina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvina is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elvina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
N. Jane is the leader of Tusooka Kwavula group in Lugazi. She is 48 years old, a hard-working and determined married lady with 4 children aged 20 – 10 years, all still in school, as she cares for 2 dependents.

Jane has a restaurant business that she has owned for 10 years and although business is good, she has always been faced with challenges of high costs for purchasing raw foods and the bad debtors who do not want to pay on time hence affecting Jane’s cash flow.

Jane sells mainly cooked food and refreshments from Kitega Jinja Highway and the quality meals and drinks she serves keep her customers coming back. She dreams of expanding her restaurant and having it occupy its own premises with a hope that this will bring in more income. She needs a loan to help her build a service counter for her restaurant since most of her previous loans have helped her in premises improvement.

loans.use: building a service counter for the restaurant for improved service

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Since the time Marisa joined ASHI in 2008, she has set up her food vending business. She has been helping her husband who is an electrician in earning money to give their four children a better life and prepare themselves for the expenses their education might require.

Through her second loan in ASHI, she applied for a bigger amount intended for purchasing a motorcycle which will be for hire. With this, her husband can have other option to earn money at times when customers for his electrical equipment repair business are scarce and he doesn't earn well.

"Skylab" or motorcycle transport is one of the means of transportation of people who live at EBJ Hamtic, Antique Philippines. The village is quite hilly and the road is rough therefore, it is easier to go places riding in a motorcycle than by any other means of transportation since the capacity of passenger is only up to three people.

With regards to her membership in ASHI, Marisa hopes that she will be given more loans so that she can have more opportunities to explore possible businesses and enhance her skill at running a business to attain success for her family and herself.

loans.use: downpayment for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Зухро уже 7 лет кредитуется.За это время она показала себя как порядочный клиент. За период кредитования у неё улучшалось семейное положение.Она на кредит закупает муки и уголя для производство и продажи лепёшек. У неё очень много клиентов так как её лепешки вкусные.Лепёшек она реализует на базаре Костокоз.
texts.en:
Zuhro has been getting financing for 7 years already. During this time, she proved to be a model client. Her family conditions improved during this time as well. She uses loans to buy flour and coal for making and selling flatbread. Zuhro has many customers because her flatbread is delicious. She sells the flatbread at the Kostokoz market.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour and coal

Analiza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In April 2009, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Analiza's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina S. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She is a married woman with three school-aged children. She runs two businesses. She runs a café and she sells traditional clothes in the Yombo Vituka Ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchanses the traditional clothes wholesale from Mnazi Mmoja Traditional Clothes wholesale center and sells them retail to customers. She purchases the business goods for her café from the Kariakoo city market. She uses her business income to meet her family's daily needs and to pay for her children school fees. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to boost up her business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Nacar

texts.en:
Nacar B. a resident of Tabon, Jose Dalman. Her husband is a construction worker and they have six children. Two of her children are students at Jose Rizal Memorial State College at Dapitan City and four of her are married.

Mrs. B. is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She applied for her third loan of Php14,000.00 to purchase a baby cow to raise. She is a good member of Paglaum. She enjoys the benefits and services of Paglaum.

loans.use: To purchase a baby cow to raise

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en: Jane T. is a 38-year-old hard-working and devoted lady. She has four children and she cares for seven dependants. She has had a drug shop for 12 years. Her lending group has helped her learn how to stock more drugs for her shop. At the moment, Jane is able to make monthly profits of 140,000/= because of the quality drugs and her good reputation. She dreams of seeing all her children educated and this is why she works hard and ensures that she saves. Jane needs a loan to help purchase more drugs for her store. She is the member of Tusooka Kwavula group in Lugazi.

loans.use: Restocking her drug shop with more medicines.

loans.name: Jacelme

texts.en:
Jacelme O. is from the village of Duanguican in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 37 years old. Jacelme is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jacelme runs a general store where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Jacelme has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Jacelme joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacelme has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jacelme is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock and to use as additional working capital. This loan will be Jacelme's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock and use as additional working capital

loans.name: Kehongo

texts.en: Kehongo M., a married man, is a Tanzanian small business owner.  He runs a food shop business at Kitunda ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells varieties of food crop products such as: wheat flower, maize flower, beans, ground nuts, sugar, and cooking oil. He purchases the goods direct from the producers at wholesale and sometimes from the Kariakoo city market. Business income is used to capitalize the business and meet his family's daily needs. He is requesting a loan of  800,000 Tanzanian shillings to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy goods for resale

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia S. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is 50 years old. Cynthia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Cynthia owns and operates a general store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Cynthia has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (about $104 US) a month from these activities.

In June 2009, Cynthia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cynthia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Cynthia's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is 32 years old trader. She is married with three children who are in school. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and, for that matter, she is very serious with her business.

Ama trades in foodstuffs like plantain and cocoyam (taro). She started this business five years ago and through this she has been very resourceful to her family.

She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of plantains and cocoyam to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes that with the loan, she can buy bunches of plantain and cocoyam from the farmers, circumventing middlemen who retail to her at a high price.

loans.use: To buy a supply of bunches of plantain

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita D. is from the town of Benoni, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 52 years old, married, and has seven adult children. Nenita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling various foods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients for making food for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making food for sale

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie M. is from the village of Boundary, Sapang Dalaga, Mis. Occ. She is 29 years old, married, and has a school-aged child. Rosalie owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling dried goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Rosalie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en: Elvis is 47 years old. He is a married man with four children who currently attend school. He sells frozen foods like chicken, pork, mutton, fish, meat etc. at the local market in his community. He does not have adequate funds to support his business. This has affected his operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices. With the loan, he wants to purchase additional cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, pork and meat. This will enable him to raise enough income to expand his business. He buys his supplies of goods from the Kumasi central market.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan M. is from the village of Landing, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married, and has two adult children. Susan works in someone else business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Susan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used in rice field production. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To be used in rice field production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en: Jeanette L. is from the town of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin. She is 39 years old, is separated from her spouse and has five school-aged children. Jeanette owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In April 2009, Jeanette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jeanette is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 41 years old. She is married and is the mother of five children. Currently two are schooling and one is a policeman. 

Victoria has been a local manufacturer of soaps for eight years now. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She is not able to produce in large quantities for lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production.

Victoria only depends on the business to support her husband in paying for the children’s school fees. It is her desire to provide quality education to her children and she would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam S. is a micro-entrepreneur and a Tanzanian married woman with three school-aged children.

Mariam runs a food retail shop at Yombo Buza Ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of produce at her shop including wheat flower, maize flower, beans, sugar, cooking oil and other items. She purchases the business goods direct from the producers and others from Kariakoo and from Buguruni city market food shopping center. Her business has employed one worker.

Mariam has been in the business for six years and the business income is used to meet her daily family needs including paying school fees.  Her future plan is to run a wholesale food shop. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle-taxi

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old. She is single and is the mother of one child who is currently in school.

Mary sells fresh fish at the local market in her community and has been in business for eight years now. She does not have adequate funds to support her business and this has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices.

With the loan, Mary wants to purchase more cartons of frozen foods like fresh fish to enable her to raise enough income and to expand her sales. She buys her stock of goods from the Kumasi central market. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fresh fish

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is a 32-year-old trader. She is married with eight children and three are currently schooling. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote for minimizing poverty and, for that matter, she is very serious with her business.

Akosua trades in foodstuff like plantain. She buys them in bulk from the surrounding villages and treks them to the city centers to bargain for a high price. She started this business seven years ago and through this she has been very resourceful to her family.

Akosua wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of plantains to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes that with the loan, she can buy bunches of plantain from the farmers, circumventing middlemen who retail to her at high prices.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of plantains

loans.name: Jofrey

texts.en:
Jofrey K. runs a food shop business at Kisiwani ward in Dar es Salaam. Food shop businesses are very common in Dar es Salaam.

K. sells different types of food crop products such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, beans, groundnuts (peanuts) and cooking oil. He purchases his business goods from the retail and wholesale shops; others items are purchased direct from the producers. He sells in retail to his customers.

K. has been in the business for three years and the business income has helped him to meet his family’s daily needs and school fees. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Odujo

texts.en: S. is married with three children and she is 35 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for the past fifteen years. S. is requesting the loan of N70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and bread to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve her crop yield

loans.name: Makinde

texts.en:
B. sells foodstuffs and has been in the business since 1987. She is 43 years old and married with three children.

B. hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike is 48 years old and married and with four children. She sells crates of drinks in retail and wholesale to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Дадобоева Мукаддас 32 лет В течении 7 лет является активной клиенткой нашей организации. Ей лепешки заказывают и клиенты которые торгуют на базаре и населении для проведение мероприятий. Производстве лепешек ей помогает муж и старшая дочь.На запрашиваемый кредит она хочет купить в сезонность  35 мешков муки и 2 тонны угля.
texts.en:
Mukaddas D. is 32 years old. She has been an active client of our organization for 7 years. She receives orders for her flatbread from customers who sell at the market and people for special occasions. Her husband and oldest daughter help Mukaddas with making flatbread. She wants to use this loan to buy 35 bags of flour and 2 tons of coal.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour and coal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for growing corn

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children. Currently three of her children are in school and the rest are working.

Augustina sells smoked fish at the community market where she lives and started her fish sales seven years ago. She buys her stock of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.

Augustina prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and, because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She has a high customer base as a result of the moderate price and her good reception towards her customers.

Augustina buys her stock of fish from the fishmongers, sometimes when demand is high. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fish. She dreams of giving her children a quality education through the proceeds of her business and she would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Laylah Group

texts.en:
Laylah is the group leader of Laylah group. There are four members in this group. They are very happy with this loan that can make their businesses larger.

Abay and Jamelah want to take out a loan for their general stores. They want to expand their stores. And Laylah wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She will buy a machine for her business. Also, Azem S. wants take a loan for his taxi business. He wants to gain more income from his business. With this loan they are can make their businesses larger and support their families and make a better future for themselves and for their families in future.

loans.use: buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Julieth

texts.en: Julieth J. M. is an Tanzanian entrepreneur and a married businesswoman. She runs two businesses in Buguruni Ward in Dar es Salaam. She runs a traditional clothes shop and also is a food vendor. She purchases the business goods wholesale from Mnazi Mmoja Wholesale Traditional Clothes shops and sells them to retail customers in Buguruni. She manages to meet her family's daily demands from her business income. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to expand the businesses.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow yams

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods, drinks, and fried beef. She has been in this business for a long time. Bola hopes for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. Bola is 48 years old and married to G.. They have four children. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
A. Rose 32, is the leader of Mpasha Bamwe loan group in Ibanda. She is a determined and very hard-working lady with a retail shop that she has owned for 2 years. Rose was a housewife involved in farming until the proceeds from her farm helped her to open her retail shop. She says that her good customer care and general organization have helped her succeed in business. She can now make 200,000/= profits per month. She hopes to expand her shop further.

Rose is married and has four children, aged 13 to 9 months, in primary schools and she cares for one additional dependant. She dreams of seeing all her children attend and have the best education so that they can be responsible people in future. Rose’s loans help her avoid running out of stock, and this loan will help her buy more shop products to increase her stock.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop.

loans.name: Anton Y

texts.en: Antony U. is a married Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur and businessman. He runs a book shop at Yombo Buza Ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells varieties of school and story books at his shop for primary, secondary and college students. He purchases the business goods from wholesale shops at the Kariakoo City shopping center. He has been running the business for three years and he uses his business income to meet his family's daily demands and for capitalization. He is requesting a loan of Ths 800,000 to capitalize the business.

loans.use: To capitalize the business

loans.name: Safura

texts.en:
Safura is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. Five of her children are currently in school. Safura is committed to providing better education for them and meeting their basic needs.

Safura loves selling goods, a business through which she makes a living. She trades in cereals, such as groundnuts. She fries the groundnuts to obtain the groundnut paste, which she sells in the market center. She gets her stock from Tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is requesting a loan to buy more groundnuts to prepare the paste. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply groundnuts and other foods.

loans.name: Raim

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Раиму - 50 лет. Женат и отец 4-х детей. Раим работает в хлебном заводе рабочим. Он зарабатывает нормально. Его жена тоже работает в хлебном заводе. Жена печет хлеб. Зарплату жены они тратят на жизнь, а на зарплату Раима планируют провести ремонт. Но им нужна крупная сумма. Поэтому они просят кредит, чтобы сделать ремонт дома, а потом погашать кредит с зарплаты Раима. Второму сыну Раима исполнилось 22 лет, и его собираются женить. До свадьбы Раим и его жена планируют закончить ремонт.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Raim is 40 years old. He is married and is a father of four children. Raim works in a bakery and makes good money. His wife also works there at the baker, she makes bread. The spend his wife salary on their livelihood and plan to use Raim's salary to make a repair. But they need a large amount of money and this is why they are asking for a loan to make repairs at home and then make payment from Raim's salary. Raim's second son has turned 22 and they are preparing to get him married. Raim and his wife plan to finish repairs before the wedding.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs at home

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is 58 years old. She is divorced with five children, all of whom work. For four years, Adwoa has prepared and hawked pastries like cake, doughnuts, and flour chips, and she also supplies these to shops in her neighborhood. Even in the face of the challenges she faces and in spite of her limited resources, she manages to meet her customers' demand. She sells her wares in the market center to her customers. Adwoa also sells fried yam with pepper in the community where she lives.

Her only problem now has to do with obtaining adequate funds to buy sufficient raw materials to meet the demands of her customers, specifically baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood. With the benefit of a loan to purchase these items, she believes she can successfully build up her business.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood.

loans.name: Mome

texts.en:
Mome is 30 years old and married with three children. She sells crates of drinks in wholesale and retail. She hopes to receive a loan in the amount of N140,000, which she will use to purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Малика имеет свой собственный магазин около дома. В период кредитования она купила холодильник витрину чтобы хранить там продукты и молочные изделия. Так же у неё улучшилось семейное положение. На запрашиваемый кредит она хочет купить разновидности масел на 1500 сомонов, хозтовары на 500 сомонов так же макароны на 500 сомонов.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Malika owns a store not far from her home. She used her loan to purchase a refrigerator showcase for storing food and milk products. The loan also helped her marital status. Malika intends to use the requested loan in order to purchase 1,500 somoni worth of oil products, 500 somoni of household goods, and 500 somoni worth of noodles and macaroni.

Translated from Russian by Pavle Milekic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of household goods, noodles, and butter

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 38 years old, is married and a mother of three children. She is a petty trader and sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, tinned tomatoes, and bags of rice. She tells us that these items move very fast and you can easily recover your money in order to restock. Mary's goods are delivered from the capital city of Kumasi.

With fifteen years of trading experience, she wants to expand her offerings with items like maize and eggs, which are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this would be possible with the help of loan assistance. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy more bags of raw materials for sale.

She is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy items like spices, onions, smoked and dried fish, tinned tomatoes, and bags of rice.

loans.name: Adewomi

texts.en: Adewomi is 52 years old. She is married and has four children. She sells crates of drinks, loaves of bread and other groceries in her shop. She hopes for a loan of N50, 000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is 51 years old. She is a divorced mother with three children who are currently in school. She lives with her children at Sefwi in the Western region of Ghana. Vida is a baker. For the past 30 years, she has been baking bread and other pastries and taking care of her household. She bakes bread and supplies it to her loyal customers. In spite of the challenges she faces, she manages to handle the demands of her customers and fulfill their requests on time.

Her only problem now is raising adequate funds to buy raw materials because prices are shooting up. She requests a loan to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide for her family and save more for the future. She said that your help is much needed in her life and business.

loans.use: To buy baking materials such as flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood.

loans.name: Zinatoy

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Зинатой - 32 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Зинатой работает в Городской электросети в качестве контролера. Она зарабатывает средне. Ее муж таксист. Зарплату Зинатой они тратят на жизнь, а на зарплату мужа планируют провести ремонт санузлов. Поэтому они просят кредит, чтобы сделать ремонт санузлов, а потом погашать кредит с зарплаты мужа. До наступления холодов Зинатой и муж планируют закончить ремонт.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Zinatoy is 32 years old. She is married and is a mother of two children. Zinatoy works in the city electrical station as a controller. She earns average. He husband is a taxi driver. They spend Zinatoy's salary on everyday life and plan to use husband's salary to repair the bathroom. They are asking for a loan for this purpose and then will make payments on it from her husband's salary. Before the coming of winter Zinatoy and her husband plan to finish the repair.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the bathroom

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of three children who are currently in school. She lives with her husband and the children in a community in the western region of Ghana.

Mary is trader who trades in salt fish and onions in bulk in the community market. She gets the goods from Kumasi. It is her desire to save for her children's education. She is requesting a loan to buy goods to sell so that she can use the profit to assist her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy onions and salt fish in bulk.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Married with seven children, Abena is a 58-year-old trader. She has been trading for the past thirty years and has since been very resourceful to her family. She trades in cereals like maize. She treks to the farming communities to buy her foods and sells them retail to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current crude oil situation in the country. All of her children are independent.

loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk.

loans.name: Nadejda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Надежде 58 лет имеет одного сына.Сын учится в политехническом институте. Сама Надежда работает кассир-контролером в спец автобазе. Свободное время от работы ездит в районы Согдийской обл. на продажу посуды. В период кредитования она улучшила свой жизненный уровень и на запрашиваемой кредит хочет расширить свой ассортимент товара.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Nadejda is 58 years old, she has one son. Her son is studying in a polytechnic university. Nadejda herself works as a cashier controller at a car dealership. In her free time she travels to the regions of the Sogdiyskaya county to sell china. During her credit history she has improved her living standards and wants to use the loan to increase the assortment of her merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy china

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 30 years old. She is married and mother with two children who are currently in school. She lives with her husband and the children in a community in the western region of Ghana. She is trader who sells salt fish in bulk in the community market. She gets her stock of goods from Kumasi. It is her desire to save for her children's education. She is requesting a loan to buy more stock so she can use the profit to assist the husband in taking care of the children's educational needs. She believes that the loan will prevent her from frequent travel to Kumasi. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy salt fish in bulk.

loans.name: Tanazio's Group

texts.en:
T. Tanazio, 45, is the leader of his lending group in Bushenyi. He is a business man with a business of selling farm produce like beans, maize, Irish potatoes and matooke (steamed green plantain) to traders in and around his home area. He has run this business  for over ten years. He has a store in the Township and his dream is to have the biggest of its kind in the area since at the moment, he is able to make profits of 120,000/= per month.

Tanazio is married with nine children of whom five are still in school and he cares for two grandchildren. He longs for his children’s education since he believes they will be better off with education.

Tanazio needs a loan to help purchase more produce for resale since the amount he gets from his farm can never be enough for his business. Plus he will use part of the loan in employing manpower on the same farm.

loans.use: To buy more farm produce for resale and to employ manpower on his farm

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is 51 years old, and married with four children. She sells crates of drinks in wholesale and retail. She hopes for the loan amount to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Azizi

texts.en:
Azizi R. is a young boy who breeds calves in a small village of Dj.Rasulov district. Azizi is young and full of energy; he tries every single day to make the life of his family better. He started his business a year ago. He continued the business of his father, who is retired. Azizi has great experience in cattle breeding, since he has observed it since his childhood. Azizi would like to expand his business and purchase more calves. This will help him to increase his income and improve his living conditions. We wish him good luck and appreciate your help!    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Дилором - 46 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Занимается продажей женской обуви и женских платков на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Она закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Дилором ездит за товаром 2 раза в месяц. Дилором кредитуется у нас с 2008 года. Она успешно закончила два предыдущих займа и теперь запрашивает новый займ для закупки летней партии обуви и женских платков.
texts.en:
Dilorom is 46 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She sells women’s shoes and women’s scarves at the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov. Dilorom buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. She goes there twice per month. Dilorom has been our client since 2008. She successfully repaid two of her previous loans and now requests a new loan in order to purchase a summer stock of shoes and women’s scarves.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer shoes and scarves

loans.name: Rebecca Kisakye’S Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is the leader of a group with four members.  She is a 35-year-old single mother of five children, between the ages of 3 and 12. All her children go to school. She rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with five people. Rebecca also takes care of four additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water in her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. Rebecca deals in secondhand men’s clothes and shoes. She goes shopping daily, using public transport, to buy inventory from industrial producers. She sells to an average of 10 people a day, from all walks of life. She works seven days a week. Rebbecca sells mainly on a retail basis. Her major monthly expenses include school fees for her children, electricity and food. She has been in this business for the last ten years.

Rebecca has been with MCDT for over five years with the same group mates, and she is applying for their tenth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of shoes for resale. Rebecca hopes to see her business grow until she can earn a permanent business location and home.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is a businesswoman who trades in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials. She employs her own personal selling method, which she says makes her goods move very fast. She is 55 years old, and a divorced mother with three children. Two of her children are traders, and one is in school. Her trading business allows her to be very supportive of her family's needs. She has been selling for the past fifteen years, but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes this loan will enable her to revive the business and make more viable profit. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials in bulk, to increase her inventory. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothing in bulk to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional goods in bulk for sale

loans.name: Latif

texts.en:
L. Latif has run a livestock business for many years. He has used the proceeds from his business to support his parents because he is not married and has no children yet. Since he began his business, he has worked hard to use his earnings to sustain his home, and his livestock business has helped him to achieve his goals. Currently, Latif needs to purchase more livestock in order to expand his business. Intelligently, he is seeking a loan from IMON International in order to acquire additional animals to offer in markets.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 36 years old. She is married and the mother of three children who are currently in school. She is a petty trader (a small-scale salesperson) who sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, canned tomatoes, and bags of rice on top of a table. She says that the products sell very fast and you can easily recover your money and buy stock the next day.

She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi. With seven years trading experience, she wants to add other foods, like maize and eggs, that are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this can be possible with the help of loan assistance.

loans.use: To buy food like cooking oil, rice, spices and canned tomatoes

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
M. Nodira is 38 years old. She lives with her spouse and works every day, starting very early in the morning, so that she can get ahead and achieve her goal of having her son successfully finish school and enter the university. She sells clothes for women. Her business is located in the central market of Khujand. Thanks to the support of her spouse and her own effort, Nodira was able to expand her business. She began with little inventory and in a small space and now has a bigger space and a large clientele. With a loan of $1100 USD, Nodira will buy a greater variety of clothing styles, for a variety of occasions, and a few specific requests of her customers. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new clothing for women

loans.name: Teopista's Group

texts.en:
Teopista K. is the leader of Tusobola loan group in Mukono. She is a friendly, hard working lady with a drive to succeed in life with her family and children. Teopista has a retail shop in Kyetume, Mukono. She has owned her shop for 10 years and it has been in the same location. Her friendly nature has kept her good customers together.

This is Teopista’s first loan. She hopes to develop her shop and her family, just like the other ladies she has seen using loans. She is a married lady with 6 school-going children aged 8 – 18 years. She also cares for 4 orphans who are not yet in school due to lack of school fees and because she has just started caring with them. She will use her loan to buy more sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, and other products for her shop. In the future, she would like it to turn into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more products.

loans.name: Fuseina

texts.en: Fuseina is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three children, all of whom are currently in school. She operates a licensed chemical shop in the village in which she lives with her family. She has been operating the shop for eleven years to help her husband care for their family. She gets her supplies from Kumasi and sometimes from suppliers who come to her. With the loan, she wants to restock her shop with drugs that are frequently demanded by her customers. She wants to save her profits to meet her children's educational needs.

loans.use: For the purchase of pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Runty

texts.en: Runty is a very funny and very friendly woman who is determined to improve the profitability of her grocery and drink business. She has been in her business for the past 3 years. She is 36 years old and married with 5 children. She is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.en:
R. Makhfirat is a girl that enjoys her work. She is in the animal breeding business. Thanks to this business, she can cover her family’s expenses and help her parents with household expenses. Makhfirat wishes to increase the number of animals she has in order to improve breeding. She needs 3000 Somoni, which she guarantees will be properly invested. She is hoping for your support. Helping this girl to achieve prosperity is in your hands.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Абдусаттор Ганиев 1975 года рождения , женат имеет 3 детей. Имеет высшее образование. Но по специальности на работу не смог устроится. Пришлось зарабатывать на жизнь, тем что научили родители.  Он откармливает скот и продает на рынке каждую неделю. Разводит скот более 15 лет. В бизнесе участвуют и родители, так как они и научили его как ухаживать за скотом. На кредит купил 2 коровы и корм.
texts.en:
Abdusattor G. was born in 1975. He is married and has 3 children. He has a higher education. However, he was not able to find a job in his profession. So he had to earn a living with the skills taught by his parents. Abdusattor feeds livestock and sells it at a market every week. He has been raising livestock for over 15 years. His parents also participate in the business because they were the ones who taught him how to care for livestock. He wants to buy 2 cows and feed with this loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 2 cows and feed

loans.name: Sharafniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Шарафнисо - 35 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Шарафнисо занимается продажей кондитерских изделий на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Ей привозят товар фирмы, а иногда она сама ездит за товаров на рынок Панчшанбе города Худжанда. В город Худжанд она ездит за товаром 1-2 раза в месяц в зависимовти от продажи. Шарафнисо хочет взять кредит для закупки разного ассортимента товара, импортных конфет и печений. Шарафнисо благодарна за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Sharafniso is 35 years old. She is married and is a mother of 2 children. Sharafniso sells confectionery at the Favoron market in the city of Gafurov. Her suppliers deliver the product, and sometimes she goes to the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand to obtain the products. She goes to Khujand 1-2 times per month, depending on sales. Sharafniso wants to obtain a loan to buy different product assortment, such as imported candies and cookies. Sharafniso is grateful for the financial support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of imported candy and cookies

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta is 27 years old. She is married and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She is a seamstress. She is has been sewing for seven years. She is a specialist in women's clothing. Her skills and designs are of class. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, such as children's school uniforms, church attire, the kaba and slit (a tailored top and long skirt), wedding dresses, and funeral clothes. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of sewing materials like linen, thread and thimbles, to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings and provide her children with quality education.

loans.use: To buy sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Mansur

texts.en:
S. Mansur is 47 years old. He is married and has 2 children. Mansur is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children. He has a great experience in cattle breeding because he has been observing it for more than 10 years. His eldest son, who appears in the picture, helps him with his business. With time, he has increased his sales and now he needs assistance in investing in his business. The business has been going well and he would like it to continue to grow. Mansur has applied for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy young cattle. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them to continue this business and help them give their children a better quality of life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchasing cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Roziya

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Розия 15 лет торгует мужской одеждой на базаре. у нее качественный товар поэтому имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Товар она привозит из Бишкека. Период кредитования у нее улучшилось жизненный потенциал.Женила сына, дочка поступила в университет. На запрашиваемый кредит она хочет улучшить свой ассортимент и привозить модные, качественные спортивные костюмы.
texts.en:
Roziya has been selling men’s clothing at the market for over 15 years. Because she sells good quality merchandise, she has many loyal customers. Roziya brings the goods from Bishkek. Her quality of life improved during the financing period. She was able to marry off her son and send her daughter to a university. Roziya wants to use this loan to improve her merchandise assortment and bring in fashionable, quality athletic suits.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of men's athletic suits

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is 57 years old and has five children. She sells drinks and pepper soup. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. Mariam says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of goods, in bulk.

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo is a petty trader; she sells food items and provisions. She has been in the business for the past 5 years. Fumilayo lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. Fumilayo hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more food and provisions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more food and provisions to sell

loans.name: Akramjon

texts.en:
S. Akramjon is 24 years old. He is married and has two small children. Akramjon has a small restaurant where he sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. Prior to opening his own business, he worked at a restaurant where he learned the ins and outs of the trade. When Akramjon first started his business he only opened to sell breakfast because he worked at night. Once his place became more popular he was able to dedicate his whole time to the business. Akramjon wants this loan so he may invest in tables, chairs and utensils. He is asking for $1500 USD. With this money, Akramjon will be able to expand his business and to earn more. The well being of this family is in your hands. Contribute to the growth of his business and they will be grateful.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase tables, chairs and utensils for expanding his cafe.

loans.name: Esther Kiden’S Group

texts.en: Esther is the leader of a 5-member group. She is 30 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 12 years. All of her children go to school. She resides in a rented a two-roomed house where she is staying with seven people. Esther takes care of four additional family members. There is electricity, but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. Esther fries groundnuts and distributes them to different shops. At times, she gives the product to young boys who sell them by Kampa city roads. She uses public transport to and from shopping and goes for shopping daily from producers in the industrial area. She sells to an average of 20 people a day, all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Esther sells mainly on a retail basis and, at times, at her home in Mengo Kisenyi. Her major monthly expenses include school fees for her children, electricity and food. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Esther has been with MCDT for over 1 year and is servicing her second loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more groundnuts for resale. Esther is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and hopes to own a permanent business premise and her own home.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of ground nuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of ingredients for making animal feed in bulk.

loans.name: Suraiyo

texts.en:
A. Suraiyo is 38 years old. She is married and uses all the money she makes to care for her two children and to provide for their education. Suraiyo has 14 years of experience selling dried fruits. She makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth, month by month. Today, Suraiyo requests a loan of 3000 Somoni for purchasing dried fruits. Her purpose is to processing the fruits in order to increase the range of goods to be sold. Suraiyo expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of dried fruits to process.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 49-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Imad has owned a restaurant for two years. He sells all types of sandwiches, fruit cocktails, and ice cream. He requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase an Italian oven for roasting chicken. This is the first time that Imad has requested a loan.

Imad is special in his work because he knows how to treat his customers. His customers are his friend, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Imad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job, and he had always wanted to open a restaurant. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase an Italian oven for roasting chicken

loans.name: Akmaljon

texts.en:
D. Akmaljon is a 48 year old man. He is married and has two children. Akmaljon’s goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God will continue to provide him with more life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals. He is a taxi driver and travels the streets of Isfara city in search of customers. He has owned his business for 5 years. Today Akmaljon’s car needs maintenance. That is the reason he wants to borrow $ 1300 USD to purchase spare parts for his car. Akmaljon sincerely thanks Kiva and all lenders that make this help possible.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the car.

loans.name: Mahsudchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Махсудчон – молодой мужчина 36 лет. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Имеет высшее техническое образование, но работы по своей специальности пока не нашел. Жена Махсудчона домохозяйка, делает работу по дому и присматривает за детьми. Махсудчон как глава семьи работает и зарабатывает деньги. Он водит маршрутное такси № 113 по маршруту Худжанд – Х. Бакирган. Он работает по графику: 2 дня работает, 1 день отдыхает. В рабочие дни он старается максимально заработать деньги, и работает с раннего утра до поздней ночи. В выходной день он ремонтирует свою машину. Займ он хотел бы использовать на ремонт своего маршрутного такси.
texts.en:
Mahsudchon is a young 36-year-old man. He is married and is a father of 3 children. He has a higher technical education, but has not yet found a job in his profession. Mahsudchon’s wife is a homemaker. She does house work and looks after the children. As the head of the family, Mahsudchon works and earns money. He drives a shuttle taxi #113 on the Khujand-H.Bakirgan route. He works on this schedule: 2 days on and 1 day off. He tries to maximize his earnings on the workdays and works from early morning to late night. He repairs his car on his days off. Mahsudchon wants to use this loan to repair his work vehicle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en: Abosede is 42 years old, married and has three children. She sells sarongs and laces. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs and laces to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and laces to sell.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is an 18-year-old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon. Hassan has owned a coffee shop for a year. He also serves narguileh (also known as shisha in Egypt). Narguileh is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. A tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. Narguileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East and is beginning to gain popularity in the US, Europe and other countries. Hassan also has a billiard table for those who want to play.

Hassan requested a loan of $700 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan. Hassan is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and clients feel comfortable going to his coffee shop. His clients are his friend, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Hassan decided on this business because he wanted to work independently and he has always wanted to have a coffee shop. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a coffee shop

Тоировой 33 лет имеет двоих детей. Она работает портнихой в ПО "Навбахор" города Худжанда. У нее очень много заказов так как она лучшая портниха в цеху. Также она обучает шитью и моделированию учениц. На запрашиваемый кредит хочет купить фурнитуры и ткани для пошива летных платьев.

Dilorom is 33 years old, she has two children. She works as a seamstress in Navbahor in the town of Khujand. She has a lot of orders as she is the best seamstress in the company. She also teaches sewing and modeling. She wants to use the loan to buy furniture and fabrics for making of summer dresses.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy potatoes in bulk and improve her working place by making some renovations.

loans.name: Abdullojon

texts.en:
T. Abdullojon has been working on cattle raising business since 1999. He has been able to support his family and his 4 grown children. Almost all of his children are married and have their own family. Abdullojon is requesting this loan in order to purchase cows to increase his cattle inventory. He is supported by his younger son who works with him taking care of the cattle. His dream is to increase his current inventory and, that way, to improve his family's living standards.
