loans.use: To purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 60-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mohammad has owned an accessory shop for 39 years. He sells toys, souvenirs, makeup, perfume and other accessories. He requested a loan of $3000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. Mohammad has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his shop by diversifying his products and improved his financial situation. Mohammad's business is special because of his large variety of products and his good reputation. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Mohammad didn’t face difficulties starting this business. He decided on this venture because, when he was young he used to sell perfumes and makeup, but he lost his job because of the war. That's when he decided to open his own shop. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en: Abosede sells palm oil and she is also a stylist. Abosede lives in Abulegba and she has been a LAPO client for the past two years. Abosede is 35 years old and married with two children. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more palm oil and hair extensions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil and hair extensions

loans.name: Ctr 70 Mulago Group

texts.en:
Victo is a leader of a four-member group. She is 40 and married with five children between the ages of 15 and 23. All of her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she resides with three people. Victo doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. 

She resides and works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. Victo sells motorcycle oil in Mulago triangle, one of Kampala's suburbs. She uses public transport to and from shops in Kampala city and goes for shopping once a week. She sells to an average of 20 people per day, mainly men. She works seven days a week and sells mainly on a retail basis. 

Victo's major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for both her home and business. She has been in this business for the last six years. Victo has been with MCDT for more than seven years and is servicing her 14th loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of motorcycle oil. Victo aspires to see her business grow bigger

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of motorcycle oil

loans.name: Wofugan

texts.en:
Wofugan C. is a married Tanzanian entrepreneur with a small business. He runs a food shop in the Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells a variety of food crop products: maize flour, wheat flour, beans, ground nuts, cashew nuts, sugar and cooking oil.

He purchases the business goods direct from the producers and sometimes from the city market at Kariakoo in Dar es Salaam on a wholesale basis and sells on a retail basis to his customers. He manages to meet the daily demands of his family from the business income. He needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to boost up the business.

loans.use: To extend the business

loans.name: Gufron

texts.en:
T. Gufron is married and has two children. He runs a small business selling wheat, corn and sunflower seeds in the local market. His place is located on the main market aisle where there are many customers every day. Gufron has been in this business for over 12 years. He is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of his business. Gufron is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni to increase the assortment of his selling inventory. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Gufron's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.

loans.use: To buy wheat, corn and sunflower seeds

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Назире – 46 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Имеет высшее образование. Она занимается продажей детской одежды. Она торгует на рынка «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда, а также на рынке "Саховат" и по воскресеньям на рынке "Якшанбебазар" города Худжанда. Назира закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан и часть товара из города Бишкек Республики Киргизстан. Она ездит за товаром 2-3 раза в месяц. Назира кредитуется у нас с 2002 года. Она очень хороший и давний наш клиент. Назира просит кредит для закупки новой партии летнего детской одежды их хлопчатобумажной ткани. Тогда у Назиры увеличится ассортимент ее товара и у нее увеличится количество клиентов.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Nazira is 46 years old, she is married and is a mother of two children. She has high education. She sells children's clothing. She sells on the Panschabe market in the town of Khujand and also on the Sahovat market as well as on the Yakwanbebazar market on Sundays in Khujand. She travels for the merchandise two to three times a month. Nazira has been borrowing from us since 2002. She is our very good and old client. Nazira is asking for a loan to buy a new batch of summer children's clothing made from cotton. This way Nazira's assortment will increase and she will have more customers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer children's clothing

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 34-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon. Mouhamad has been working as a car painter for sixteen years. Mouhamad requested a loan of $3,000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and paint for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his garage. Mouhamad is special in his work because of his efficiency. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Mouhamad first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mouhamad decided on doing his work because of his experience and wanting to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and paint for his work.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey S. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and small business man. He runs a pub business at Kiwalani Ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells different types of soft and alcoholic drinks in his pub; also, he sells cooked food and snakes. He has been in the business for six years. He pays his children's school fees and meets his family's daily demands from his business income. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is a 35-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. He has been working as a blacksmith for ten years. Yasser requested a loan of $1000 US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Yasser is noted for his punctuality and efficiency. His clients can be anybody from inside or outside his region. Yasser didn’t face difficulties when he first started his business. He decided on this work to meet his family’s needs. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin is a LAPO client. She sells kerosene in retail and wholesale to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. Toyin is 47 years old and married with three children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 42-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He has been working as a blacksmith for 20 years. Ali requested a loan of $2000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and iron for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Ali is has a reputation for his good work. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network. Ali decided on this business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and iron for his work

loans.name: Мухайё Mukhaiyo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Шодиева торгует на базаре Костокоза более 10 лет. У нее много клиентов так как она продает качественные товары. Период кредитование у нее увеличилось товарооборот,а также смогла улучшить свой семейный статус. На запрашиваемый кредит она хочет разнообразить и улучшить ассортимент летней детской одежды.
texts.en:
S. has been selling at the Kostokoz market for more than 10 years. She sells quality goods, so she has a lot of customers. During the lending period sales have increased, and she has also been able to improve her family's living conditions. She is seeking a loan because she would like to diversify and improve her assortment of children's summer clothing.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's summer clothing

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en: Sauda S. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and business woman. She runs a café as a food vendor at Yombo Kiwalani Ward in Dar es Salaam. She also sells soft drinks to customers. She has three school children and she manages to pay their school fees from the business income. She has also managed to purchase a building site. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Abdukhalil

texts.en:
F. Abdukhalil is 43 years old. He is married and has 4 children. His wife works as a teacher in the local school. For many years, Abdukhalil has lived very happily in his small house surrounded by his farm and the "good morning" of a beautiful sunrise every day. He rises before sunrise and, with love and hope, he works the field that generate his family's income. Abdukhalil is applying for a loan of $1000 USD to buy the supplies necessary for the maintenance of his crop, including seeds and fertilizer. These supplies will guarantee the quality of the harvest to which he has dedicated many hours of work during many months.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gollen Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes un groupe de jeunes femmes qui voulons nous activer dans le commerce du bois de menuiserie en ouvrant un magasin de vente en détail du bois déja transformer pour l'utilisation des menuisiers de notre écovillage d'une part et aussi l'ouverture d'une boutique de produits féminis que nous comptons exploiter en même temps. Ce choix est dû au fait que les menuisier vont toujours chercher leur matières premières à Ziguinchor qui est distant de 45 kilomètres, alors que notre écovillage ne dispose pas d'activité dans ce sens. C'est pour cela que nous avons chertché à faire autres choses que ce qui se fait d'habitude. La demande en bois de menuiserie est très forte et souvant les artisans ne répondent pas à la demande par manque de matériaux et c'est cela que nous voulons combler. De l'autre coté nous allons installer une boutique de vente d'effets vestimentaires féminins, qui est aussi très demandé.
texts.en:
We are a group of young women who want to be active in the lumber business by opening a retail store for wood which has already been processed and is ready for carpenters to use in our eco-village.  In addition, we would open a shop of women's items that we intend to operate at the same time.  This choice is due to the fact that furniture makers always go to find their raw materials in Ziguinchor, which is 45 km away, while our eco-village lacks this kind of business.  This is why we sought to do something different that what is usually done.  The demand for lumber is very high, and artisans do not often meet it due to a lack of supplies.  And this is what we want to fill.  Elsewhere, we are going to establish a shop for women's clothing and accessories, which are also in high demand.   

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and some wood for carpentry

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
F. Sharif is happily married to his wife. Their marriage has been blessed with 4 lovely children. Sharif has decided that he wants to live the rest of his life in the place where he was born. He not only loves the peaceful environment, but it also houses their major source of income, farming. He has been involved in farm activities since childhood. He is used to the heat of the sun. Sharif has worked as a farmer for the past 10 years. However, life has been difficult and progress slow. Because he lacks financial resources, Sharif would like to borrow 2500 Somoni so that he can buy seeds and fertilizer for his crop. Sharif has gained a reputation for responsibility with his financial obligations and for keeping his word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist him with the operation of his business.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Мавлуда – женщина 47 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается продажей детской одежды и женской обуви на рынке Панчшанбе города Худжанда. Так как ее муж не очень хорошо зарабатывает, она старается много работать и зарабатывать побольше денег, чтобы прокормить семью. Конечно же ей очень трудно. Мавлуда закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан.  Мавлуда хотела, бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому, что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Для этого она предпочла взять займ для расширения своего ассортимента.
texts.en:
Mavluda is a 47-year-old woman. She is married and is a mother of 3 children. She has a secondary education. Mavluda sells children’s clothing and women’s shoes at the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand. Because her husband does not make much money, Mavluda tries to work more and earn more money in order to support the family. It is obviously hard for her. Mavluda buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. Mavluda wants to expand her merchandise assortment because good assortment attracts more customers. She prefers to obtain a loan for expanding her goods assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of goods assortment

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells provisions and foodstuffs. She has been in her business for the past 10 years. Florence is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to enable her to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Sekinot

texts.en: Sekinot is 36 years old and married with two children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. Sekinot sells building materials in retail to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. She says thank you and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Bisi

texts.en: Bisi sells clothes and she has been in this business for the past 20 years. Bisi lives in Abulegba and she has been borrowing from LAPO for the past 3 years. She is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more clothes in large quantities to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
M. Bahrom is dedicated to the business of livestock. He distinguishes himself by having a lot of experience when it comes to livestock. He supports his spouse and two children and also provides for their education. Thanks to his hard work, he has been able to give his children his support so that they can get ahead. Bahrom is hoping for the support of IMON with the goal of obtaining a loan of 2500 Somoni. The loan will allow him to purchase young cattle, raise and breed them, and in this way, to earn more. Both Bahrom and his loving family will benefit from this loan.

loans.use: To buy cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Isack

texts.en: Isack S. is a Tanzanian micro-business entrepreneur and married man. He runs a clothing and shoes shop at  Yombo Kiwalan Ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases the business goods from the Karume city market as second hand goods in wholesale and retail. He sells the goods to customers in retail. The business income generated is used to meet his family's daily demands and for business capitalization. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Mirdjamol

texts.en:
M. Mirdjamol and his family have always been dedicated to agriculture. Mirdjamol is 44 years old, married and has 3 children. He has always been focused on making the land produce. His loans have generally been spent on the supplies necessary to obtain good production. In the future, Mirdjamol expects to have his own working capital which will allow him to cover his costs and buy more land so he can increase production and grow as a farmer. Currently he needs a loan of 4000 Somoni to continue purchasing farming supplies for his crop.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Зулфинисо – 42 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. Она занимается продажей мужской одежды. Она торгует на рынке «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. В пятницу она выходит на рынок «Джума-базар», а в воскресенье на рынок «Якшанбе-базар». Зулфинисо закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан, и часть товара в городе Бишкек Республики Кыргызстан. Она ездит за товаром 2-3 раза в город Истаравшан и 1 раз в месяц или раз в два месяца в город Бишкек. Зулфинисо за свой кредит хочет закупить партию летней мужской одежды и школьных сорочек для мальчиков.
texts.en:
Zulfiniso is 42 years old. She is married and is a mother of 2 children. She has a secondary education. Zulfiniso sells men’s clothing at the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand. She goes to the Djuma-bazar on Fridays and at the Yakshanbe-bazar on Sundays. Zulfiniso buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan and some merchandise in the city of Bishkek in the Kyrgyzstan Republic. Zulfiniso wants to use this loan to buy a stock of men’s summer clothing and school shirts for boys.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of men's summer clothing and school shirts for boys

loans.name: Rahmonkul

texts.en:
O. Rahmonkul is 56 years old, married, and has three children. He has secondary education and has an animal husbandry business. He has a small cow house where he breeds calves. Because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. Rahmonkul buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells in the same market at a more profitable price. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. Rahmonkul wants to buy young cattle and needs money, so he decided to apply for a loan. He is very grateful to all those who can support him.

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Мавлуде 43 года. Замужем и мать 5-х детей. Имеет среднее-специальное образование. Она закончила колледж по специальности товароведение. Мавлуда занимается продажей мужской и детской одежды на рынке панчшанбе, Дусти и Саховат города Худжанда. Мавлуда закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан, а иногда она закупает товар у крупных торговцев, которые ездят в Бишкек и Турцию. Ей это обходится дешевле, потому, что ее товарооборот не такой уж большой. она хочет расширить свой бизнес и закупать побольше товара, так как наступает школьный сезон и все люди начинают покупать школьную одежду с Августа месяца. Мавлуда просит займ для осуществления этой цели, и благодарна кредитной организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Mavluda is 43 years old. She is married and is a mother of 5 children. She has a secondary specialized education. She finished a college program in commodity research. Mavluda sells men’s and children’s clothing at the Panchshanbe, Dusti and Sahovat markets in the city of Khujand. Mavluda buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan and sometimes from large traders who go to Bishkek and Turkey. It is cheaper for her because her goods turnover is not that big. She wants to expand her business and buy more merchandise because school season is coming, and people are starting to buy school clothing in August. Mavluda is requesting a loan to accomplish this goal and is grateful to our organization for the financial support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school clothing

loans.name: Pardakhol

texts.en:
A. Pardakhol, age 42, is a married woman. She and her husband have two children. In the midst of their agricultural jobs, they show a great deal of optimism and confidence, putting all their effort in the farming of vegetables, which they later offer to wholesalers. All this effort is paying off, because they have recently started the construction of their own house. This has been a great source of motivation for them and, therefore, they wish to improve the quality of their products through a better use of raw materials and seeds. They are requesting a loan of 2600 Somoni which will help them to finish the construction of their dream house for which they have yearned so long.

loans.use: To buy seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mamud

texts.en:
G. Mamud is a hard-working man who is in agriculture. He has worked at this business for a long time and acquired his abilities in ranching and farming when he was very young. He is a married father with responsibilities for maintaining his 3 children. Mamud is known as being very responsible and hard-working, because every day, very early in the morning, he starts his job taking care of his fields and raising cattle in his own pen located at his house. IMON International has been the backbone of his business because they gave him loans which have allowed him to improve his standard of living through the acquisition of cattle and vegetables for planting. Today, once again, Mamud trusts that his credit will be approved and he will be able to improve his business with the purchase of cattle and farm supplies to plant.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en: Upendo S. M. is a Tanzanian micro-business entrepreneur and married woman. She has a food shop business at Yombo Lumo Ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells different types of food crop products including wheat flour, maize flour, beans, ground nuts, and cooking oil. She purchases the business goods direct from the producers in wholesale and from the Kariakoo city market. She meets her daily family demands from her business income. She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to add capital to the business.

loans.use: To add capital to the business

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
M. Haidar is 34 years old. He is married and has 6 children. Haidar sells women's shawls in the central market of Shahrituz. His wife, who appears in the photograph, helps him with the business. For 10 years, he managed to serve his clientele. Thus, Haidar‘s business is his main source of income, allowing him to improve his living conditions and provide his children with education. He requests $600 USD to buy new women's shawls in order to increase the range of goods that he sells. Haidar would like to thank everyone for support and promises to repay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new women's shawls

loans.name: Mirzochon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Мирзочону 60 лет. Женат и имеет 3-х детей. Занимается продажей колбасных изделий и сливочного масла на рынке Панчшанбе города Худжанда, возле мясной будки № 117. Ему поставляют товар разные колбасные цехи. Половину товара он берет под реализацию а половину за наличные деньги. Тот товар, который он берет под реализацию, он берет подороже. Поэтому Мирзочон хочет взять кредит, чтобы оплатить весь товар, чтобы ему обошлось подешевле.
texts.en:
Mirzochon is 60-years-old, and married with 3 children. He earns his living selling sausage products and butter alongside meat stall № 117at the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand. He gets his product from a number of different sausage shops. He buys half on consignment and the other half with cash. The goods he gets on consignment are somewhat less expensive, so Mirzochon would like to get a loan in order get everything on consignment at less cost.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For sausage products and butter

loans.name: Alberto Miomo

texts.pt:
Alberto Miomo C. nasceu em Gaza, tem 62 anos de idade e casado e pai de 7 filhos com idades compreendas entre os 10 aos 40 anos de idade. Somente os três mais novos e que se encontram a estudar.

Alberto sai de gaza quando criança para capital Maputo a procura de emprego, começa a trabalhar para um oficial Português como empregado doméstico, mas devido a sua dedicação no trabalho o português consegue arranjar uma vaga para ele numa das escolas oficias e faz a 6ª classe do antigo sistema. Anos depois o patrão volta a Portugal e ele fica desempregado então emigra para áfrica do sul e trabalha nas minas, mas devido à morte do seu irmão durante a escavação na mina seu pai obriga Alberto a deixar aquele emprego alegando que era muito perigoso, assim ele regressa a casa da sua irmã esta que vivia no Município da vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia. Dois anos depois consegue arranjar um emprego como estivador bracal e devido à dedicação e força de vontade é promovido para gerente do STIVA durante 20 anos auferia mensalmente um valor de 25.000.00MT, mas quando ele é avisado acerca da sua reforma constrói de imediato uma barraca em sua casa. Hoje ele é reformado e aufere um valor mensal de 8.500.00MT o que não satisfaz as sua necessidades então numa conversa com a sua esposa que e nossa cliente fala acerca dos nossos serviços aproxima se solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00MT para reforçar o seu negócio. O impacto da sua actividade é notório, pois fornece produtos básicos a comunidade reduzindo distâncias anteriormente percorridas em busca do mesmo serviço. Tem viajado uma vez por semana, pois é único com barraca e porque também tem facilidade de transporte, tem tido de lucro 2.500.00MT e consegue poupar 1.000.00MT, pois iram ajudar muito nos momentos críticos do seu negócio, para alem dos seus filhos não responsabiliza se por ninguém.

Este e o primeiro empréstimo de Alberto na Hluvuku e Kiva, os 15.000.00MT serão usados para aumentar o volume do seu negócio, esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um outro para dar inicio a criação de frangos.
texts.en:
Alberto Miomo C. was born in Gaza. He is 62 years old, married, and the father of 7 children with ages between 10 and 40 years old. Only the three youngest are in school. Alberto left Gaza when he was a child for the capital, Maputo, in search of work. He began working for a Portuguese official as domestic help. Due to his dedication to his work the Portuguese was able to arrange a spot for him in one of the official schools, and he finished the 6th grade in the old system. Years later his boss returned to Portugal, and he was left unemployed. He went to South Africa and worked in the mines, but due to the death of his brother during an excavation of a mine, his father demanded Alberto to leave that line of work claiming it was too dangerous. He came to live with his sister who lived in the town of Namaacha which borders Swaziland. Two years later he was able to arrange a job as a cargo loader, and because his dedication and force of will he was promoted to the manager of STIVA. For 20 years he earned a monthly sum of 25,000MT, but when he was advised of his retirement he immediately constructed a stand in his home. Today he is retired and earns a monthly sum of 8,500MT which does not satisfy his necessities. During a conversation with his wife, who is our client, he learned of our services and solicited a loan in the amount of 15,000MT to strengthen his business. The impact of his activity is notorious. He provides basic products to the community reducing the distances people previously covered in search for the same service. He travels one time each week, and he is the only one with a stand and also because he has transportation. He has earned 2,500MT and is able to save 1,000MT, and that has helped in the critical moments of his business. Besides his children he is not responsible for anyone else. This is his first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. The 15,000MT will be used to increase the volume of his business. He is confident that he will pay off the loan before the due date and request another loan to begin raising chickens.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks in his shop

loans.name: Muattar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Муаттар 41 год. Она замужем и мать 5-х детей. Муаттар занимается пошивом женской одежды на заказ. Кроме этого она учит девушек шитью за дополнительную плату. Муаттар берет заказы и шьет разную женскую одежду, в том числе национальные платья, юбки, сорочки, брюки и т.д. Муаттар берет кредит в нашей организации второй раз. Она хочет приобрести импортную машину "Аверлог" для своего дела. Муаттар надеется, что кредит поможет ей расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Muattar is a 41-year-old, married mother of five. Muattar is engaged in sewing women's clothes to order. Besides that, she is teaching young women to sew for additional income. Muattar takes orders and sews various women's clothes, including national dresses, skirts, shirts, trousers and the like. Muattar is taking a loan from our organization for the second time. She wants to acquire an imported "Averlog" sewing machine for her work. Muattar hopes that the loan will help her to expand her business. --- MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Furniture and an Averlog sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock his shop with merchandise

loans.name: Helena Da Conceição

texts.pt:
Helena Da Conceição S. nasceu em Manica tem 45 anos de idade e mãe de 6 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 8 aos 28 anos de idade. Os quatro mais novos e que se encontram a estudar.

Após o casamento, Helena sai de Manica com seu esposo este que residia na cidade capital Maputo, apos sua chegada passava a maior parte do tempo sozinha, pois seu marido era camioneta, sendo assim a vida fica difícil e ela inicia seu próprio negócio de pastel eira actividade que aprendeu com sua mãe na sua infância. Anos depois seu esposo compra um terreno no Município da vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia e constrói uma casa onde ela vive ate então, hoje e proprietária de uma lanchonete sita na Escola Secundária da Namaacha trabalha das 4h as 22h, horário em que termina o curso nucturno e conta com dois empregados que auferem 1.500.00MT cada. Tem como melhor produto de venda (pasteis, chamussas e bolos) que tem feito por encomendas para baptismos, casamentos e aniversários viaja uma vez por semana onde adquiri o saco de trigo a 920x6 e bidões de óleo a 760x6 e dois sacos de açúcar a 1200.00MT cada gastando no mínimo um valor de 15.000.00MT obtendo de lucro um valor de 10.000.00MT mensalmente. Para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua mãe que vive com ela em sua casa

Este e terceiro empréstimo de Helena na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva os dois primeiros foram usados para aumentar o volume do seu produto, estes 15.000.00MT serão usados para o mesmo fim e esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir a obra do seu armazém no mercado informal shoprite e meter mercadoria, pois ela pretende vender a grosso.
texts.en:
Helena Da Conceição S. was born in Manica, she's 45 years old and a mother to 6 children between the ages of 8 and 28 years old. The 4 younger ones are attending school. After getting married, Helena left Manica with her husband who resided in the capital city of Maputo at the time. At the beginning of her life there, she used to spend a long time on her own because her husband was a truck driver. She then started a business selling Pastel ( a typical deep fried treat), a trade she learned from her mother during her childhood. Years later, her husband bought a plot of land in the city of Namaacha in the Swaziland boarder and built the house where they now live. Nowadays, she is the owner of a snack bar located inside the Namaacha secondary school. She works from 4 am to 10 pm, time when the night classes end. She is helped by two employees who earn 1.500,00 MT each. Her best selling items are pastel, chamussas and cakes. She makes them to order, for baptisms, weddings and birthday parties. Helena travels once a week to buy wheat flour, vegetable oil cans and two bags of sugar for 1.200,00MT each, spending at least 15.000,00 MT and getting a profit in the amount of 10.000,00 MT monthly. Besides being responsible for her children, she also has her mother under her care. This is her third loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. Her first two loans were used to increase her production, this one will be used for the same purpose. She is confident she'll be able to repay her loan before the payment due date. She plans on requesting another loan in the future in order to finish building her shop in the informal market "Shoprite" and increase her stock because she plans on selling items wholesale in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks in her shop

loans.name: Allah Wallie Group

texts.en:
This is Sallamatu J., Fatmata J. and Rashid B.. They named their group Allah Wallie. They are local entrepreneurs based in Waterloo, a small town about 22 miles from Freetown.  This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Shine on Sierra Leone. With this loan, their businesses will improve in size and quality. Sales and profit will also improve as a result. Consequently, they will be in a better position to help their children in their educational, nutritional and medical needs.

Sallamatu J. (right) is the leader of this group. Sallamatu is now 37 years of age. She was born in Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone. She currently resides in Waterloo together with her husband who is a lorry driver. They have one child who is in Junior Secondary School II. Sallamatu sells market food and has been in the business for seven years now. This loan will enable her to improve the standard of her business.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional stock of cloth in bulk

loans.name: João Crisóstomo

texts.pt:
João Crisóstomo A. tem 54 anos de idade, nasceu e cresceu em Inhambane, é casado e Pai de 6 filhos de idades compreendias entre 8 anos aos 25 anos. O mais velho esta a trabalhar na  vizinha África do Sul, o segundo está fazer 2°ano de faculdade e os outros mais novos estão a frequentar o Ensino Geral.
João sai de Inhambane para capital Maputo com seu tio alegando que ia estudar apos concluir o curso de professorado e afecto para trabalhar no Municipio da vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia. Apos sua chegada trabalha na escola Agraria como Professor de Portugues durante 4 anos e foi transferido para trabalhar na Direcçao Distrital da Educaçao, e funcionario permanente, ocupando a função de Tecnico de Produção e Alimemtação Escolar e oufere um salario liquido de 4.500,00mtn mas não consegue poupar nada no final do mês devido ao custo elevado de vida. João vive actulmente com a sua familia numa casa cedida pelos serviços e está a construir a sua propria casa no mesmo distrito com emprestimo que contraiu no BIM  no valor de 16.000.00mt e pagou durante 2 anos, com este valor ele não consegue concluir a sua obra devido ao elevado custo do material e aproxima se a hluvuku  e kiva solicitando um empréstimo para dar continuidade da mesma.Para alem da sua familia João responsabiliza-se pelo sobrinho orfão de pais que vive em Inhambane, manda lhe uma sexta básica anualmente no valor de 500.00mtn.
Este e o o terceiro empréstimo de João na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva. Os dois primeiros empréstimos foram usados para comprar material de construção para dar continuidade da sua obra e pede este terceiro para a mesma finalidade este confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para fazer manutenção de água e energia.
texts.en:
João Crisóstomo A. is 54 years old. He was born and raised in Inhambane. He's married and a father of 6 children between the ages of 8 and 25 years old. His eldest son works in the neighboring country of South Africa, his second one is a sophomore in college and the younger children are attending school. After getting a teaching degree, João left Inhambane and headed to the capital city of Maputo with his uncle to work in the neighboring village of Namaacha, on the boarder of Swaziland. After arriving there, he got a job teaching the Portuguese Language, position that he held for 4 years before being transferred to work in the Regional Education Department as Production of School Meals technician. He is a permanent employee and makes a net income of 4.500,00MT. He isn't able to save any money due to the high cost of living in his area. João currently lives with his family in a house that was provided to them by the social services. He is building his own house with a loan he received from BIM in the amount of 16.000,00MT. He paid that loan over the course of two years, but the amount borrowed was not enough to conclude the work due to the high cost of materials in the area. He then approached Hluvuku and Kiva, requesting a loan in order to finish his house. Besides taking care of his family, João is also responsible for his nephew, who is an orphan and lives in Inhamane. He sends him groceries, which costs him 500,00MT annually. This is his third loan with Hluvuku and the second with Kiva. His first two loans were used to buy construction material to continue building his home and the third one is going to be used for the same purpose. He is confident he will be able to pay back before the due date and he intends to request a new loan in the future in order to set up water and electric services in his new home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Casa Mas 2 Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes le deuxième groupe de l'association Casa Mas,(réf.50953) qui a déjà bénéficié d'un prêt de Kiva qui vient de boucler son remboursement. Nous sommes donc des jeunes garçons et filles qui veulent faire de la restauration hors de notre village. Nous avons opté pour la création d'un fast-food sur le continent pour pouvoir aider nos familles restées au village de Carabane où nous habitons. Seulement cette activité se fera hors du village car le potentiel en terme de rendement ne peut se faire que dans un lieu de forte affluence qui se trouve être un écovillage (Elinkine),localisé sur le continent , qui est de surcroit un port de pêche. L'endroit est très peuplé par des personnes qui y travaillent pendant toute la saison et qui rencontrent des difficultés pour se nourrir.Tous les membre de notre groupe ont eu une formation en restauration dans des écoles de tourisme
texts.en:
We are the second group of the association Casa Mas (ref. 50953) which has already benefited from a Kiva loan, which has just been repaid.  Basically, we are young boys and girls who want to work in food catering outside our village.  We have opted for creating a fast-food restaurant on the mainland in order to be able to help our families still back in the village of Carabane, where we live.  Just this business will be operated outside our village because the potential for financial returns can only be had in a place where many people come together.  Such a place is an eco-village (Elinkine) that is located on the mainland and that is moreover a fishing port.  This place is crowded with people who work there the entire season and who meet with difficulties in feeding themselves.  All of our group members have had training in the restaurant business in our tourism schools.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy restaurant supplies, equipment, and pots and pans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Marta Chavela

texts.pt:
Marta Chavela D. N. nasceu em Changalane uma Localidade que dista 38 km da vila do Município da Namaacha. Tem 40 anos de idade e mãe de 3 filhos com idades compreenD. entre os 5 aos 18 anos de idade. todos eles encontram se a estudar.

Marta inicia o seu próprio negócio apos a morte do seu sogro, este que era proprietário de uma grande loja que dista 7 km da vila do Município da Namaacha em Macuacua porque era a única nora casada oficialmente foi cedida para explorar aquele estabelecimento. Seu marido que e proprietário de um tractor iniciam com trabalhos de lavoura nas machambas onde conseguiu juntar um fundo para dar a sua mulher iniciar com o negócio, anos depois houve um conflito entre familiares na disputa de bens do seu falecido sogro e ela fica na beira da falência. Numa conversa com sua prima que e nossa cliente falam lê acerca dos nossos serviços e ela aproxima se solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT para reforçar o seu negocio e ela consegue levar avante, tem viajado uma vez por mês devido à localização da sua loja que se encontra perto da fronteira e a maior parte dos consumidores fazem as compras na vizinha suazilândia, ela tem como melhor produto (açúcar, arroz e bebiD.). Consegue de lucro um valor de 4.000.00MT e consegue poupar 1.000.00MT, pois conta com ajuda de 2 empregados e com ajuda do seu esposo que é criador e proprietário de 32 cabeças de gado bovino, para alem dos seus filhos marta responsabiliza se pela sua mãe enviando lhe 1.000.00MT em cada 3 meses.


Este e o segundo empréstimo de Marta na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. O primeiro usou para reforçar o seu negócio, pois encontrava se na beira da falência, Estes 20.000.00MT serviram para aumentar o volume do seu stock. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para expandir mais ainda o seu negocio e vender a grosso.
texts.en:
Marta Chavela D. N. was born in Changalane, a community 38 km from the town of Namaacha. She is 40 years old and has three children between the ages of 5 and 18. All of them are still in school. Marta started her own business after her father-in-law's death. He owned a large store 7 km from Namaacha in Macuacua. Because she was the only daughter-in-law who was legally married, it was left to her to care. Her husband owned a tractor and worked on small farms to earn money to help his wife with her business. Years later there was a family dispute over the distribution of the deceased's assets, and she was on the verge of bankruptcy. A cousin told our client about our services, and she came to us to request a loan in the amount of 10,000 meticals to improve her business. She has been successful. Because of her store's location near the border with Swaziland, most consumers do their shopping in the neighboring country. She travels once a month and has the best products (sugar, rice, and beverages). She makes 4000 meticals profit each month and saves 1000 meticals, since she has the help of two employees and of her husband, who raises cattle and owns 32 head. In addition to her children, Marta takes care of her mother, sending her 1000 meticals every three months. This is Marta's second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. She used to first to improve her business, since she was near bankruptcy. This 20,000 metical loan will be used to increase the volume of her stock. She is confident that she will pay off the loan early and request a new one to continue expanding her business and start selling wholesale.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Moriayo Remi

texts.en: Moriayo sells clothes, shoes and underwear. She has been in this business for the past 6 years and she is very happy with the growing nature of her business. Moriayo is 39 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She needs the loan of N 80,000 to purchase more clothes, shoes and underwear to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, shoes and underwear to sell

loans.name: Mafalda

texts.pt:
Mafalda N. nasceu em Gaza tem 43 anos de idade vive maritalmente é mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 13 aos 25 anos de idade todos vão a escola somente a filha do meio é que já esta empregada na educação.

Mafalda sai de Gaza para o Município da vila de Namaacha na fronteira de Suazilândia ainda criança com seu pai este que era trabalhador das águas da Namaacha (MONTEMOR), este que vem perder a vida durante o horário de trabalho. Sendo assim a empresa cede trabalho para um dos seus filhos, sendo a mais velha teve a oportunidade de trabalhar para ajudar no sustento da família. Hoje e funcionaria permanente a mais de 24 anos trabalhando em turnos das 7:00 as 15:30h no período da manhã e das 15:30 as 23:0h no período da noite, auferindo mensalmente um valor de 2.129.00MT, valor este que não satisfaz as suas necessidades, pois vive numa casa de aluguer pagando mensalmente 500.00MT. Mas com ajuda do seu esposo este que trabalha como guarda fronteira, eles conseguem colectar um fundo e ambos dão inicio da obra que devido ao elevado custo do material não conseguem concluir, então o esposo teve que pedir um empréstimo de 34.000.00MT numa instituição bancaria (BIM) para dar continuidade da mesma que também não e concluída. numa conversa com seus colegas de serviço teve conhecimento dos nossos serviços e aproxima pedindo um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT para concluir as mínimas partes e de seguida mudar se para sua própria casa, para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza não responsabiliza se por ninguém. Tem um grande sonho de se casar oficialmente e ser 

Este e o primeiro empréstimo de Mafalda na Hluvuku e Kiva, estes 10.000.00MT serão usados para comprar aros da porta e janelas e as suas respectivas fechaduras, esta muito feliz, pois dentro em breve vai viver na sua própria casa. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para os preparativos do seu futuro casamento.
texts.en:
Mafalda N. was born in Gaza. She is 43 years old and lives with her common-law husband. She has five children between the ages of 13 and 25. They are all in school except the middle daughter, who is already employed in education. Mafalda and her father left Gaza for the town of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland while she was still a child. Her father worked at the Montemor mineral water company, and died on the job. The company then hired one of his children, and since she was the eldest she had the opportunity to work to help support her family. Today she has been an employee there for 24 years, alternating between a day shift from 7 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. and a night shift from 3:30 p.m. to 11:00 p.m. She earns 2129 meticals a month, not enough to cover her basic expenses, since she lives in a rental house that costs 500 meticals a month. But with the help of her husband, who works as a border guard, they manage to scrape by. Because of the high cost of construction materials they have not been able to finish building their house. Her husband had to apply for a 34,000-metical loan from a bank (BIM) to continue the work, and it still remains unfinished. She learned about our services in a conversation with coworkers, and came to us to request a loan of 10,000 meticals to finish part of the house and be able to move into their own home. Apart from her children, she is not financially responsible for anybody else. She has big dreams of getting married officially and being This is Mafalda's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. She will use these 10,000 meticals to buy door frames and windows and their respective locks. She's very happy, since soon she will be living in her own home. She's confident that she will pay off the loan early and request another one to pay for preparations for her future wedding.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his shop with merchandise

loans.name: António Samuel

texts.pt:
Antonio Samuel B. nasceu em Impaputo uma localidade que dista 25 km da vila do Município da Vila Namaacha na fronteira da Suazilandia, vive maritalmente é pai de uma filha de 2 aninhos que vivem com ele em sua casa.
António estudou ate somente a 4ª classe teve que parar com os estudos devido à guerra que se fazia sentir naquela região, então começa a trabalhar em casa do seu tio durante 5 anos e teve que abandonar o emprego devido ao seu estado de saúde não o permitia fazer trabalhos muito pasados.com o fundo ganho durante os anos de trabalho com seu tio ele consegue comprar uma geleira e inicia com a venda produtos congelados tais como (gelo, frangos, peixe e mais diversos), mas sua geleira avaria e de seguida ele emigra para a áfrica do sul na tentativa de arranjar um bom emprego e comprar uma nova geleira. Três meses depois regressa a casa quando recebe a informação de que seu filho mais velho perdeu a vida e resolve então ficar perto da família. Mas como o fundo que ele trazia não era suficiente para dar inicio de um bom negócio ele aproxima se a Hluvuku solicitando um credito de 7.000.00MT valor este que pagou sem nenhum problema, hoje e proprietário de uma barraca em impaputo tem viajado 2 vezes por mês gastando 7.000.00MT em todas as viajem e lucrado 4.000.00MT mensalmente. Para alem da sua filha responsabiliza se pela sua mãe que vive com ele em sua própria casa

Este e o segundo empréstimo de Antonio na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva, os primeiros 7.000.00MT foram usados para comprar produtos para dar inicio do seu negócio, e estes 15.000.00MT serao usados para aumentar o volume dos seus produtos. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para fortificar mais ainda o seu negocio.
texts.en:
António Samuel B. was born in Impaputo, a community 25 km from the town of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland. His partner and two-year-old daughter live with him in his house. António only attended school through the fourth grade and had to leave school because of the war that rocked the region. He worked in his uncle's house for five years but had to leave that job because of his poor health, which prevented him from doing heavy labor. With the money he had earned while working with his uncle, he purchased a freezer and started selling frozen products such as ice, chicken, and fish. When his freezer broke, he emigrated to South Africa in an attempt to find a good job and buy a new freezer. He returned home three months later when he learned that his eldest son had died, and decided to stay close to his family. But the money he had brought back wasn't enough to start a good business. He approached Hluvuku requesting a loan of 7000 meticals, which he paid off without any problems. Today he owns a shop in Impaputo and travels twice a month, spending 7000 meticals on each trip and making a profit of 4000 meticals a month. In addition to his daughter, he takes care of his mother, who lives with him in his house. This is António's second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first 7000 meticals were used to buy products to start his business, and these 15,000 meticals will be used to increase his stock of products. He's confident he will repay the loan early and request a new one in order to continue to expand his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Ghaleb

texts.en: Ghaleb is 44 years old and married with three sons. Ghaleb has been running a store where he sells different kinds of goods such as perfumes, cosmetics, deodorants, and other items.  He is an expert vendor and often recommends specific products to his many customers.  Ghaleb requests a loan of 2,000 USD to purchase merchandise and build his new inventory.  He appreciates your help.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and build his new inventory

loans.name: Adewumi

texts.en:
Adewumi is a hair stylist and also sells hair extensions. She learned her business within two years and she has been in the business for the past five years.

Adewumi is 35 years of age and she has three children. She is requesting the loan of N70,000 to purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream

loans.name: Consider Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Consider group. They are (left-to-right) Hawa K., Hassan D. and Mariama S.. They are all residents of Waterloo Small Town, twenty-two miles from Freetown.

This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. These entrepreneurs sell market food but their businesses have been developing at a very low pace due to the lack of capital. With SMT opening a new branch in Waterloo in partnership with Shine on Sierra Leone, they have come to solicit a loan of Le 1,500,000 in order to help improve their businesses and living standards

Mariama S. is the leader of this group. She is age thirty-one and was born in Feredugu, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a mechanic and they have one child who is in class I. Mariama sells rice and has been in this business for more than eight years now. With this loan, she will be able to purchase at least four bags of rice.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks of cloth in bulk

loans.name: Elisabete Jacinto

texts.pt:
Elisabete jacinto N. tem 38 anos nasceu em Inhambane, vive maritalmente e mãe de 4 filhos uma recém nascida de apenas 1 mês de vida e os três mais velhos estes que se encontram a estudar na Escola Primária.
Elisabete sai de Inhmbane a Namaacha uma vila na Fronteira da Swazilândia devido à guerra que se fazia sentir naquela região com seu tio. Após sua chagada ela continua com os estudos e consegue fazer a 10ª classe. Anos depois consegue arranjar um emprego na  OTM(organização dos trabalhadores de moçambique) como servente onde trabalhou durante dois anos, auferia por mês 150mt salario  que não satisfazia as necessidades da casa pois ela já vivia sozinha numa casa de aluguer, aranja um novo emprego no Centro de Formacao de Professores primarios da Namaacha (CFPPN) actual Instituto de Formacao de Professores primarios da Namaacha(IFPPN) onde encontra se a trabalhar ate entao,das 6:30h as 14;30h auferindo um valor de 1.800.00mt mensalmente.junta se com seu marido este que e trabalhador da Educaçao e beneficiam se assim de terrenos que eram distribuidos naquela repartiçao de ensino.mas como nao tinham fundo para iniciar com a sua obra aproxima se a Hluvuku solicitando um emprestimo para dar inicio da sua obra esta que não foi concluida devido ao elevado custo do material,mas graças a hluvuku e kiva ela solicita um outro emprestimo para dar continuidade da mesma obra. Para elem dos seus filhos elisabete responsabiliza se pela sua mae que vive em Inhambane enviando lhe um valor mensal de 1.000.00mt por mês.

Este e o terceiro emprestimo de elisabete na hluvuku e segundo com kiva, este terceiro emprestimo de 25.000.00mt seram usados para dar continuidade da sua obra esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo determinado e pedir um novo emprestimo para fazer manuntençao de energia e pintura.
texts.en:
Elisabete Jacinto N. is 38 years old and was born in Inhambane, lives with his wife and they have 4 children, a new born baby girl who is one month old and the oldest ones are in primary school. Elisabete left with her uncle from Inhmbane to Namaacha a village at the frontier with Swazilandia because of the intensity of war there. After they arrived he is able to finish 10th garde. Years later she was able to get a job with OTM (Mozambique Workers Organization) as a servant where she worked for 2 years, her monthly salary was 150MT which didn't satisfy her necessities at home as she was living alone and paying her rent. She found a job with the Center of Education for Teachers of Primary School (CFPPN), where she works from 6:30am to 2:30pm with a salary of 1.800MT a month. Her husband works in education too and was able to benefit from the distribution of land but they don't have money to start building, this is why they came to Hluvuku to request a loan to start the construction that stopped because of the high cost of construction materials, thanks to Hluvuku and Kiva she wants to use the loan to continue with the construction. Besides her two children, Elisabete supports her mom who lives in Inhambane, she sends her 1,000MT a month. This is her third loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva, this third loan for 25,000MT will be used to continue building her house. She is confident she will pay on time and will request another loan for energy and paint for the house

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel N. is a 31-year-old married man, blessed with two children. He is a charcoal wholesaler. His business is located in the Zambezi shopping centre in Muguga and his customers buy from him either wholesale or retail. He has been in this business for the past year and he makes a profit of Kshs. 30,000 per month. His dream is to establish a bigger store that will be able to handle more stock in his charcoal business.

A need to expand Daniel's business has come about and, after asking around, his brother introduced him to KADET where he can access a loan.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To restock a charcoal business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cultivation of maize

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Maria M. nasceu em inhambane, tem 56 anos de idade não teve a oportunidade de ir à escola devido à falta de condições dos seus progenitores. E casada e mãe de 8 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 25 aos 45 anos de idade todos eles são casados

Maria sai de inhambane a namacha uma vila na fronteira da swazilandia com seu esposo este que era policia civil e afectuo em macuacua uma localidade do distrito que dista 
7km da vila. Maria inicia seu proprio negocio de criaçao de galinhas do mato pois na zona onde ela vivia era muito adequada para pratica dessa actividade e revendia os na vila. Com o fundo colectado e com ajuda do seu esposa ela consegue comprar um carro que lhes permitiu mais ainda expandir o seu negocio, para alem de frangos passa tambem a vender carvao na capital. Mas devido a guerra maria perde todos seus bens e muda se para vila onde continua com a sua actividade.numa conversa que teve com seu filho que e nosso cliente ela aproxima se e solicita um emprestimo para recomeçar com o seu negocio de frangos. Hoje ela agradece muito a hluvuku e kiva por lhe terem financiado o valor, tem conprado no maximo 5x100 caixas de pintos gastando 28.000.00mt revendendo cada a 100.00mt, tem ganho um lucro no valor de 8.000.00mt consegue poupar por mês 2.000.00mt porque tem de pagar dispesas dos seus netos 
que encontram se a estudar.

Este e o terceiro emprestimo de maria na hluvuku e segundo com kiva. Estes 20.000.00mt seram usados para aumentar o volume do seu negocio. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar cem nenhum problema e pedir um novo emprestimo pois para alem dos seus negocios conta com ajuda do seu marido.
texts.en:
Maria M. was born in Inhambane, she is 56 years old and didn't have the opportunity to study due to her parents lack of resources. She is married and has 8 children between the ages of 25 and 45, all of them married. Maria left Inhambane for Naamacha, a neighboring village on the boarder of Swaziland, with her husband who was a police officer in Macuacua, a town 7km from the village. Maria started her own business raising guinea fowls and selling them at the village. She was able to buy a car with the funds she raised and the help of her husband. Having a vehicle to work with, allowed them to expand their business and start selling charcoal in the capital city of Maputo. But, due to the war, Maria lost all her assets and moved back to her village, where she continued her business, with difficulty. After having a conversation with her son who was already a member, she requested a loan to rebuild her business selling chickens. She is very grateful to Hluvuku and Kiva for having provided her with the amount she requested. She was able to buy 5x100 crates of chicks at 28.000,00MT and resell each bird at 100,00MT, having a profit of 8.000,00MT. She is able to save 2.000,00MT a month because she has to support her grandchildren who are attending school. This is Maria's third loan with Hluvuku and her second loan with Kiva. The 20.000,00MT that she is requesting will be used to grow her businesses. She is confident that she'll be able to pay her loan back without any problems and later on request a new loan, because besides having her business she can also count on her husband's help.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her poultry business

loans.name: Omolabake

texts.en: Omolabake sells hair extensions and she is also a stylist. She is 46 years old and married with four children. Omolabake lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in business for the past 23 years. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years. She has been faithful to LAPO in her repayments. Omolabake is hoping for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: processing and selling palm oil

loans.name: Lorta Uaquene

texts.pt:
Lorta Uaquene N. nasceu em inhambane tem 56 anos de idade e solteira mãe de 4 filhos dos quais três já falecidos. actualmente vive com seu filho mais novo já casado e com seus 3 netos estes que vão a escola.

Lorta inicia os seus estudos muito tarde devido à falta de condições, pois seu pai a abandonou ainda criança deixando a com sua mãe esta que era uma simples camponesa alegando que ele ia trabalhar na vizinha áfrica do sul, não tendo voltado ate entao.com15 anos lorta inicia seus estudos fazendo assim a 2 classe do antigo sistema e esta fica grávida e abandona os estudos, pois tinha que cuidar dos seus 3 filhos estes que perdem a vida no tempo da guerra. Lorta fica muito desesperada apos a morte dos seus filhos, e a sua irmã convida lhe para morar com ela em namaacha uma vila na fronteira da suazilandia, apos sua chegada começa a trabalhar como empregada domestica durante 5 anos.com o fundo colectado ela inicia o seu próprio negocio e constrói a sua própria casa com o rendimento ganho nos negócios, mas devido aos preparativos do casamento do seu filho ela fica na beira da falência e pede empréstimo a hluvuku no valor de 8.000.00MT para reforçar o seu negocio valor este que foi pago com muito sucesso. Estes 10.000.00MT serão usados para aumentar o volume do seu stock tem viajado 1 vez em cada semana, pois ela tem vendido 2 vezes por semana quartas e sábados onde no mercado informal shoprite onde há intercambio de produtos vindo de paises fora tem de lucro 5.000.00MT. responsabiliza se pela sua mãe esta que vive com ela em sua casa e consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00MT 

Este e o segundo empréstimo de lorta na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. os primeiros 8.000.00.MT foram usados para reforçar os seus negócios, e  Estes 10.000.00MT serão usados para aumentar o volume do seu stock. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir a casa do seu único filho.
texts.en:
Lorta Uaquene N. was born in Inhambane, is 56 years old, and has mothered four children, three of whom have passed away. Now she lives with her youngest child, who is married, and her three grandchildren, who all go to school.

Lorta began her school studies very late, due to a lack of means. Her father abandoned her when she was an infant, leaving her with her mother, a simple farmer. He said that he was going to work in neighboring South Africa and has never returned to this day. At age 15 Lorta began her studies and made it through second grade in the old educational system. Then she became pregnant and stopped her studies, having to take care of her three children, who later lost their lives in wartime. Lorta was quite hopeless after the death of her children, and was invited to live with her sister invited in Namaacha, a village on the border of Swaziland. After she arrived there, Lorta worked as a domestic worker for five years. With the money she saved, she began her own business. She built her own house with the earnings from her business. But the expenses for her child's wedding left her almost bankrupt, and she requested a loan from Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner) for 8,000 meticais (MT) to bolster the value of her business. She very successfully repaid the loan. This current loan of 10,000 MT will be used to increase the volume of stock for her business, for which she travels once a week. She sells twice a week, on Wednesdays and Saturdays, at the informal market, Shoprite, where there is an exchange of products coming from other countries and she makes a profit of 5,000 MT. Lorta takes care of her mother, who lives with her in her house, and also is able to save 1,000 MT per month.

This is Lorta's second loan from Hluvuku and the first with Kiva. The first 8,000 MT were used to strengthen her business, and these 10,000 MT will be used to increase the volume of her inventory. She is confident that she will repay the loan early and will ask for another loan to finish the house of her only child.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cultivating maize and manioc

loans.name: Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Esmeralda” esta representado por la señora Andrea y conformado por 12 miembros dentro D. los cuales se encuentra un parentesco familiar entre la señora Nicolasa y su hija la señora Maribel, ambas cuentan con ingresos totalmente independientes por lo que no representa un riego para el grupo. Una mayoría D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. productos como la comida, refrescos, ropa, cosméticos y confección D. prendas D. vestir. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es bastante alta pero la dedicación y las ganas D. trabajar son las que prevalecen ante la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la  adquisición D. mercadería, insumos, materiales y para la ampliación D. sus puestos D. venta que les permitirá generar un  mejor ingreso para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En general los miembros del grupo cuenta con experiencia gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo así como la responsabilidad y compromiso que se requiere para recibir un apoyo económico para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Esmeralda" is represented by Mrs. Andrea, and comprised of 12 members including Mrs. Nicolasa and her daughter Maribel, who have small businesses with individuals incomes. The majority of the group members have businesses including cosmetic sales, food sales, clothing sales. The business competition in the commercial atmosphere is quite high, but the dedication and drive to work help these women exceed the competition. The final destination of this financing is for the acquisition of merchandise for the new season, and to improve and expand their sales stands. This will allow them to proviD. their families with a higher standard of living. In general, all of the group members have experience, thanks to previous financing from similar organizations like Agrocapital Foundation, who know about the responsibility and compromise required to receive economic support for businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Albarka Group

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim Sorie K., Kadiatu K. and Isatu S.. Ibrahim, in the middle, is the leader of this group. Ibrahim owns a pharmacy and has been in the medicine business for many years. He will use this loan to buy more drugs to add to his pharmacy. Ibrahim is now 35 years of age. He was born in the Port Loko district of northern Sierra Leone.
