He is married to a businesswoman and the couple have two children. One of their children is now in class five and the other is in class one.

This group is named Albarka, a Temne word for "Thank You". The members are entrepreneurs based in Waterloo, a small town, 22 miles from Freetown city. Business has been growing at a very slow pace for these people due to lack of capital. SMT, in partnership with Shine on Sierra Leone, is opening a new branch in Waterloo. They have come seeking a loan of Le 500,000 each, to help them improve on their businesses.

loans.use: To invest in a pharmacy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing cocoyams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing manioc and making manioc flour

loans.name: Chapaquitas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Chapaquitas” esta representado por la señora Mirian Janeth y conformado por 12 miembros, una mayoría D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. productos como la comida, cosméticos, edredones, combustible y al transporte público D. pasajeros. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es bastante alta pero la dedicación y las ganas D. trabajar son las que prevalecen ante la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la  adquisición D. mercadería, insumos, materiales y para la ampliación D. sus puestos D. venta que les permitirá generar un  mejor ingreso para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En general los miembros del grupo cuenta con experiencia gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo así como la responsabilidad y compromiso que se requiere para recibir un apoyo económico para sus negocios.Debido a que alginas socias no pueden dejar sus puestos D. trabajo sus esposos son los que se reunen en el gruposon los casos D. la señora Deysy y la selñora Noemi.
texts.en:
The “Chapaquitas” group is represented by Mirian Janeth and has 12 members. Most of the members are vendors of a variety of products such as food, cosmetics, bedspreads, and fuel, while others proviD. public transportation of passengers. The level of competition in the commercial environment that they work in is quite high, but their dedication and willingness to work helps them to succeed against the competition. The purpose of the financing is for the purchase of merchandise, ingredients and raw materials, and for enlarging their sales stalls, which will allow them to generate more income and improve their families' standard of living. Overall the members of the group have acquired experience thanks to loans from other entities similar to Agrocapital, which is why they are familiar with the financing system and the responsibility and commitment required in order to obtain economic support for their businesses. Because some of the members cannot leave their businesses unattended, their husbands are the ones who meet with the group. That is the case for Deysy and Noemi.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow maize and manioc

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.pt:
José Daniel E. tem 30 anos nasceu em homoine um distrito da província de inhambane, vive maritalmente e pai de duas filhas a primeira com 7anos e a segunda com 3anos de idade só a mais velha é que se encontra a estudar.
Jose mudou se para Namaacha uma vila na fronteira com Swazilândia a procura de emprego na companhia da sua tia que já vivia naquele distrito. apos sua chegada não consegue ingressar na escola devido a falta de documentos então começa a trabalhar num estabelecimento onde auferia um valor mensal de 500.00MT e não conseguia satisfazer as suas necessidades pois já havia se juntado com a sua esposa. Anos depois resolve iniciar o seu próprio negocio com o valor que havia colectado nos seus 3 anos de trabalho, começa a vender bolos e recargas de tele moveis na fronteira, trabalhando das 7h às 20h quando a fronteira fecha as portas. Hoje Daniel graças à hluvuku e kiva tem sua própria casa onde vive com a sua família tem como melhor produto recargas que compra por 15,00MT, 45.00MT, 74.00mt e 90.00mt e vende por 20.00mt, 50.00mt, 80.00mt e 100.00mt consecutivamente viajando quatro vezes por mês, tem um rendimento mensal de 5,000. 00mtn e consegue poupar 1.000.00mtn, ajuda os seu avo que se encontra em homoine enviando-lhe uma caixa de sabão, 50kg de arroz e 25kg de açúcar em cada 6 meses que corresponde a 1,500.00mtn.

Este e segundo empréstimo de Jose na hluvuku e kiva. Os primeiros 12.000.00MT aumentaram o volume de mercadoria para satisfazer as necessidades e exigências dos clientes, e pede estes 20.000.00MT para o mesmo fim como se encontra numa zona fronteiriça solicitam muito os seus serviços. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do prazo e pedir um novo empréstimo para ampliar a sua barraca e iniciar com a obra de ampliação da sua casa.
texts.en:
Jose Daniel E. is 30 years old, he was born in Homoine a district of the province of Inhambane, he lives with his wife and has 2 daughters, the first is 7 years old and the second is 3 years old, the oldest is already studying. Jose moved to Namaacha a village at the frontier with Swazilandia looking for a job and stayed with his aunt was already living there. He couldn't enter to school because he didn't have papers so he started working at a place where he makes 500.00MT a month and that wasn't enough because he was already living with his wife. Years later he decided to start his own business with money he saved for 3 years, he started selling cakes and recharge cards for cell phones at the frontier, working from 7am to 8pm when the frontier closes its doors. Thanks to Hluvuku and Kiva now Daniel has his own house where he lives with his family, his best product are recharge cards that are sold for 15,00MT, 45.00MT, 74.00MT and 90.00MT and sell for 20.00MT, 50.00MT, 80.00MT and 100.00MT traveling 4 times a month he gets an income of 5,000.00MT and is able to profit 1,000.00MT he helps his grandmother who is still in Homoine sending her a box of soap, 50kg of rice and 25kg of sugar every 6 months, which is about 1,500.00MT. This is the second loan Jose is requesting to Hluvuku and Kiva. The first 12,000.00MT increased the volum of the merchandise to satisfy his clients' necessities, and now he is requesting 20,000.00MT is for the same because at the frontier there is great demand for his services. He is sure he will pay the loan before the deadline and request a new loan to enlarge his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the stock in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a young cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise goats

loans.name: Olajumoke

texts.en: Olajumoke sells drinks and has been in the business for the past ten years. She is 42 years old and married with three children. Olajumoke lives in Ogun State and she hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Los Cusis Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Cusis” esta representado por la señora Leticia y conformado por 14 miembros dentro D. los cuales se encuentra un parentesco familiar entre la señora Leticia y su hermana la señora Sarah Milena, ambas cuentan con ingresos totalmente independientes por lo que no representa un riego para el grupo. Una mayoría D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. productos como la comida, cosméticos, artesanías libros, ropa, llantas D. repuesto y abarrotes. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es bastante alta pero la dedicación y las ganas D. trabajar son las que prevalecen ante la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la  adquisición D. mercadería, insumos, materiales y para la ampliación D. sus puestos D. venta que les permitirá generar un  mejor ingreso para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En general los miembros del grupo cuenta con experiencia gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo así como la responsabilidad y compromiso que se requiere para recibir un apoyo económico para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Los Cusis" is represented by Mrs. Leticia and comprised of 14 members, including Leticia's sister Sarah Milena. Both have individual incomes, and as such bear no risk to the group. The majority of the group's members sell products such as food, cosmetics, handicrafts, books, clothing, and groceries. The business competition is quite high, however, the group's dedication and inspiration to work help them superseD. the competition. The group is requesting financing to buy new merchandise and materials in order to expand their sales posts and generate higher revenue, which will allow the members to improve their families' quality of life. In general, all of the group members have experience, thanks to previous financing from similar organizations like Agrocapital Foundation, who know about the responsibility and compromise required to receive economic support for businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Poderosas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Poderosas” esta representado por la señora Ana y conformado por 12 miembros dentro D. los cuales se encuentra un parentesco familiar entre la señora Ana y el señor Alberto que es su sobrino, ambos poseen ingresos totalmente independientes por lo que no representa un riego para el grupo. Una mayoría D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. productos como la comida, zapatos, ropa, cosméticos, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio y al servicio D. soldadura. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es bastante alta pero la dedicación y las ganas D. trabajar son las que prevalecen ante la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la  adquisición D. mercadería, insumos, materiales y para la ampliación D. sus puestos D. venta que les permitirá generar un  mejor ingreso para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En general los miembros del grupo cuenta con experiencia gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo así como la responsabilidad y compromiso que se requiere para recibir un apoyo económico para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Poderosas" is represented by Mrs. Ana, and comprised of 12 members including Ana's nephew Alberto. Ana and Albert, like the other group members, have small businesses with individuals incomes. The majority of the group members have businesses that incluD. cosmetic sales, food sales, groceries, shoes and clothing sales, and a soldering service. The business competition in the commercial atmosphere is quite high, but the dedication and drive to work help these women exceed the competition. The final destination of this financing is for the acquisition of merchandise for the new season, and to improve and expand their sales stands. This will allow them to proviD. their families with a higher standard of living. In general, all of the group members have experience, thanks to previous financing from similar organizations like Agrocapital Foundation, who know about the responsibility and compromise required to receive economic support for businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is 36 years old and married with two children. She sells juice, drinks and pepper soup in her restaurant. She has been in this business for the past two years. Kehinde has numerous customers patronizing her restaurant because she has good customer relations and she knows how to prepare pepper soup very well. She lives in Ogun state and she is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more juice, drinks and pepper soup items to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Joaquim Xavier

texts.pt:
Joaquim Xavier J. nasceu em Inhambane tem 30 anos de idade vive maritalmente e estudou ate a 10ª classe é pai de 3 filhos, a mais velha de 11 anos a penúltima de 5 anos e a mais nova de apenas 3mêses de idade. Somente as duas mais velhas e que vão à escola.

J. sai de Inhambane para Município da vila de Namaacha na fronteira da suazilândia com sua irmã quando concluiu a 8ª classe, pois onde ele estudava só tinha aquele nível de ensino. chegado a Namaacha continua com os seus estudos tendo conseguido a vaga de noite.No período de manhã a irmã arranja lhe um emprego na mata num contrato que era renovável de 3 em 3 meses durante 2 anos. Anos depois candidata-se voluntariamente como membro  numa organização denominada (OJM) Organização da Juventude Moçambicana e é afecto como assistente de departamento de administração e finanças ate então. E trabalhador a mais de 5 anos auferindo mensalmente um valor de 3.300.00MT trabalhando das 7h às 17h e nos sábados das 5h às 18h caso houver visita dos chefes do aparelho do estado com um subsidio de 1.500.00MT valor este que não satisfaz as suas necessidades e então aproxima se a hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo para dar inicio da sua obra e pede este de 12.000.00MT para o mesmo fim. Consegue por mês poupar 500.00MT, pois vive numa casa de aluguer onde paga em cada mês um valor de 800.00MT.

Este e o terceiro empréstimo de J. na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. Estes 12.000.00MT serão usados para comprar material de construção para fazer a cobertura da sua casa, esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e provavelmente nos final deste ano ira morar em sua própria casa.
texts.en:
Joaquim Xavier Joao was born in Inhambane, he is 30 years old, studied until the 10th grade and lives with his wife and 3 sons the oldest is 11 years old, the next is 5 years old and the youngest is 3 months old. The two oldest go to school. Joaquim left Inhambane and went to the municipality of Vila de Namaacha at the frontier with Suazilandia to live with his sister when he finished the 8th grade, because where he was living they didn't have the next level. When he arrived to Namaacha he continued with his studies during the night. During the morning his sister got him a job in the jungle with a renewable contract every 3 months for 2 years. Years later he was a volunteer member of the organization called (OJM) Organization of Mozambique Youth and was entrusted as assistant of the administration and finances department. Since then he has been working for the past 5 years earning a monthly salary of 3,300.00MT working from 7am to 5pm and Saturdays from 5am to 6pm when there are visits from the chiefs of the state department, he receives a subside of 1,500.00MT but it doesn't fulfill his necessities so he came to Hluvuku to request a loan to start building his house and receives 12,000,00MT. He is able to save 500.00MT a month because he rents the place where he lives at 800.00MT monthly. This is the third loan Joaquim is requesting to Hluvuku and first with Kiva. The 12,000MT will be used to buy material for construction to build the ceiling of his house, he is confident he will pay before the due date and probably by the end of the year he will be living in his own house.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Celina

texts.pt:
Celina C. nasceu em Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de Suazilandia e viúva é mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 20 aos 35 anos de idade. Todos estão empregados no trabalho.

Inicia os seus estudos muito tarde devido à falta de transporte, pois ela nasceu numa localidade (Mandevo) que dista 10 km da vila do Município de Namaacha. Com 12 anos passa a viver em casa da sua tia e consegue iniciar com seus estudos, quando freqüentava a 3ª classe esta fica grávida e perde a sua vaga, no mesmo ano junta se com seu esposo este que era guarda fronteira, anos depois este perde a vida e Celina fica desesperada. Consequentemente ela ganha uma indimnizaçao proveniente do serviço do seu falecido marido e inicia seu próprio negócio de venda de roupas, calções e almofadas adquiridas na áfrica do sul gastando em todas as viajem um valor de 10.000.00MT e revendidas na cidade capital maputo, tendo de lucro um valor mensal de 5.000.00MT, pois seus clientes têm pagado em dois prestações cada peça que forem a levar. tem contribuído para colocar o produto mais perto  do consumidor reduzindo desta forma os custos de deslocação,e aliviar algumas despesas familiares. Para alem dos seus netos responsabiliza se pelos seus bisnetos que vivem com ela em sua casa.

Este e o terceiro empréstimo de Celina na Hluvuku e Primeiro com kiva. Estes 15.000.00MT serão usados para aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria e satisfazer mais ainda a necessidade do cliente a tempo. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para construir um salão de beleza e boutique, tornar se numa grande comerciante e criar postos de trabalho para os outros.
texts.en:
Celina C. was born in Namaacha a village at the frontier with Suazilandia, she is a widow and has 5 children who are between 20 and 35 years old. They are all working. She started her studies very late because of the lack of transportation, she was born at Mandevo which is 10km from the municipality of Namaachaa. When she was 12 she went to live to her aunt's house and was able to start studying. When she was on the 3rd grade she got pregnant and lost her school vacancy, the same year she started living with her husband who was a guard at the frontier, years later he lost his life and Celina ended up desperate. She received an indemnity from his husband's service and started her own business selling clothes, underwear and pillows she gets from South Africa, she spends on each trip 10,000.00MT and sells them in the city of Maputo, obtaining a monthly profit of 5,000.00MT, because her clients pay her in two parts any piece they buy, this has facilitated product placement closer to the consumer reducing this way the costs and helping with her family expenses. This is why two of her grandchildren take care of her great grandchildren who live with her at home. This is the third loan of Celina with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva. These 15,000MT will be use to increase the volume of her merchandise and satisfy the necessities of her clients on time. She is sure she will pay the loan before the time established and will request a new loan to build a beauty parlor and boutique, she wants to turn into a great business person and create employment for others.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks in her businesss

loans.name: Luisa Alexandre

texts.pt:
Luisa Alexandre M. nasceu em namaacha uma vila no município de namaacha, e divorciada mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 9 aos 27 anos de idade os três mais novos e que vão à escola.

Apos a morte do seu pai Luisa teve que parar de estudar e dar espaço aos irmãos mais novos, um ano depôs com ajuda do seu tio consegue ingressar num curso de formação de professores onde conhece seu marido. E afeta para trabalhar numa das escolas do mesmo distrito como professora de português, seu marido abandona a e junta se com outra esposa Mas a sua vida econômica não lhe causou muitos problemas porque ele enviava mensalmente uma sexta básica que durava um mês dando assistência aos filhos, Luisa trabalha das 6h às 12h como professora no período da manha auferindo um valor de 2.977.00MT e no período da tarde como auxiliar do partido FRELIMO auferindo um valor de 3.010.00MT. Não consegue poupar nenhum valor porque alem dos seus filhos Luisa responsabiliza se pela sua mãe enviando por mês um valor de 500.00MT e encontra se a construir a sua casa fazendo manutenção das portas que por ventura já se encontram desgastadas devido às chuvas freqüentes que caíram há meses atrás.

Este e o terceiro empréstimo de Luisa na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva estes 15.000.00MT serão para cobrir a sua varanda e renovação das portas. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para fazer manutenção de pintura.
texts.en:
Luisa Alexandre M. was born in Namaacha. She is divorced and has 5 children between the ages of 9 and 27. The three youngest are still in school. After her father's death, Luisa had to leave school and make room for younger siblings. A year later, with her uncle's help she was admitted to a teacher training program, where she met her husband. She works in the local schools as a Portuguese teacher. Her husband left her and remarried, but she didn't have economic difficulties because he sent her some money every month to help with the children. Luisa works from 6 a.m. to noon as a teacher, earning 2977 meticals a month, and in the afternoons as a an aide for the FRELIMO party, where she earns 3010 meticals a month. She is unable to save any money because in addition to her children, Luisa also takes care of her mother, sending her 500 meticals a month. She needs to make repairs on her house, since the doors were badly damaged by the constant rain that fell a few months back. This is Luisa's third loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. She will use the 15,000 meticals to pay for the veranda and repairing the doors. She is confident that she will pay off her loan early and request a new one so she can repaint the house.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
M. Nguyễn Thị (646991190) is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has two adult children.

M. owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling rice products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 1999, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

M. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 10th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 60 years old and married with six children. She sells drinks and frozen foods like fish, beef and turkey. Esther hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase frozen foods and drinks to sell

loans.name: Hồ Thị

texts.en:
L. Hồ Thị (1315040378) is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has four school-aged children.

L. owns and operates a service-based business, primarily providing cargo transportation services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.


In 2007, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

L. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve her business. The loan will be her 5th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve her business

loans.name: Adebola

texts.en: Adebola sells frozen foods and other foodstuffs. She has been in this business for the past seven years and she has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years. She is 37 years old and married with three children. Adebola lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs and frozen food to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget sells foodstuffs and frozen food like chicken, fish and turkey. She travels to the Republic of Benin to purchase her goods twice a week by bus.

Bridget is 33 years old and married with two children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan of N70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and frozen food like chicken, fish and turkey to sell. She thanks you, a Kiva lender.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị owns and operates a business selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. She is a 46 year-old woman, married and has five school-age children. They are living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. H. has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2001, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase products to sell. H. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her seventh loan from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

No. 1321020573.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a home product business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (1319020500) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has three infant children.

H. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2001, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Mafalda

texts.pt:
Mafalda N. nasceu em Gaza tem 43 anos de idade vive maritalmente é mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 13 aos 25 anos de idade todos vão a escola somente a filha do meio é que já esta empregada na educação.

Mafalda sai de Gaza para o Município da vila de Namaacha na fronteira de Suazilândia ainda criança com seu pai este que era trabalhador das águas da Namaacha (MONTEMOR), este que vem perder a vida durante o horário de trabalho. Sendo assim a empresa cede trabalho para um dos seus filhos, sendo a mais velha teve a oportunidade de trabalhar para ajudar no sustento da família. Hoje e funcionaria permanente a mais de 24 anos trabalhando em turnos das 07h00min as 15h30minh no período da manhã e das 15h30min as 23:0h no período da noite, auferindo mensalmente um valor de 2.129.00MT, valor este que não satisfaz as suas necessidades, pois vive numa casa de aluguer pagando mensalmente 500.00MT. Mas com ajuda do seu esposo este que trabalha como guarda fronteira, eles conseguem colectar um fundo e ambos dão inicio da obra que devido ao elevado custo do material não conseguem concluir, então o esposo teve que pedir um empréstimo de 34.000.00MT numa instituição bancaria (BIM) para dar continuidade da mesma que também não e concluída. numa conversa com seus colegas de serviço teve conhecimento dos nossos serviços e aproxima pedindo um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT para concluir as mínimas partes e de seguida mudar se para sua própria casa, para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza não responsabiliza se por ninguém. Tem 

Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Mafalda na Hluvuku e Kiva, estes 10.000.00MT serão usados para comprar aros da porta e janelas e as suas respectivas fechaduras, esta muito feliz, pois dentro em breve vai viver na sua própria casa. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para os preparativos do seu futuro casamento
texts.en:
Mafalda N. was born in Gaza. She is 43 years old and lives with her common-law husband. She has five children between the ages of 13 and 25. They are all in school except the middle daughter, who is already employed in education. Mafalda and her father left Gaza for the town of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland while she was still a child. Her father worked at the Montemor mineral water company, and died on the job. The company then hired one of his children, and since she was the eldest she had the opportunity to work to help support her family. Today she has been an employee there for 24 years, alternating between a day shift from 7 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. and a night shift from 3:30 p.m. to 11:00 p.m. She earns 2129 meticals a month, not enough to cover her basic expenses, since she lives in a rental house that costs 500 meticals a month. But with the help of her husband, who works as a border guard, they manage to scrape by. Because of the high cost of construction materials they have not been able to finish building their house. Her husband had to apply for a 34,000-metical loan from a bank (BIM) to continue the work, and it still remains unfinished. She learned about our services in a conversation with coworkers, and came to us to request a loan of 10,000 meticals to finish part of the house and be able to move into their own home. Apart from her children, she is not financially responsible for anybody else. She has big dreams of getting married officially and being This is Mafalda's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. She will use these 10,000 meticals to buy door frames and windows and their respective locks. She's very happy, since soon she will be living in her own home. She's confident that she will pay off the loan early and request another one to pay for preparations for her future wedding.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy constructions materials

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (130320063) is a 63-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has six adult children.

H. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2001, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị (1303020065) is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has four adult children.

L. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2001, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell.

L. is now requesting a new loan of 13,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị S. (1303031067), a 56-year-old married mother of five adult-aged children, lives in the town of Hưng Nguyên where she owns and operates a business raising water buffalo for sale. Mrs. S. has been engaged in this activity for over 20 years, earning approximately 2000000 VND a month.

In 2002, Mrs. S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund that was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future, she is now requesting a new loan of 11000000 VND to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be Mrs. S.'s sixth from TYM Fund, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị S. (130302096), a 54-year-old married mother of four adult-aged children, lives in the town of Hưng Nguyên where she raises cows for sale.  Engaged in this business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 3000000 VND a month.

In 2002, Mrs. S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Having fully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund that was used to purchase breeding livestock, she is now requesting a new loan of 12000000 VND to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  This will be her sixth loan from TYM Fund, and Mrs. S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị (638990340) is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has four school-aged children.

V. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising chickens for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over thirteen years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 1999, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

V. is now requesting a new loan of 11,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase chicks to raise and sell. The loan will be her 10th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (1319020491) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has two school-aged children.

H. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month.

In 2001, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
T. Hoàng Thị (1304020082) is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, T. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising water buffalo for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (about $170 US) a month from these activities.

In 2001, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. T. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. The loan will be the seventh she has taken out from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business

Mỹ owns and operates a manufacturing business, manufacturing and selling iron products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month.

In 2004, Mỹ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

Mỹ is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of income for Clarita T.’s family. Through their farm, she is hoping that her youngest child, unlike her other children, will finish college. Though sometimes the family struggles to manage the farm because of the calamities and pests that hit their palay, those problems do not keep them from continuing their farming.

In order to improve her family's chances of a good harvest, Clarita is applying for a loan from Kiva in the amount of PHP12,000 for them to maintain their farm. With the loan they can buy fertilizers and pesticides that they can use in maintaining their palay.

“I know that, with the assistance from Kiva lenders and with our perseverance, we are able to achieve our dreams,” Clarita shares.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her rice farm

texts.en:
Lerma P. and her family live in the village of Rang-Ay at the mountainous municipality of San Agustin, Isabela. She is married to Elendrie and blessed with four children.

In order to support her family, Lerma raises hogs. Wanting to sustain the business, she is asking for support form Kiva. Knowing that Kiva lenders have soft heart for the needy, she decided to request a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos that she will use to purchase one piglet as well as feeds for her hogs. She is hoping that her request will be granted.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Being fond of gardening, Lucena S. ventures in a vegetable-garden business. According to her, aside from gardening, she also dreams of having a vegetable-vending stall in their village, thus she is requesting PHP 5,000 from Kiva for her to start her store. She is very optimistic that, through the loan, she can start another business for the welfare of her family.

Lucena is a woman with strong determination to face all the challenges in life. Aside from being a business-minded person, Lucena is truly a faithful and loving wife to her husband, Ofelio. They are able to nurture their six children, three of whom are already married. On the other hand, another two were forced to quit schooling because of poverty. Thus their youngest child is the only one attending school.

loans.use: To use to start her new store
